loans.name: Epouses Des Enseignants N°5" Gie Yokouté 2" Group

texts.fr:
Le GIE Epouses des enseignants n°5, « GIE Yokouté 2»  rassemble des enseignantes et/ou des épouses d’enseignants qui s’activent dans le commerce. Elles se sont regroupées en réseaux pour solidariser mais aussi pour pouvoir bénéficier de financements plus facilement. Elles viennent pour la première fois à l’IMCEC pour solliciter un crédit.
Daba est la présidente du groupe. Elle fait du commerce depuis plus de 15 ans, et s’active particulièrement dans la vente de produits halieutiques, poisson fumé et séché et autres fruits de mer. Elle a trouvé une clientèle fidèle à Dakar à qui elle livre régulièrement son produit. Daba donne sa participation dans les dépenses de la maison et l’accompagnement scolaire de ses enfants.
Elle veut un jour, diversifier son activité et vendre dans l’avenir des denrées alimentaires et aller jusqu’à ouvrir une épicerie.
texts.en:
The "GIE Yokouté 2" Epouses des Enseignants [Teachers' Wives] Group of 5 brings together teachers and/or the wives of teachers who are in business. They form networks to support one another but also to be able to more easily access funding. This group is seeking a loan from UIMCEC for the first time.

Daba is the group's leader. She has been in business for more than 15 years, and takes particular interest in selling fishing equipment, smoked fish, dried fish, and other seafood. She has found a loyal group of customers in Dakar to whom she regularly delivers her products. Daba puts her profits toward the household expenses and her children's school fees. One day, Daba would like to diversify her business and in the future sell foodstuffs or even open a grocer's shop.

loans.use: To purchase fishing equipment, smoked fish, and dried fish to sell.

loans.name: Anonymous Group
loans.use: to pay for timber,labor and other materials to use in his construction contracts

loans.name: Aminna

texts.en:
Aminna is 50 years old. She is married with eight children aged between 9 and 25 years. 3 of them go to school. She is a farmer and has been growing rice for the past 27 years. Also her husband is a farmer. With the loan from Kiva, he would like to buy more fertilizers to grow rice for sell. The profits from the business will be used to buy a piece of land and to improve her family's welfare.

The agriculture sector accounts for 37% of Rwanda's gross domestic product, generates 65% of Rwanda's export revenue, and employs approximately 90% of Rwandans (as of 2009). Despite the importance of agriculture to Rwandans and their economy, financial institutions view lending to fund agricultural activities as a high-risk proposition because the profitability of these activities is affected by weather, natural disasters, and price fluctuations. For this reason, farmers in Rwanda remain under served by financial institutions. Urwego Opportunity Bank is expanding into this market and is happy to provide Kiva lenders with the opportunity to support Rwandan farmers.

loans.use: to buy more fertilizers to grow rice to sell.

loans.name: Amina

texts.fr: Amina est âgée de 38 ans et mariée. Amina vit avec ses quatre enfants dans le quartier d'Adidogomé. Amina vend des produits d’alimentations générales. Amina veut ajouter un stock de détergents à ses marchandises pour ainsi diversifier son activité. Amina achète ses provisions trois fois par mois au marché. Pour commander des cartons de détergents, Amina nécessite ce fonds pour financer son approvisionnement et réaliser une bonne marge bénéficiaire
texts.en:
Amina is 38 years old and married and lives with her four children in the Adidogomé neighbourhood. She sells general foodstuffs and would like to add a stock of detergents to her products to diversify her activity.  

Amina buys her provisions from the market three times a month.  To order the boxes of detergent, she needs the funds to finance her supply and to obtain a good profit margin.

loans.use: to buy 24 boxes of detergent.

loans.name: Doreen

texts.en: Doreen is a hard working, active and confident woman of Nyakakaoni,Nyakayojo village, Mbarara district. She is aged 65 and and is divorced.  Doreen has a wholesale business as well as agriculture. From this business she earns about UGX 1,500,000. With this she maintains her family through buying food, paying rent and purchase of stock. Doreen wants to expand her business but she says finance is a problem, therefore she is requesting a loan of UGX 4,000,000 to add stock. This loan will help her increase her working capital in order to serve more customers efficiently. With the additional income from growing her business she would like to work on her farm and buy more cows for fattening. She appreciates the Kiva lenders for the financial support. Pictured is Doreen and the UGAFODE Credit officer.

loans.use: To buy soda and sugar in bulk

loans.name: Tuzamurane Group

texts.en: TUZAMURANE is a group led by Agatha, who is 39 years old. The group name means “Support each other” in English. She has been a group leader for six years. She has a shop and has been doing this business for six years. The group members sell different items and they have the same  ideas for changing their lives. With the loan, she would like to buy more soap, sugar, salt and cooking oil for sell. The profits from the business will be used to pay school fees for her children and improve her standard of living.

loans.use: To buy more soap, sugar, salt and cooking oil to sell.

loans.name: Viateur

texts.en:
Viateur is aged 29 years. He is married with three children aged between 2 and 9 years. 2 of them go to school. He is a farmer and he has been growing maize for the past 9 years. His wife is a businesswoman. With the loan from Kiva, he would like to pay workers who harvested his maize. The profits from the business will be used to pay school fees for his children.

The agriculture sector accounts for 37% of Rwanda's gross domestic product, generates 65% of Rwanda's export revenue, and employs approximately 90% of Rwandans (as of 2009). Despite the importance of agriculture to Rwandans and their economy, financial institutions view lending to fund agricultural activities as a high-risk proposition because the profitability of these activities is affected by weather, natural disasters, and price fluctuations. For this reason, farmers in Rwanda remain underserved by financial institutions. Urwego Opportunity Bank is expanding into this market and is happy to provide Kiva lenders with the opportunity to support Rwandan farmers.

loans.use: to pay workers for harvesting maize.

loans.name: Yèrèdèmè Group

texts.fr:
La dame par devant est Hawa  qui tient en main le mouton sur la photo.
Hawa est une dame âgée de 32 ans, mariée et  mère de 4 enfants 02 de ses enfants fréquentent l’école ; ses enfants sont entre 10 et 2 ans ; elle-même non scolarisée, et habite dans  un village au Mali, son mari est cultivateur.
Comme la majorité des femmes du village, Hawa  fait l’embouche  des moutons et  travaille les champs d’arachide et de sésame pendant l’hivernage  pour subvenir aux besoins de leur  famille.
Elle achète des béliers, les engraisse et les revend sur place aux commerçants de bétail de la zone.
Hawa rêve du bien –être et l’avenir de ses enfants  et espère qu’avec le soutien du RMCR elle aura la solution.
Le fonds qu’elle  a reçu de l’institution sert  à l’achat de béliers pour l’embouche.
Elle fait un intérêt de 30000fcfa par tête ; elle aide son mari avec ses profits dans la prise en charge des dépenses quotidienne de la famille.
Elle pratique cette activité depuis 8 ans et trouve que l’embouche est facile à mener par une femme dans sa  localité.
Les animaux sont nourris par le son des mils, les feuilles d’arachide, haricot et de quelques  arbres.
Souvent les épidémies menacent les animaux ceux qui sont des  obstacles  dans ce métier.
texts.en:
Hawa, age 32, is married with four children ages 2 to 10, two of them in school. Hawa herself never received any schooling. She lives in a village of Mali and her husband is a farmer. She is the member seen with a sheep at the front in the group photo. 

Like most women in her village, Hawa fattens sheep and spends the rainy season working in the groundnut and sesame fields to help support her family. 
She buys rams that she fattens and sells to livestock merchants of the area. 

Hawa’s long-term goals are to ensure her children’s well-being and provide for their future, and she hopes that her partnership with RMCR will be the answer. 

The loan she obtained from RMCR will be used to buy rams to fatten. She will earn a profit of 30,000fcfa per head. This will help her to support her husband in managing their family’s day-to-day expenses.

Hawa has been doing this for 8 years. She feels that this is an easy activity for a woman from her area. The animals are fed millet bran as well as leaves from groundnuts, beans and certain trees. 

One of the obstacles she faces in this line of work is the epidemics that often threaten the animals.

loans.use: to buy rams to fatten and sell.

loans.name: John

texts.en:
John is 47 years old. He is married and blessed with 5 children, of ages between 20 and 7 years, whom he supports. 

John runs a green grocery business which has lasted for 7 years now.

He is taking a second loan with VisionFund Kenya which he will be using to purchase stock of groceries like tomatoes, sukuma wiki (kale), potatoes, cabbages and carrots.

His hopes and dreams for the future is to expand his business and educate his children.

loans.use: to purchase stock of groceries like tomatoes, sukuma wiki (kale), potatoes, cabbages and carrots

loans.name: Eunice

texts.en:
Eunice is 55 years old and widowed. She has seven children between the ages of 12 and 29. For the last five years, she has been running a retail shop where she sells assorted food items. She earns a monthly income of 8,000 KES.
	 
Eunice has applied for her third loan of 15,000 KES from VisionFund Kenya and intends to use the loan to pay school fees. Eunice will use the anticipated profits to increase her retail inventory.

Her hopes and dreams for the future is to open a wholesale store to increase the variety of goods.

loans.use: to pay school fees

loans.name: Elizabeth

texts.en:
Elizabeth is forty-two years old. She is married and they have three children. 
Elizabeth is a tailor as well as retailer,businesses she has done for eight years earning a monthly income of KES 8,000.

This is her first loan with VisionFund Kenya which she will use to purchase stock like paraffin, sugar, rice etc as stock for her general store. 

With the anticipated profits, Elizabeth will be able to pay school fees for their children. In future she desires to be financially stable family.

loans.use: to purchase stock like paraffin, sugar, rice etc as stock for her general store

loans.name: George

texts.en:
George is a 39-year-old man who is married and taking care of one child. George has been selling household goods for a period of 5 years, earning himself an income of KES 10,000 at the end of every month.

George is requesting his first loan of KES 20,000 with which he intends to purchase kitchen utensils, water buckets, and plastic basins to sell to his customers on a daily basis. He plans to use the anticipated income to buy a plot of land, and he hopes to have a bright future with a lot of success.

loans.use: to purchase kitchen utensils, water buckets, and plastic basins

loans.name: Demtila

texts.en:
Demtila is 61 years old. She is married and blessed with six children of ages between 30 and 15 years respectively of whom she supports. 

She does quarry mining for the last seven years now. She has applied for another loan from VisionFund Kenya which she will use  to purchase quarry tools, hire more employees to work on the mine as well as cover transport expenses accrued. 

With the generated income, Demtila will be able to start another business. 

Her hopes and dreams for the future are to expand her business and be successful.

loans.use: to purchase quarry tools, hire more employees to work on the mine as well as cover transport expenses accrued

loans.name: Meruzhan

texts.en:
Meruzhan is a farmer in the frontier village of Gandzakar of the Tavush region. He was born here, and like his family's previous generations, Meruzhan also with his family members surely decided to develop the farm that his father established. Now the care of it is Meruzhan’s duty. 

In the farm, Meruzhan has pigs, chickens and beehives. His farm products Meruzhan sells with the help of his wife and retired mother. From the farm, they sell pork and eggs. The honey that they sell each season is very popular, and for it, they have a lot of loyal customers. Meruzhan’s wife works at the bread factory as a baker, but she manages to help her husband about the farm also. Their single son is already grown up, and he is employed already, but that does not mean that he has no time for any function on the farm; he greatly helps his parents. 

Meruzhan hopes that Kiva lenders will help him with this loan to develop swine breeding, to buy several piglets and also fodder for his farm cattle. His thanks and regards to all the Kiva lenders.

loans.use: to develop swine breeding, to buy several piglets and also fodder for his farm cattle

loans.name: Norah

texts.en:
Norah, 25, is a charismatic, active and helpful woman. Being a loving mother is the principal motive for her to struggle tirelessly day after day seeking alternatives in order to make a living and bring sustenance to her family.  She hails from Ikonge, a remote village in the Nyamira area of Kenya. This area has harsh weather conditions and to survive, you must have tough skin. Norah has defied all the odds and has been engaged in farming for the past five years. Her primary sources of income are crops and animal farming. Norah passionately loves farming. She is contented with the farming way of life. Norah is a very enterprising woman, and although she never had formal employment, she has always worked hard on her farm and she has always assured her parents of a decent meal. The Nyamira area has favorable conditions for horticulture farming, and that is why she is seeking a loan to buy seedlings for fruits and vegetables to start horticulture farming. Because of good roads, a good climate, and a good transportation network, she is sure that she will reap maximum profits and be able to increase her business. 

Being a woman and accessing funds in Africa is very challenging, but Norah feels relieved knowing there are institutions such as Kiva that help enterprising women like her. Norah is very disciplined with finances and she plans that through the accumulated profits, she will be able to improve her living conditions and secure the future of her children to come.

loans.use: To buy seedlings for fruits and vegetables to start horticulture farming

loans.name: Grace

texts.en:
In 1985, Grace ventured into farming as a way of life so that she could be able to produce food for her family. Thirty years down the line, Grace is deep into commercial dairy and horticultural farming. Her primary income sources are milk, eggs, and vegetables. The money she makes from her various investments have helped elevate the quality of life led by her nine children who are in school. 

Grace is seeking a loan to expand her horticultural farm. The crops she grows on her farm are insufficient to fulfill the demand. However, to grow more crops, she needs more income. Caught up in this situation, Grace will find your loan very handy. With KES 30,000 she is also going to pay for the resources necessary to expand her horticulture production. She has made a commitment to herself that the money she will make from this investment will go to loan repayment and her children's education. The money will also offset some of the farm expenses. She is certain that your lending will have a very big impact on her life.

loans.use: To expand her horticulture farming

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To buy a dairy goat

loans.name: Ani

texts.en:
Ani is a nice farmer and mother of two sons (her younger son is in the photo). 

Ani lives with her grandparents-in-law, husband and two sons. With the help of her family members, she takes care of their family farm. It includes livestock of cows, calves, sheep and chickens, and also arable land where barley, potato and emmer wheat are cultivated. 

They reestablished their farm five years ago, and since that time, they were able to develop it into a sustainable and profitable farm. All Ani needs is some financial resources to purchase forage for feeding the livestock and a hand mower needed for the farm.

Because this is her first loan, it has been approved within the framework of the new joint initiative between Kiva and SEF. The first-chance loan program provides loans to people who didn’t have access to credit products before because they have no credit history.

Ani and her family members hope for lenders' support for their farming business.

loans.use: to pay for forage for feeding the livestock and a hand mower needed for the farm

loans.name: Rose

texts.en:
Hello lenders! Meet Rose, 53 years of age and a very hardworking and self-driven farmer who is based in Kapsumai, a remote village in Kapsowar. This region has harsh weather patterns, and poultry farming is the only profitable business venture that thrives.

Rose is happily married and blessed with a beautiful family. For the past 15 years, she has been involved in mixed farming, and her primary sources of income have been selling milk and crop farming. She passionately loves poultry farming. When asked what is most enjoyable about farming, her reply was “selling eggs”. Her biggest challenge is the lack of funds to increase her poultry farming.

She is seeking a loan to buy additional poultry. Poultry farming is the only business that thrives in the Kapsowar area because of the harsh weather patterns, so she wants to take full advantage of the poultry business.

Rose is a member of Sinon Digital Self-help Group and through the group, she has received training on financial management and saving. Through the loan, she will sell eggs to the local market and to her neighbors, hence improving her living conditions and getting out of the poverty situation she is in currently. Profits from the loan will be used in repaying back the loan and increasing her business.

loans.use: to buy additional poultry.

loans.name: Annah

texts.en:
Annah is a wife, mother, and farmer with 22 years’ experience in mixed farming. She lives in Nyamira, Kenya with her four children on a small piece of land that she inherited from her parents. Annah completed primary school thanks to the financial support and effort of her parents. She has the spirit to succeed in life and sells milk, eggs, and a variety of crops to the local market and neighbors. She passionately loves poultry farming and as she likes to say “poultry is close to my heart”. 

Although this humble and ever smiling mother makes a profit selling poultry, she lacks the funds to buy good quality breeds of poultry and expand her farm. She requests a loan to buy poultry. She has identified good breeds of poultry that will increase productivity and produce quality meat. Annah has enough feed to give the poultry energy and green grams (beans) to give the poultry protein. This will assure increased productivity. 

She chose to join Juhudi Kilimo so that she can have access to quality loans at an affordable interest rate. This loan will be a turning point in Annah’s life since she will improve her living standards and secure the future of her children.

loans.use: to buy poultry.

loans.name: Komlan

texts.fr: Komlan est un homme marié qui est âgé de 40 ans. Komlan vit à Apédokoè avec six personnes à sa charge. Pour contribuer aux besoins quotidiens de sa famille, Komlan répare et vend de l’huile à moteur au bord de la route afin d’avoir la rentabilité nécessaire. Komlan s’approvisionne auprès de ses fournisseurs quatre fois par mois. Pour commander des bidons d’huile à moteur, Komlan sollicite ce crédit pour financer son achat et disposer d’une bonne marge bénéficiaire pour favoriser l’éducation de ses enfants
texts.en:
Komlan is a 40-year-old married man, who lives in Apedokoe with six dependents.

To contribute towards his family's daily needs, Komlan makes repairs and sells motor oil along the road in order to ensure sufficient profits. He resupplies four times a month.

Komlan is requesting this loan to finance the purchase of motor oil containers, so he can achieve a good profit margin and ensure his children's education.

loans.use: buy two containers of motor oil

loans.name: Anonymous Group
loans.use: To buy groceries to resell

loans.name: Edmond

texts.en:
Edmond is a 62-year-old second-time borrower of UGAFODE applying for a loan of ugx.5,000,000 Ugandan shillings (UGX). He is a married man with six children that he takes care of with the help of his wife. He is a resident of Makenke, a small village, where he operates a poultry and dairy farming business.

Edmond wants the loan to stock poultry feed, since he has just brought in 2,000 layer chicks and 3,000 broiler chicks, and to renovate an aging poultry structure. He is undoubtedly sure of market so he will repay his loan with ease.

Edmond is so thankful for the support the funders hand out to borrowers as they struggle to beat the structural rigidities of the economy. His future plan is to start exporting poultry products to other growing countries.

NB
Please note that Bombo Road is the institution's branch location and in any way has no connection with the client's residence or business. Thank you.

loans.use: To buy poultry feed

loans.name: Kitintake-Mukisa Group

texts.en:
Sylivia is a group member of Kitintale-Mukisa Group. She is a 32-year-old resident of Kitintale who has applied for a loan of UGX 500,000 through the group. She is married and has three children who are eight, six, and three years old. She has three dependents staying with her. 

Her business sells charcoal and groceries on a small scale. She operates the business to earn income which supports her family's needs and demands. The client has plans to grow the business to a bigger level and to acquire more goods for easy expansion. Her challenges include the high tax levied on charcoal for government revenue and stiff competition in the area.

The group is appreciative of Kiva's support towards their businesses.

loans.use: To buy groceries

loans.name: Sumomei Group

texts.en:
These members are part of the group called Sumomei and are beginning their fourth loan cycle with ID-Ghana. The group is made up of nine members and led by Faustina, who is the leader of the group. The members of the group run a variety of businesses, including corn dough, general goods, fish, assorted soap, sewing accessories, second-hand clothing, makeup products, tea and cutlery. 

The loan that they will take out will benefit small micro businesses like Faustina's. She states that she joined ID-Ghana five years ago at the invitation of a friend who is a member of the institution. Currently, her business is the sale of tea. She explains that she learned this business previously because it was a family business. She is 35 years old and married with two school-going children. 

The loan that she will take now is to increase her capital for the purchase of Milo, milk, sugar, eggs and noodles to prepare tea and sell to customers. She will acquire the items from the market to sell. This way of working allows her to generate resources to support her family. When asked what she likes about ID-Ghana, she responded that she likes the institution's health-related offerings.

They will hold each other responsible for the repayment of the total loan amount of GHS 7,200.

loans.use: to purchase Milo, milk, sugar, eggs and noodles to prepare tea and sell to customers.

loans.name: Josephat's Group

texts.en:
Josephat is a 45-year-old proud father of 10 children. He is a group leader, often described as a very experienced farmer, and is representing his group of 13 farmers in Webuye District. Since joining One Acre Fund in 2012, Josephat has noticed that he has had a healthier life due to better nutrition.

Josephat described his harvest as good last year, but believes he can have a better one this year by continuing to work with One Acre Fund. He is very excited to also be purchasing a solar light, apart from fertilizer and maize, because he will now be able to reduce the consumption of paraffin fuel and therefore, save more money. With the profits from this season’s harvest, he plans to send his children to school.

With this loan, Josephat’s Group will be able to plant a total of 9.75 acres of land and purchase a total of eight solar lights.

loans.use: to purchase a solar light and gain access to cost efficient hybrid seeds and fertilizer for maize cultivation.

loans.name: Isaac

texts.en:
Isaac is 29 years old and from Kisumu. He is single and supports four people in his family.

Isaac operates an electronic shop that he has been operating for the past five years.  It generates a monthly income of KES 30,000.

He has applied for his first loan with VISIONFUND KENYA, which he will use to restock his electronic shop with new improved appliances and other home items.  He will use the anticipated profit to grow his business.

His dream is to have a big business and support his family.

loans.use: to buy appliances and other items for his shop

loans.name: Naiyan

texts.en:
Naiyan is 35 years old and married. She has four children, aged 14, 11, 8 and 6 years, whom she supports. Naiyan runs a retail shop which has lasted for 10 years now. 

She is taking her third loan to purchase stock like clothes to sell to her customers. She will use the anticipated profit to expand her business. Her hopes and dreams for her business are to open another business.

loans.use: to purchase clothes to sell to her customers.

loans.name: Zedekia

texts.en:
Zedekia is a 25-year-old man from the town of Kakamega, which is found in Western province in the western part of Kenya. He is married and supports two people in his family.

Zedekia has a retail shop, which has been operating for the last two years, and generates a monthly income of 12,000 KES. He has applied for his second loan with VISION FUND KENYA LTD, which he will use to purchase maize flour, and any other shop items, in bulk.  He will use the anticipated profit to grow his business, so as to be able to provide for his family's needs.

His dream is to have a big business and support his family.

loans.use: to purchase maize flour, and other items for his shop, in bulk

loans.name: Mary Nyambura

texts.en:
The person on the photograph is Mary. She is married and blessed with two children, and she joined Hand in Hand Eastern Africa so as to get knowledge and also borrow for and improve her business.

Mary practices dairy farming, and she is borrowing a Kiva loan so as to buy a calf in order to add to her livestock business, and hence, improve her level of income.

Mary is grateful to Kiva and her lenders.

loans.use: to buy a calf for her livestock business, and hence, improve her level of income.

loans.name: Dorice

texts.en:
Dorice is a 35-year-old mother from Kisumu. She is a widow and supports four people in her family: her four children who are 14, 11, 9 and 1 year old, respectively.

Dorice has a tailoring stall which has been operating for the last eight years, generating a monthly income of KES 30,000.

She is taking her first loan with VisionFund Kenya, which she will use to purchase clothing materials. She will use the anticipated profits to expand her current business.

Her dream is expand her business and educate her children for life.

loans.use: to purchase clothing materials

loans.name: Marah

texts.en:
Marah is 19 years old, and she is studying for a degree in network and security engineering. She lives in Irbid with her family of four people.  She is working really hard to get ahead and to grow. 

Marah dreams of having a good job so she can help to pay for her daily expenses and help her family in household expense. 

She has requested a loan to pay for her educational expenses so she can continue her education, and achieve her dreams of being a successful engineer.

loans.use: to pay for her educational expenses

loans.name: Peter

texts.en:
The person appearing in the photo is Peter. He is married, and blessed with one child. He joined Hand in Hand Eastern Africa (HiH EA) in May 2014.

Peter is a mixed farmer. He is grateful to HiH EA for developing his entrepreneurial spirit through training and mentorship. He is borrowing through Kiva to buy fertilizers and seeds that will help improve his crop yield. He hopes to get more profits to enable him to provide for his family's needs, such as education and food.

Peter is grateful to Kiva and their lenders for their support. He promises to repay the loan promptly.

loans.use: To buy fertilizer and seeds that will help improve crop yield.

loans.name: Grace

texts.en:
The person in the photograph is Grace, a member of the Kapkatet Burgei group. She is 53 years old, married and has six children.

Grace has a profitable farming business. She joined Hand in Hand Eastern Africa in 2014, and she has benefited from training in savings mobilization, enterprise and financial management. 

She is borrowing a loan to buy fertilizers and quality hybrid seeds to improve the yields in her farming enterprise. She hopes this will increase her income, and she will be able to provide for the family needs.

Grace is  grateful to Kiva and promises to repay the loan promptly.

loans.use: to buy fertilizer and hybrid seeds that will help boost farming.

loans.name: Kapkatet Burgei Group

texts.en:
The person raising her hand in the photo is Joy, a member of Kapkatet Burgei group. She is thirty years old, and a mother of two. Her economic activity is her shop. 

Joy is grateful for the Hand in Hand Eastern Africa training that has enabled her to manage her business through savings, enterprise development, and financial training.
 
She is borrowing from Kiva to boost her shop business, by bringing in more stock. Joy believes this will boost her business, and enable her to  increase her income. She will therefore be able to support her family with ease.

Joy is grateful to Kiva and their lenders, and promises to repay her loan promptly

loans.use: To stock more food in her shop. This will help improve her sales volume.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy more paints to decorate his house

loans.name: Evaline

texts.en:
Evaline is 47 years old and married. She has four children whom she supports. 

Evaline has run a posho mills for eleven year s now. She is taking her second  loan to purchase stock like maize to mill for her customers.

She will use the anticipated  profit to expand her business. Her hope and dream for her business and children is to open another business.

loans.use: to purchase more dry maize to mill for her customers.

loans.name: Tamara

texts.en:
Tamara is a 21-year-old university student majoring in sociology, now in her third year. Her father is retired from the army. 

Tamara is aiming to get her Bachelor's degree so that she can continue her studies and register for the Master's program. Because she doesn't have enough money to pay for her upcoming semester fees, she has applied for this education loan.

loans.use: to pay for her upcoming semester fees

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To buy a dairy cow to supply more milk for more income.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To buy more bales of used clothing for resale

loans.name: Alice

texts.en:
The person in the photograph is Alice.  She is a widow, 52 years old and living with three of her children.  She joined Hand in Hand Eastern Africa to get knowledge and to borrow and improve her business. Her economic activity is poultry farming and she is borrowing a Kiva loan to buy poultry feed, which will boost her eggs and poultry production and therefore increase stock levels and income level.

She is grateful to Kiva and her lenders for the financial support.

loans.use: To buy poultry feed, which will boost her eggs and poultry production and therefore increase stock levels and income levels.

loans.name: Rose

texts.en:
Micro finance institutions (MFI) view lending to fund agricultural activities as a high-risk proposition. Juhudi Kilimo is expanding into this market and is happy to provide Kiva lenders with the opportunity to support Kenyan farmers. Meet Rose, an ever-smiling, hardworking and honest mother who is 43 years of age. She hails from the Chuka area of Kenya. She is the proud mother of three lovely children. She loves and treasures her children and will go the extra mile to make sure that they are comfortable. 

Rose's primary source of income has come from selling milk, crop farming, and poultry farming. Through these ventures she has been able to earn a decent income. She is a very determined and dedicated farmer who has been farming for 25 years. During this time, she has never regretted going into farming. Although this humble mum has been making profits, not everything has been “a bed of roses." She faces financial challenges, and because the Chuka area has proven a ready market for cereals, she is kindly seeking a loan to buy cereals for re-sale in order to improve her income. 

Rose's upbringing was challenging, and she has faced many economic problems. Still, this ever-smiling mum has been making great improvements, and she believes that through your loan she will be able to realize her goal of improving her living conditions and transforming her life. Through Juhudi Kilimo, Rose has received training, and she has proven to be honest and disciplined with finances. She intends to fully repay the loan with the profits from her business. Rose is quite visionary and, with her accumulated profits, hopes she will be able to open a large cereal-selling shop that will boost her income and turn her life around.

loans.use: To buy cereals

loans.name: Flora

texts.en:
Flora is married and she has two kids.  Flora has her own house. Flora is a cook and she makes many kind of dishes with fish. She sells the food in one corner of her house. 

Flora's husband is a mason and he works at many places at El Alto.  Flora needs a loan to buy more fish, corn, and other kinds of food to prepare her dishes. She would like to have her own restaurant in the future.

loans.use: to buy more fish, corn, and other kinds of food to prepare her dishes

loans.name: Peres

texts.en:
Peres is a 27 years old mother from Kisumu. She is married to John who is a farmer and supports the family. They have been blessed with three children who are 11, 7 and 4 years old respectively.

Peres has a green grocery stall which she has been operating for the last four years and generates a monthly income of KES 200,000. She has applied for the first loan with VisionFund Kenya, which she will use to purchase green groceries, and she will use the anticipated profit to increase her stock.

Her dream is to run a wholesale business and build a nice home for her family.

loans.use: to add stock of green groceries

loans.name: Mustafa

texts.en:
Mustafa is an ambitious 22-year-old young man living with his family that consists of five members in Irbid. He is a university student majoring in tourism management, and he is in the middle of his journey. He is working as a delivery man for one of the restaurants.

Mustafa is seeking to work in his field after getting his bachelors’ degree. Now he is applying for this loan to be able to pay for his upcoming semester fees which he couldn’t pay because of the financial crisis he and his family have been facing.

loans.use: to pay for his upcoming semester fees

loans.name: Lucy

texts.en:
Hello! Meet Lucy, 34 years of age, a very hardworking, honest and dedicated farmer who lives in Michai, a remote village in Kitale. She is happily married and is blessed with adorable children. 

She has been practicing mixed farming for the last eleven years and has gained a great deal of experience. To afford a decent and comfortable life for her children, she has been selling milk, eggs, and varieties of food crops from her farmland. To make ends meet and make extra cash, she has been engaging in another small personal business. 

The Kitale area is very populated, and the demand for poultry products and eggs is very high. Like many farmers from her region, she finds poultry farming very enjoyable, and she stated that the most enjoyable part about poultry farming is “the increased profits I enjoy.” Her biggest challenge, however, is meeting the demand that is really high. She lacks funds to increase her poultry farming, and she is seeking a loan of 65,000 KES (Kenyan shillings) to buy poultry. 

Being a woman seeking to access funds is very challenging, but through institutions such as Juhudi Kilimo via Kiva, she feels relieved knowing that her dream will be achieved and that she will be able to buy more poultry. As a result of the loan, she will sell more eggs and poultry products to her neighbors and to the local market, and this will translate to an increased profit margin and an improved income level. 

Being a visionary woman, she intends to accumulate more profits and expand her poultry market to other markets; this will increase her income and improve her living conditions. The extra income she will get will be used to fully repay the loan, permanently change her living conditions, and secure the future of her school-going children.

loans.use: To buy poultry

loans.name: Mariam

texts.en: Mariam is 45 years old, divorced and the village of Chinti. She takes care of her daughter on her own. In the region there is a high unemployment rate, but self-employment helps inhabitants to make a living.  So, she started a clothing trading business locally, for satisfying even her basic needs. She goes to Turkey and purchases clothing at wholesale prices. The job is hard for Mariam, but she is urged to make some income to solve her financial difficulties. Now Mariam requested financial support for making an additional source of income. All the financial institutions rejected her loan requests because of her unstable financial conditions.  After several unsuccessful attempts, Mariam applied for credit to MFO Credo. Her request was approved in the framework of the Start Up program, which is a joint initiative with Kiva, permitting the poor people to start or re-start businesses. Mariam will renovate the house with the requested amount and make a family hotel. She will rent the house and will generate more income. The loan will greatly assist Mariam and her daughter, enabling them to make better living conditions and tackle their financial difficulties.

loans.use: To renovate her house and make a family hotel

loans.name: Etienne

texts.en:
Etienne is 32 years old. He is a farmer and he has been growing maize for 15 years. 

With the loan from Kiva, he would like to pay workers who harvested maize. The profits from the business will be used to improve his standards of living.

loans.use: To pay workers who harvested maize.

loans.name: Mary Wanjiku

texts.en:
The lady in the photo is called Mary. She is 41 years old and married with two children.

She practices mixed farming, practicing poultry, dairy and vegetable farming and she is borrowing a Kiva loan to buy poultry and dairy feeds, which will increase her milk and eggs production and her income.

She is grateful to Kiva and her lenders.

loans.use: To buy dairy and poultry feed, which will increase her milk and eggs production and her income.

loans.name: Rose

texts.en:
Rose is 47 years old  and is married with three children. She also supports seven members in her family. She sells secondhand clothes, a business she has been doing for the last six years, and generates a monthly income of KES 7,000.

She is taking her second loan with VisionFund Kenya, which she will use to purchase more stock of secondhand clothes such as shirts, t-shirts, skirts, and trousers, as well as shoes. She will use the anticipated profit to buy more varieties of clothes for sell.

Her future hopes and dreams are to expand her clothing business and have a better living standard.

loans.use: To add more stock of clothes to sell and make more income

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to purchase more items such as sardines, milk, etc.

loans.name: Mohamed

texts.en:
This is 43-year-old Mohamed.  He is married and has no child.   

In 2004, Mohamed established his tailoring business. He began his business because he was trained by his parents to be self-employed. Working six days a week and twelve hours a day, he earns about SLL 1,000,000 every month from this business. 

He would like a loan in the amount of SLL 5,000,000 to buy more materials like cottons and plain material for resale.  He hopes that this loan will enable him to increase his monthly profits by approximately SLL 906,640. 

In the future, Mohamed plans to build a dwelling home and a plot of land at Devil Hole. His major challenge is the high rate of competition and he is hard working. He thanks you for your support.

loans.use: To buy more materials for resale

loans.name: Mary Ann

texts.en:
Her name is Mary Ann, 29, a resident of Coron, Palawan, Philippines. She has a life partner named Jerich, a construction worker by which she has two children, who are not of school age yet. She manages her household while operating the business. She works hard to augment their income to support and meet their daily personal, household needs.

Mary Ann operates a variety store. In the Philippines, a general store is basically a small convenience store which sells fresh, dry, and packaged commodities directly to consumers. Almost all products are essential household items and food. She earns by buying supplies at wholesale prices and selling at retail prices. Her regular customers are her neighbors and the local community. She earns a minimum net income of Php 600 a day. 

To help her continue operations of her general store she is requesting a Php 10000 loan which she will use to buy grocery items such canned goods, instant noodles, biscuits, fruit juice and bananas. She is positive that it will boost her income as she expands her business. She is thanking God and you in advance for the financial help that will be given her for it will surely cover their everyday needs.

Mary Ann hopes to maintain and grow her business. She strives hard to save for the education of her children and prays to get married soon and lead a happy life. She faithfully meets up with her co-fellowship* members to share stories of her work every week and where she can also draw strength and inspiration from the Word of God she studies. 

* All CCT community partners / clients are organized into fellowship groups that meet on a weekly basis. A fellowship group is composed of 15 to 30 community partners. The fellowship groups gather each week to study the Word of God, build social capital and repay Micro Finance loans.

loans.use: To pay for grocery items to sell at her store.

loans.name: Idrissa Yusuf

texts.en:
This is 43-year-old Idrissa.  He has four children aged 16,12, 8, and 4 years.   

In 2004, Idrissa established his provision/grocery business. He began his business to sustain his family and improve himself.  Working six days a week and twelve hours a day, he earns about SLL 700,000 every month from this business.  

He would like a loan in the amount of SLL 5,000,000 in order to purchase more cartons of sardines, milk, luncheon meat, Peak dried milk, etc. He hopes that this loan will enable him to increase his monthly profits by approximately SLL 850,000. 

In the future, he plans to raise more capital that will enable him to build his own dwelling home and educate his children for their future.  The major challenge is the high rate of competition.  He is hard working and wants to thank you for your support.

loans.use: To purchase more items such as sardines, milk, etc.

loans.name: Hugo Nelson

texts.es:
Hugo es un hombre inteligente y muy recursivo de 32 años de edad, que ante la falta de oportunidades para emplearse busco adecuar en un espacio afuera de su hogar un taller de monta-llantas, como se ve en la foto es todo muy rustico pero con este negocio algo improvisado ha podido generar el sustento para su familia que la conforman 3 hijos, dos hombres de 3 y 6 años de edad y una princesa de 6 años y su pareja.

Trabaja la extenuante jornada de 14 horas diarias para poder generar el dinero para su familia, su idea es generar empleo, formalizar un negocio, tener un local, sostenibilidad del negocio, diversificar su oferta hacia los clientes.

Hugo quiere solicitar un préstamo que lo tiene muy motivado, ya que será el principio de su formalización como negocio, con el crédito lo que piensa es poder realizar reformas locativas, que será la remodelación de su espacio, tendrá algo parecido a un local y todo ello para para empezar con un proyecto a largo plazo y comprar inventario que serán neumáticos y parches.
texts.en:
Hugo is an intelligent and very resourceful 32-year-old man who, lacking job opportunities, set up a place outside his home to serve as a tire repair workshop.   As seen in the photograph it is very rudimentary, but with the business he has improvised, he has been able to generate income for his family, which consists of 3 children and his partner.  Two of his children are boys, aged 3 and 6, and he also has a 6 year-old princess.

He works arduously every day for 14 hours a day to generate income for his family.  His idea is to generate employment with a formal business, having a storefront and a sustainable business where he can diversify his offerings to his customers.

Hugo is very motivated to request a loan to use to begin formalizing his business.  With the loan, he plans to remodel his business space so that he will have something that is similar to a shop.  This way he can start implementing his long-run plan.  He will also buy inventories in the form of tires and patches.

loans.use: to undertake some improvements and renovations to his business

loans.name: Nancy

texts.en:
The person appearing in the photo is Nancy. She is fifty-five years old and married with six children.

She joined Hand in Hand Eastern Africa (HiH EA)  to benefit from trainings on enterprise development and financial planning. This has helped her improve her knowledge in business management. 

In July 2014 she applied for a loan of KES 10,000 from HiH EA’s Enterprise Incubation Fund (EIF) which she has since completed repaying.  She used her first loan to invest in her enterprise of maize and beans farming by purchasing farm inputs like fertilizer and seeds. 

She is borrowing more from Kiva in order to purchase farm inputs like irrigation equipment and storage sacks. She hopes this will enable her boost her proceeds hence increase her income. She will therefore be able to improve the living standards of her family including modern housing and quality health care. 

Nancy is grateful to Kiva and their lenders and promises to repay promptly.

loans.use: To buy farm inputs like irrigation equipment and sacks that will improve farm output.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy a dairy cow so as to increase the amount of milk supply for more income.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To buy a cow to enable him add more stock into his retail business after milk sales.

loans.name: Gegham

texts.en:
Gegham is 37 years old and he lives in Sevan city of the Gegharkunik region. Gegham is married and he lives with his beautiful wife and his parents, who are already retired, and they help Gegham in farming activities. 

Gegham is the owner of a big farm where he takes care of cows, calves, a heifer, sheep, lambs and chickens. Thanks to his hardworking character, Gegham manages to arrange the sale of a great range of farm products right from his house; he sells meat, dairy products, and eggs; for these all he already has loyal customers. Gegham mentions that he really enjoys his work on his farm and he simultaneously manages to give different construction services around his city. 

This loan of 700,000 Armenian drams  Gegham will be happy to receive in order to buy a lot of animal fodder for all his farm cattle, as it too early for the pastures to be full of grass.

loans.use: to buy a lot of animal fodder for all his farm cattle, as it too early for the pastures to be full of grass

loans.name: Mohammad

texts.en:
Mohammad is 27 years old. He lives with his big family that consists of eight members in Irbid.

Mohammad is working in the army, but his dream, to get a bachelor's degree, has not been achieved. He believes in the importance of education. Because of that, he decided to complete his education and major in accounting.

Now Mohammad is facing a financial problems that prevent him from paying his university fees; therefore, he applied for an education loan to pay his semester fees.

loans.use: To pay his semester fees

loans.name: Joash's Group

texts.en:
Joash, featured in the picture above, is representing his group of ten farmers in Webuye District, Kenya. He is best known in his community for being a very hardworking individual and is very excited to be joining One Acre Fund for the first time this year.

Joash’s decision to join the program was largely due to the fact that he wanted to have access to quality training and acquire new farming methods. In addition, he was keen on purchasing a solar light that he could afford, as he says that by doing so he would be able to reduce the consumption of paraffin fuel and therefore save more money, which he is very excited about. With the profits he earns from the coming harvesting season, Joash plans to send his children to school.

Among the ten farmers in Joash’s Group, a total of 6 acres of land will be planted using the farming inputs received with this loan. The group will also receive a total of 18 solar lights.

loans.use: to purchase a solar light, as well as hybrid seeds and fertilizer to improve harvests of maize.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy more grocery products to offer to his clients.

loans.name: Sanoat

texts.ru: Саноат благодарит Вас за поддержку за первый кредит. Она была счастлива, узнав, что ее кредит одобрили, и она может получить деньги. Саноат обратилась за следующим кредитом, с надеждой, что ее во второй раз поддержат. На этот раз она обратилась, чтобы расширить ее животноводческую деятельность. Сейчас у нее 3 голов скота. На заемные деньги она планирует приобрести еще несколько голов и корма для них. Саноат мечтает стать финансово устойчивым человеком и надеется, что ее мечта осуществится.
texts.en: Sanoat thanks you for supporting her first loan. She was happy to find out that her loan was approved and that she was able to receive funds. She is looking for another loan and further support. This time she wants to expand her animal husbandry business. She currently has three head of cattle and plans to use the loan amount to purchase a few more head of cattle and feed for them. She dreams of becoming a financially independent person and hopes that her dream will come true.

loans.use: to buy cattle and cattle feed

loans.name: Stella

texts.en:
Stella is 25 years old and married to Evanson. Together they have been blessed with two children aged 5 and 2 years old. She has been a small scale farmer for the last 11 years and earns KES 10,000 per month .

Stella has applied for her first loan of KES 25,000 from VisionFund Kenya to buy a dairy cow to increase her income from the sale of milk to her clients. She plans to use the anticipated profits to educate her children and to open a general shop.

She hopes to lead in supply of goods in the area.

loans.use: To buy a dairy cow to increase her income from the sale of milk to her clients.

loans.name: Aida

texts.en:
The sunny woman in the photo is Aida. She lives with her husband in Gay village of the Armavir region. They have been running their farm for many years. In the greenhouse, Aida and her husband cultivate potatoes, cucumbers, and tomatoes. Aida's husband sells the gathered harvest in local markets, and that's how they get an income for living. 

To purchase supplies for reconstruction of the greenhouse (polyethylene cover and pipes) and potato seeds needed for the farm, Aida has applied for this loan.  As this is her first requested loan,  it has been approved within the framework of the new joint initiative between Kiva and SEF. The first-chance loan program provides loans to people who didn’t have access to credit products before because they have no credit history.

Hardworking Aida and her husband wait for lenders' support to their farm.

loans.use: to pay for supplies for reconstruction of the greenhouse (polyethylene cover and pipes) and potato seeds

loans.name: Sonia Teresita

texts.es:
Ella es Sonia es una mujer casada de 35 años de edad, inicio en el año 2010 un negocio de confección, donde se especializa en la confección de ropa interior para hombre, esta actividad es la que le ha permitido generar el sustento para sus dos hijos de 7 y 10 años de edad y con la que espera seguir llevando el pan a su mesa.

Su sueño es el de una madre responsable y se centra en poder generar recursos para pagar la educación de sus hijos, que no solo accedan a una educación sino que también tengan los materiales para formarse.

Sonia con la ayuda de un préstamo quiere cumplir con uno de sus objetivos que se trazó cuando inicio este negocio, el cual es poder tener una confección de línea propia de ropa, y con este crédito que puede ser apoyado pro ti, lo puede lograr.

Con el préstamo podrá comprar hilos, resortes, tela tanto impermeable, algodón, marquillas, etiquetas y otros productos pues se centrara mucho en la confección de ropa interior para hombre.
texts.en:
Sonia, 35, is a married woman.  In 2010, she started a sewing business where she specializes in sewing underwear for men.  This activity has permitted her to generate sustenance for her two children, 7 and 10, and with which she hopes to continue to bring bread to the table.
Her dream is one of a responsible mother and it concerns being able to generate resources to pay for the education of her children so that they not only have access to an education, but that they have the materials to take advantage of it.
With the help of the loan, Sonia wants to fulfill one of the objectives she outlined when she began this business, which is to be able to have her own line of clothing, and with this loan, which can be supported by you, she will be able to do it.
With the loan, she will be able to buy thread, elastics, impermeable cloth, cotton, stamps, labels, and other products which are crucial for the creation of underwear for men.

loans.use: to buy thread, elastics, impermeable cloth, cotton, stamps, labels, and other things.

loans.name: Las Jovenes De Exito De Panimache Group

texts.es:
Clara (es la primera del lado derecho de la fotografía) es una muchacha de apenas 20 años, es soltera vive junto a sus padres en una comunidad de Sololá.
Clara para generar sus ingresos y apoyar a sus padres con los gastos de la casa, se dedica a la elaboración de trajes típicos de su región desde hace tres años.
Ella cuenta que desde hace algún tiempo se había propuesto a mejorar sus textiles típicos, pero lamentablemente ella no contaba con suficiente dinero para comprar más materiales de mejor calidad, por lo que organizo a un grupo de personas para juntos solicitar un préstamo que lo utilizara para comprar hilos de tipo ceda, lustrina, lana, manchado.
Su gran sueño es que sus tejidos sean reconocidos en muchos lugares y que ella pueda tener una cadena de tiendas de artesanías.
texts.en:
Clara (first on the right side of the picture) is a young woman of barely 20 years of age. She is single and lives with her parents in the community of Sololá.
To generate income and help her parents with household expenses, she has been working for the last three years making traditional regional garments.
She notes that for a while now, she has set out to improve her traditional textiles, but unfortunately, she does not have enough money to purchase more materials of better quality. For this reason, she organized a group of people, to apply for a loan together, which she will use to purchase silk threads, silk cloth, wool and dyes.
Her biggest dream is that her weaving art is renowned in many places and that she can have a chain of craft shops.

loans.use: purchase silk threads, silk cloth, wool and dyes to make traditional garments.

loans.name: Tema

texts.en:
Tema is 31 years old. He is married with six children of ages between 16 and 2 years old respectively whom he supports.

He operates a boda boda motorbike which has lasted for six years now.

He will be using the loan to repair and maintain the motorbike and hopes the income generated will help him to purchase another motorbike.

His hopes and dreams for the future are to expand his business and be successful.

loans.use: to repair and maintain his motorbike.

loans.name: Stephen

texts.en:
Stephen is 54 years old. He is married with three children. He has had a farming business for 14 years. He will be using the loan to purchase farm inputs for crop production and hopes this will help him to pay school fees for his children.

His hopes and dreams for the future are to have a prosperous business and improve the living standards of his family.

loans.use: to purchase farm inputs for crop production to help him pay school fees for his children

loans.name: Zulma Del Carmen

texts.es:
Zulma una mujer veterana, toda su vida le gusto trabajar como independiente, creyó que era lo mejor para su vida y hoy lo ratifica, no puede tener grandes riquezas pero tiene su esposo, su familia y su negocio que es lo que la hace feliz.
Tiene un negocio donde oferta servicios de cibercafé, en su mismo negocio vende algunos alimentos como galletas frituras, dulces, chocolates etc.
Trabaja 12 horas en su negocio y es apoyada por una persona un lapso de tiempo de 4 horas donde ella puede descansar.
El negocio de los cibercafés se ha ido acabando poco a poco la razón es que en una ciudad como Medellín  ya es muy asequible tener acceso a internet desde tu hogar por ello para sobrevivir en este medio tienes que dar muy buenos servicios y velocidad de navegación, lo que lleva a la señora Zulma a solicitar un préstamo pensando en sobrevivir, el cual invertirá en la mejora de la velocidad de navegación y el resto será para la compra de una fotocopiadora.
texts.en:
Zulma is a woman with many years of work experience.  She has enjoyed working independently all her life.  She always believed that was best for her, and today she confirms it.  She won't become rich, but she has her husband, her family and her business, which make her happy. 
Zulma has a cyber-cafe.  She also sells some food at her business, like cookies, fried foods, sweets, chocolates etc.
Zulma works at her business twelve hours a day.  She is helped by another person for a 4-hour span of time, during which she can have her break. 
Cyber-cafes have been closing one by one because in a city like Medellín, home internet has become very accessible.  To survive in this line of work, Zulma needs to provide very good service and internet speed, which has lead her to request a loan.  She will invest the loan in improving the speed of her internet connection and the remainder will be used to purchase a photocopy machine.

loans.use: to invest in improving the speed of her internet connection, and the remainder of the loan will be used to purchase a photocopy machine.

loans.name: Laura Cristina

texts.es:
Laura es una hermosa morena de 20 años de edad, muy emprendedora y creativa y recursiva que inicio un negocio de confección directa u a terceros a principios del mes de enero del presente año, se siente muy motiva por esta oportunidad que se le presenta en sus manos, está emocionada y comprometida con sacar su negocio adelante.

Ella aprendió empíricamente de la profesión y su principal ventaja que tiene es que es la única que opera en la zona y puede tener contrato con algunas empresas por cercanía ya que se ahorrarían costos de envió.

Solicita un préstamo para la compra de las siguientes maquinas: 
•	Maquina recubridora
•	Maquina plana
•	Comprar insumos principalmente telas.
Estos insumos serán de gran utilidad puesto que su negocio tendrá los elementos básicos para dar un buen servicio, ya su objetivo es crecer para tener personas que le ayuden.
texts.en:
Laura is a beautiful 20 year old brunette, very entrepreneurial, creative, and resourceful who started a sewing business directly and to third party users. Since the beginning of January this year, she feels very motivated by this opportunity she has in her hands.  She is excited and committed to take her business ahead. She learned this profession empirically, and her main advantage is that she is the only person who runs this business in the zone, and that she can have a contract with some companies for their proximity which would save them shipping costs. She is asking for a loan to buy the following machines: 
- a coating machine
- a shallow machine
-  other inputs,  mainly fabrics. 
These inputs will be of great help given that her business will have the basic elements to provide a good service. Her goal is to grow so that she can have people to help her.

loans.use: To buy a coating machine and a shallow machine, as well as to buy inputs primarily fabrics.

loans.name: Christine

texts.fr: Christine est âgée de 38 ans et habite dans le quartier d’Agoè. Christine a quatre enfants à sa charge et s’active parfaitement pour venir en aide aux différents besoins de sa famille. Christine prépare de la pate bandée faite à base du maïs afin de vendre et avoir le bénéfice nécessaire. Christine s’approvisionne deux fois par mois auprès de ses fournisseurs. Pour avoir plus de revenus, Christine  demande ce prêt pour acheter quelque sac de maïs  destiné à la préparation et favoriser l’éducation de ses enfants.
texts.en: Christine is 38 years old and lives in the Agoè neighborhood. Christine has four children in her care and is very motivated to meet the different needs of her family. Christine makes packs of corn meal mash to sell and make the profit necessary. Christine restocks twice a month with her supplies. In order to increase revenues, Christine is requesting this loan to buy some sacks of corn for her business purposes and to support the education of her children.

loans.use: to buy some sacks of corn

loans.name: Anonymous Group
loans.use: To buy condiments

loans.name: Anonymous Group
loans.use: To buy grains

loans.name: Maria Olga

texts.es:
María Olga es una mujer de 53 años con mucho empuje y verraquera, ella es separa de su esposo con quien tuvo 2 hijos ya ellos mayores de edad, pero no espero a que la mantuvieran, que le pagaran todo, de inmediato busco alternativas para generar ingresos, y lo hizo con su negocio de confección directa, y ahora no solo se conforma con vender algunas prendas, se encuentra solicitando un crédito para la compra de una vitrina y de surtido de telas, adornos, hilos para confeccionar más prendas que ahora exhibirá en su hogar.
Tú puedes ayudar a esta mujer que busca tener un hogar propio apoyando su iniciativa y sus ganas de progresar y demostrar que está para grandes cosas.
texts.en:
María Olga is a 53-year-old woman, who is spunky and has a lot of energy. 

She separated from her husband, with whom she had two children—already of legal age. She didn't wait to have someone to provide for her and to pay for all her expenses. She immediately looked for options to generate income, and she found them in her dressmaking business. 

And now, not content with selling only a few garments, she is requesting a loan to buy a display cabinet and an assortment of fabrics, trimmings, and threads to make more clothes, which she will display at her home.

You can help this woman, whose goal is to have her own home, by supporting her initiative and her willingness to progress and show that she is capable of great things.

loans.use: to buy a display cabinet and an assortment of fabrics, trimmings, and threads to make clothes.

loans.name: Michael Steven

texts.es:
Michael un joven emprendedor de 20 años de edad, que quiere obtener tu apoyo para iniciar su vida laboral, desde joven siempre se interesó por vender y ser productivo y hoy que tiene la suficiente edad y algo de experiencia quiere apoyar en los gastos de su hogar y producir los recursos para pagar su estudio.

La razón de su préstamo no es solo poder estudiar, él vive con su madre y no quiere que se siga matando realizando labores de aseo que tanto daño le hacen a su salud debido a los químicos que maneja, por ello se propuso a impulsar su negocio para lograr su cometido.

Solicita un préstamo para crear una empresa, con el dinero comprara surtido de calzado, zapatillas y tennis, los cuales venderá ambulantemente a personas cocidas, familiares y en pueblos.

Apoya a este joven en su hermosa labor de lograr sacar a su madre de sus labores para que tenga una mejor salud y este tranquila en su hogar con un hijo que está dispuesto hacer lo que sea por ella.
texts.en:
Michael, 20, is an enterprising young man who wishes to obtain your support to be begin his working life,  Since he was young, he has always been interested in selling and being productive.  Now that he is old enough and has some experience, he wants to help out with the household expenses and generate the resources to pay for his studies.
The reason for the loan is not just to be able to study.  He lives with his mother and he doesn't want her to continue killing herself doing cleaning work which does a lot of damage to her health because of the chemicals she uses.  For this reason, he is compelled to initiate his business in order to achieve his commitment.
He is requesting a loan in order to create a company.  With the money, he will buy an assortment of shoes, sneakers, and tennis shoes which he will sell itinerantly to people he knows, family members and in towns.
Support this young man in his beautiful labor to be able to get his mother away from her work so she will have better health and be tranquil in her home with a son who is willing to do anything for her.

loans.use: to buy an assortment of shoes, sneakers and tennis shoes which he will sell itinerantly.

loans.name: Lideres De Santa Rosa Group

texts.es: El grupo “Lideres de Santa Rosa” está conformado por 12 socias solidarias y responsables. Este es el caso de Saturnina de 55 años de edad es separada con 02 hijos.  Ella  se dedica a la venta de especerías, desde hace ocho años tiene dicho negocio el cual le va bien. Su mayor deseo es de comprarse un carro para poder transportar su mercadería. El crédito que solicitó lo destinará para la compra ajos, comino, pimienta y sal .El grupo “Lideres De Santa Rosa” agradece a los inversionistas Kiva por el crédito brindado y se comprometen a seguir trabajando bien. Saturnina se encuentra sentada en la parte delantera, es la segunda del lado derecho y viste polo rosado.
texts.en:
The group "Lideres de Santa Rosa" is composed of 12 solidary and responsible members.  This is the case of Saturnina, 55, who is separated with two children.  She makes a living selling spices.  She has had this business for eight years and it goes well.  Her great wish is to buy a car to be able to transport her merchandise.  
The loan she is requesting will be used to buy garlic, cumin, pepper, and salt.  
The group "Lideres de Santa Rosa" thanks the Kiva investors for the credit offered and promises to continue working well.  
Saturnina can be found seated in front .  She is the second from the right and is wearing a pink shirt.

loans.use: to buy garlic, cumin, pepper, and salt.

loans.name: La Familia Perez Group

texts.es:
Rosa (es la señora de en medio con delantal) es una mujer de 41 años de edad, es casada tiene una linda familia de tres hijos de las edades entre dieciséis y veintiún años, viven en una comunidad de Sololá.
Rosa para poyar a su querido esposo con los gastos de la casa, desde hace ocho años se dedica a la elaboración de cintas que se utilizan como tocoyal en su comunidad, ella cuenta que gracias a esta labor ha logrado sacar adelante a su familia.
Rosa ahora a pesado en modernizar sus cintas, pero para poder hacerlo necesita de hilos de buena calidad que ahora en el mercado tienen un precio un poco elevado, por lo que dentro de sus posibilidades no se encuentra realizar esta inversión, por tal motivo  ella organizo a un grupo se señoras con el mismo objetivo para solicitar un préstamo que lo utilizara para comprar hilos de tipo ceda, lustrina, alemán, lana y mostacia que se utiliza para adornarlo.
Rosa sueña que con esta inversión lograr mejores ingresos y apoyar a su esposos para terminar la construcción de su casa
texts.en:
Rosa (the woman in the center of the above photo who is wearing an apron) is a 41-year old woman. She is married and has a beautiful family with three children between the ages of sixteen and twenty-one. They live in the Sololá community.

For the last eight years, Rosa has helped her husband with the household expenses by making belts used as "tocoyales" (woolen wraps worn as hair adornments) in her community. She says that thanks to her work, she has been able to get her family ahead.

Rosa has started modernizing her belts, but to do so, she needs good quality thread, which is a bit expensive in the market right now. It was not within her means to make that investment, which was her motivation for organizing a group of women with the same objective as her to request a loan. The loan will be destined for purchasing silk, woolen and beaded threads and embroidery floss for embellishing the "tocoyales."

Rosa hopes that with this investment she will have an improved income and be able to help her husband to finish construction on their house.

loans.use: to purchase silk, woolen and beaded threads and embroidery floss for adorning "tocoyal" belts (woolen wraps worn by indigenous people as a hair adornment)

loans.name: Dúo Orquideas De Magdalena Group

texts.es:
Dúo Orquideas de Magdalena
Este dúo está formado por doña Carla Eugenia, ella tiene 24 años de edad y se dedica a la venta de medicina química y medicina natural en su farmacia, esta ubicada en su domicilio, desde ya hace cuatro años, ella está solicitando el crédito para la compra de medicamentos para poder surtir su farmacia, su mayor deseo es seguir surtiendo la farmacia y tener  todos los medicamentos y vitaminas necesarias para su clientela.
texts.en:
The "Dúo Orquideas de Magdalena" Communal Bank
This pair was put together by doña Carla Eugenia.  She is 24-years old and makes her living selling pharmaceutical medicines and natural medicines at her pharmacy.  She has had the pharmacy set up in her home for four years.  Doña Carla Eugenia is requesting the loan to purchase medications to stock up her pharmacy.  Her greatest desire is to continue stocking her pharmacy and having all the medications and vitamins her clientele may need.

loans.use: to purchase medicines for re-sale.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To buy a dairy cow so as to supply more milk to customers to ear more income.

loans.name: Norvey De Jesus

texts.es:
Norvey es ya todo un señor de 40 años de edad, separado de su esposa con quien tuvo dos hijos, ambos adolescentes, trabaja arduamente en su chaza de alimentos (ver foto), para generar sustento tanto para pagar su sustento, como para pagar el estudio de sus dos hijos.
Inicio su negocio en el año 2011 cansado de trabajar duramente por un jornal bajo, por este motivo busco los caminos del emprendimiento y ahora vende cigarrillos, snakcs, dulces, galletería, refrescos, chocolates, goma de mascar entre otros productos.

Solicita un préstamo para la compra de surtido de productos anteriormente descritos, el resto del capital será para arreglar su chaza de alimentos que tiene un problema para el desplazamiento, tiene que cambiar ruedas y aceitar su mecanismo para hacer más fácil la movilidad por las calles.
texts.en:
Norvey is quite a man. He is forty years old and is separated from his wife with whom he had two children, both teenagers. He works hard at his food stall (see photo) to make enough to buy food and to pay for his two children's education. 

He started his business in 2011. He became tired of working hard for low wages, so he sought to become his own boss. He now sells cigarettes, snacks, sweets, cookies, sodas, chocolates, and chewing gum, among other products. 

He is requesting a loan to buy an assortment of the products just described. The rest of the capital will be to fix his food stall which has problems moving. He needs to change the wheels and oil the mechanism that makes it easier to move around the streets.

loans.use: to buy an assortment of cigarettes, snacks, sweets, cookies, sodas, chocolates, and chewing gum

loans.name: Miski Warmi Group

texts.es:
La A.C. “MISKI WARMI” iniciará el séptimo ciclo en Pro Mujer, como parte del Centro Focal de Panamericana, está compuesta por ocho  integrantes y está dirigida por una mesa directiva donde la señora Virginia es la Presidenta. Los negocios que las integrantes de la asociación comunal llevan adelante son variados entre ellos existen: venta de faldas, venta de cosméticos, venta de ropa, venta de videos, venta de material de ferretería, venta de joyas, frial. 

El crédito que sacaran beneficiara a pequeñas microempresarias donde la señora Virginia es integrante, ella indica que es la primera vez que integra Pro Mujer, ingresando por la invitación de una amiga que es cliente de la institución. En la actualidad ella tiene un negocio de frial de pollos; da a conocer que este negocio lo inicio hace varios años, ya que conocía la forma de trabajo de un empleo anterior que tenía, cuando decide guardar un capital emprende su negocio. 

El crédito que ahora sacará es para el aumento de capital (compra carne pollo por mayor) que adquirirá de las vendedoras de la ciudad de El Alto y posteriormente lo comercializará en su espacio de venta. Esta forma de trabajo le permite generar recursos para apoyar a su familia económicamente, ya que ella es soltera y tiene dos hijos.  

Cuando se le consulta qué le gusta de Pro Mujer, ella responde que le gusta el área de salud que ofrece la institución.
texts.en:
The communal bank "Miski Warmi" will begin its seventh cycle with Pro Mujer, as part of the Panamericana Central Office. It is made up of 8 members and is directed by a board of directors, of which Virginia is the President. The members of the group work in various businesses, which include the sale of skirts, cosmetics, clothing, videos, hardware materials, and jewelry.

The loan that they will take out will help small entrepreneurs. Virginia is one of the members. She mentions that this is her first time joining Pro Mujer. She joined at the invitation of a friend who is a member of the institution. She currently has a business selling chicken meat. She states that she started this business many years ago since she already knew the form of work from a previous job. Then she decided to save up the money to start her business.

The loan that she is requesting now is to increase her capital and buy chicken meat at wholesale from the vendors in the city of El Alto. She will then market the meat at her sales space. This work allows her to generate resources to support her family financially since she is single and has two kids.

When she is asked what she likes about Pro Mujer, she answers that she likes the health zone that the institution offers.

loans.use: to buy chicken meat at wholesale.

loans.name: Eismeldi Jose

texts.es:
La persona que pueden ver en la foto es un hombre llamado Eismeldi, es una persona nacida y criada en el campo, su actividad que le genera el sustento a su familia es la cría y venta de cerdos, con ello lleva desde el año 1996 y en la foto se puede  ver algo que construyo con sus propias manos que fue el corral.

Inicio el negocio pro una seria de combinación de acontecimientos uno de ellos fue por necesidad ya que debía llevar un alimento a su casa en donde lo espera su hija y su pareja, la otra es por falta de oportunidades de empleo en la zona y la última fue por ganas de crear una empresa que le permitiera estar cerca de su familia.

Su negocio en el transcurso de los años no ha tenido grandes cambios, pero con ello ha solventado sus necesidades, ahora se encuentra solicitando un préstamo para realizar una remodelación de sus cocheras ya que la que tiene cumplió un periodo de vida más que largo, el resto del capital lo invertirá en la compra de alimento para cerdos y 5 lechones.
texts.en:
The person that can be seen in the photo is a man named Eismeldi who was born and raised in the countryside. His business that provides sustenance for his family is breeding and selling pigs, which he has done since 1996. In the photo, you can see something that he built with his own hands, a corral. 

He started his business for a series of reasons, one of which was out of necessity since he needed to bring home food to his daughter and wife. Another was because of a lack of job opportunities in his area, and the last one was because he wanted to create a business that would allow him to be near his family. 

Throughout the years, his business has not had major changes, but with it he has met his needs. Now, he is requesting a loan to remodel his shed as it has already fulfilled a long lifetime of use. The rest of the capital will be invested in the purchase of food for the pigs and five piglets.

loans.use: to remodel his shed.

loans.name: Sostene

texts.en:
Sostene is 38 years. He is a farmer and he has been growing maize for the past 13 years. With the loan from Kiva, he would like to pay workers who harvested his crop. The profits from the business will be used improve his standard of living.

The agriculture sector accounts for 37% of Rwanda's gross domestic product, generates 65% of Rwanda's export revenue, and employs approximately 90% of Rwandans (as of 2009). Despite the importance of agriculture to Rwandans and their economy, financial institutions view lending to fund agricultural activities as a high-risk proposition because the profitability of these activities is affected by weather, natural disasters, and price fluctuations. For this reason, farmers in Rwanda remain under served by financial institutions. Urwego Opportunity Bank is expanding into this market and is happy to provide Kiva lenders with the opportunity to support Rwandan farmers.

loans.use: To pay workers who harvested his crop

loans.name: Peace

texts.en:
Peace is 39 years old. She is married with two children between one and five years old. None of her children go to school yet. She is a farmer and she has been growing maize for 16 years. Her husband is also a farmer. With the loan from Kiva, she would like to pay workers who harvested her maize. The profits from the business will be used to buy a cow to raise.
