The agriculture sector accounts for 37% of Rwanda's gross domestic product, generates 65% of Rwanda's export revenue, and employs approximately 90% of Rwandans (as of 2009). Despite the importance of agriculture to Rwandans and their economy, financial institutions view lending to fund agricultural activities as a high-risk proposition because the profitability of these activities is affected by weather, natural disasters, and price fluctuations. For this reason, farmers in Rwanda remain underserved by financial institutions. Urwego Opportunity Bank is expanding into this market and is happy to provide Kiva lenders with the opportunity to support Rwandan farmers.

loans.use: To pay workers who harvested her maize.

loans.name: Villa Entre Rios Group

texts.es:
Selmira es una mujer de 23 años de edad, vive con su pareja, tiene un hijo de 1 año y su negocio es la venta de ropa de segunda mano.
Ella es buena madre, emprendedora, de buena actitud, optimista, responsable y trabajadora. Su negocio lo desarrollan en la localidad de ‘Sacaba’ un área rural que se caracteriza por su crecimiento y por su potencial comercial y productivo. Ubicado en un valle semi-tropical, dónde la venta de comida es abundante, variada y todo se acompaña con chicha (bebida fermentada de maíz). De clima templado durante todo el año; en invierno la gama de temperaturas varía de 1 grado centígrados a 24 grados centígrados y durante la época de verano, la gama de temperaturas varía a partir de 10 grados centígrados a 19 grados centígrados con fuertes lluvias.
Selmira es de tez morena, cabello negro largo lo usa amarrado, ojos pardos, baja estatura, complexión física delgada, viste a la moda, su lengua materna es el Quechua que se habla en el lugar y habla español por cultura general y por el comercio que realiza (sentada al centro usa polera cuello v celeste y suéter negro). Su vida la comparte con su pareja que trabaja como soldador en una empresa metalúrgica, y con su hijo que es un bebé, viven en una casa propia construida de adobe con techo de calamina que cuenta con agua de pozo, energía eléctrica y alcantarillado. Su sueño de superación la llevo a liderar una banca de personas con negocios como; venta de perfumes, llantería, servicio técnico a celulares, venta de refrescos, venta de polleras, venta de helado y elaboración de empanadas, para solicitar un préstamo y mejorar sus actividades. Su negocio es la venta de ropa de segunda mano, como; pantalones, poleras, blusas, camisas, camisetas, etc., actividad que realiza de forma ambulante en diferentes ferias y comercios de la ciudad. Su trabajo comienza muy temprano por la mañana cuando se dirige a recoger sus prendas para llevarlas al sitio elegido para la venta de hoy, arma un puesto de venta con una mesa y una sombrilla, estirando 2 cobertores de plástico para colocar la ropa, la ropa queda mezclada y los clientes escogen dentro de la ropa amontonada. La ventaja de su negocio es que puede cuidar a su hijo mientras trabaja, la desventaja es que existe mucha competencia. “existe mucha competencia en mi negocio, aun así mis ventas son buenas y cuento con clientes constantes…” comenta. Su sueño es tener una casa propia, ella desea realizar la compra de variedad de ropa de segunda mano para ofertar y vender por mayor. Esta es la 2 secuencia de préstamos con la institución en 2 años que se dedica a esta actividad de forma independiente. 
Es por esos motivos que Selmira solicita un préstamo para la compra de variedad de ropa de segunda manos para ofertar y vender por mayor para el bien de su hijo.
texts.en:
Selmira is a 23-year-old woman who lives with her partner and has a one-year-old child. Her business involves selling secondhand clothes. Selmira is a good mother who is enterprising, optimistic, responsible, hardworking, and has a good attitude. She conducts her business in the town of Sacaba, a rural area that is known for its growth and its business and productive potential. Located in a semi-tropical valley, Sacaba is where the sale of food is abundant, varied, and is always served with “chicha” (a fermented corn beverage). The weather is mild throughout the entire year. In winter, the temperature range varies between 1-24 degrees Celsius. During the summer, the temperature varies between 10-19 degrees Celsius with strong rains.

Selmira has a dark complexion, long black braided hair, brown eyes, short stature, and a thin physique. She dresses fashionably. Her native language is Quechua, which she speaks in her town, but she also speaks Spanish as part of the general culture and to conduct business. In the photo, she is seated in the middle and wearing a black sweater and holding a light-blue fleece jacket. Selmira shares her life with her partner, who works for a metalwork company. They have a son who is a baby. She and her family live in an adobe house with a metal sheet roof. Their house has well water, electricity, and sewage services. Her drive to succeed has resulted in her becoming the leader of a Communal Bank that includes businesspeople who sell perfumes, manage a tire repair shop, provide mobile phone technical services, sell soft drinks, sell traditional skirts, sell ice cream, and make empanadas. They have joined together so that they can request a loan and improve their business activities.

Selmira sells secondhand clothes such as trousers, turtlenecks, blouses, shirts, T-shirts, and other garments. She conducts her business as a street vendor by going to different fairs and markets in the city. Selmira begins her work very early in the morning, which is when she must choose which clothes she will take with her to the place where she will sell for that day. Her mobile vending post includes a table, an umbrella, and two plastic sheets to cover the clothes. She carries a mix of clothes and the customers choose what they want from the piles. The advantage of her business is that she can look after her son while she is working. The disadvantage is that there is a great deal of competition. “There is a lot of competition in my business, but my sales are still good and I have regular customers,” says Selmira. Her dream is to have a house of her own. She wants to buy a variety of secondhand clothes to offer and sell in bulk. This is Selmira’s second loan cycle with Emprender and she has managed an independent business for two years.

For the reasons previously mentioned, Selmira is requesting a loan so that she can buy a variety of secondhand clothes that she can offer and sell in bulk. As a result, she can provide for her son’s welfare.

loans.use: to buy a variety of secondhand clothes in bulk.

loans.name: Vilma

texts.es: Vilma de 54 años de edad se dedica a la venta de ropa, calzado perfumería en diversos barrios de  la ciudad. Como esposa y madre de un hijo de 22 años sus sueños se enfocan el mejoramiento de las condiciones de vida  de su familia, por eso    su meta es comprar  más adelante su vivienda propia. Hace 6 años, en el mes de Abril desde el año 2009, observando el éxito de su hermana en las actividades comerciales, y por sugerencia de ella, decidió seguir sus pasos e inició con una pequeña inversión, comprando calzado, perfumería etc, hoy su negocio ha crecido y genera otros ingresos,  prestando el servicio de alquiler de sillas para eventos. Su gran propósito es  fidelizar a su clientela con precios competitivos, pero sobre todo con un excelente servicio, por eso trabaja todos los días desde las 7 de la mañana hasta las 7 de la noche, comprando de contado a mayoristas especializados y vendiendo a crédito y también de contado. Vilma se propone aumentar las ventas y sus utilidades, por eso ha acudido a un credikiva, primer financiamiento que hace a la Fundación Mario Santo Domingo, mediante el cual comprará perfumería cosméticos, calzado y ropa, para comercializarlos y muy pronto alcanzar sus sueños  de prosperidad.
texts.en:
Vilma is 54 years old and in the business of selling clothes, shoes, and perfumes in different neighborhoods of the city. As a wife and a mother of a 22-year-old son, her dreams focus on improving her family’s living conditions. For this reason, her goal is to buy a house in the future. Six years ago, in April 2009, Vilma saw how successful her sister was in her business activities. At her sister’s suggestion, Vilma decided to follow in her footsteps and start with a small investment. She bought shoes, perfumes, and other products. Today her business has grown and now generates additional income. Vilma also rents out chairs for events. Her main goal is to retain her customers by offering competitive prices and, above all else, providing excellent service. She works every day from 7:00 A.M. to 7:00 P.M. Vilma buys her merchandise with cash from specialized wholesalers and then sells the products on credit or for cash.

She intends to increase her sales and profits. For this reason, Vilma is applying for a Kiva loan, her first form of financing through Fundación Mario Santo Domingo. She will use the money to buy perfumes, cosmetics, shoes, and clothing that she can sell. Very soon, she hopes to reach her dreams of prosperity.

loans.use: to buy perfumes, cosmetics, shoes, and clothing to sell.

loans.name: Angel Adriano

texts.es:
Angel tiene 50 años de edad, vive en casa propia con su cónyuge y sus cuatro hijos en el distrito de Querocotillo que se encuentra ubicado en la provincia de Cutervo, región Cajamarca, en la sierra norte de Perú. Las actividades principales que se desarrollan en este distrito son la agricultura, comercio y ganadería.

El se dedica al cultivo de maíz, realiza esta actividad desde hace 15 años contando con experiencia en este negocio y con buenas referencias por parte de sus vecinos. El crédito será utilizado para la compra de abono y fertilizantes para brindar mantenimiento a su cultivo de maíz, con esto Angel espera ofrecer un mejor producto lo que le va a permitir mejorar su nivel de ingresos y por ende mejorar su calidad de vida.
texts.en:
Angel is 50 years old and lives in his own home with his wife and their four children. They reside in the District of Querocotillo in Cutervo Province, which is located in the region of Cajamarca in the northern mountains of Peru. The main business activities in this district are agriculture, trade, and livestock breeding.

Angel grows corn and has been in this business for 15 years. He has experience in this business and good references from his neighbors. This loan will be used to buy compost and fertilizers so that he can maintain his corn crop. With this loan, Angel hopes to offer a better product so that he can improve his income level and eventually his quality of life.

loans.use: to buy compost and fertilizers so that he can maintain his corn crop.

loans.name: Patrick

texts.en:
Patrick is 31 years old. He is married with one child. He has had an agriculture business for seven years. He will be using the loan to purchase farm inputs as a way of expanding his business and hopes this will help him to buy farm inputs like fertilizer.

 His hope and dream for the future is to make sure that his family will have a stable life.

loans.use: To buy farm inputs like fertilizer to improve the farming business

loans.name: Lawrence

texts.en:
Lawrence is 36 years old and married with four children. He has had a farming business for 13 years. He will be using this loan to purchase farm inputs and he hopes this will help him to pay the school fees for his children. 

His hopes and dreams for the future are to have a prosperous business and to improve the living standards of his family.

loans.use: to purchase farm inputs.

loans.name: Benard

texts.en: Most people in the world dream of getting well-paying jobs. Benard, from the Nyamira area of Kenya, has never secured one and has opted to be a smallholder farmer. He decided that he will be independent and contribute to his community by practicing mixed farming. Benard is blessed with two beautiful children whom he refers to as his "heart beat.” His primary sources of income are milk and poultry farming, as well as some personal business that he does to supplement his meager income. Deciding to practice poultry farming for Benard was not difficult. “I was brought up with chickens raised by my parents”. For the past eight years, Benard has been earning a decent income from poultry farming. However, the demand is overwhelming and he wants to increase his poultry, but the biggest challenge is lack of funds. He is seeking a loan to purchase additional poultry. Poultry farming has become one of the most important aspects of agriculture in Kenya because it creates business opportunities for entrepreneurs and it’s a kind of business that can never dry up. Poultry farming is a less strenuous activity that is profitable. Many poultry farmers find a sense of fulfillment having hens all over their homestead. The hens lay eggs that can be consumed or sold. If taken seriously, poultry farming has the potential of being a big business because the demand for poultry products is always high. With your loan, Benard is going to make more income that will enable him to take care of his family's expenses. As times keep getting harder, Benard is doing all he can do to ensure that his family's basic needs are met.

loans.use: To buy poultry

loans.name: Davit

texts.en:
Davit is 58 years old and married from the village of Doesi. He has a wife and son who are temporarily unemployed. The only breadwinner in the family is Davit, who works as a car painter and gets 200 GEL approximately. The income is really hardly enough to meet even basic needs and so the family lives under poverty. In order, somehow, to increase his productivity and monthly income, Davit decided to start another activity as well. He sought credit among local financial institutions, but his attempts was unsuccessful because of his poor living conditions. The startup program that is a joint initiative between Kiva and Credo, enables rural poor and inexperienced people to get a loan for starting or re-starting businesses. His application was approved under the framework of this program to get a loan of 3,000 GEL for purchasing a car to start trading with fruits and vegetables.  He will sell the products with price mark-ups door-to-door and will have his own customers in his and nearby villages.
 
The loan will greatly assist Davit and he will be able to improve his economic situation and give his family a better style of life.

loans.use: To buy a car and start trading with fruits and vegetables

loans.name: Haydee

texts.es:
La socia Haydee se sigue dedicando al trabajo como profesora de un colegio,la socia trabaja desde las 8:00 a.m hasta las 2:00 p.m,la sociao por medio de este trabajo quiere salir adelante, el sueño de la socia es tener un colegio. La socia solicita el crédito para comprar un televisor para su casa.

La socia está feliz por el préstamo y se compromete a cumplir con los pagos de su cuota.
texts.en:
Haydee continues to work as a teacher at a high school. She works from 8:00 A.M. to 2:00 P.M. Through this job, she wants to get ahead. Her dream is to have a school of her own.

Haydee is requesting a loan in order to buy a television for her house. She is pleased with the loan and promises to complete her payments.

loans.use: to buy a television for her house.

loans.name: Theresa Agnes

texts.en:
Theresa is 44 years old.  She is married, and has 3 children aged 17, 15 and 5 years old. In 2011, Theresa established her building material business. She began her work because she wanted to expand her building material to help others.  

Working 6 days a week and 11 hours a day, she earns about Le 1,500,000 every month from this business.  She would like a loan in the amount of Le 5,000,000 in order to buy 50 bags of cement, 30 shovels, and 30 oil pans to resell. 

She hopes that this loan will enable her to increase her monthly profits by approximately Le 429,000. 

In the future, Theresa plans to concentrate on expanding her business. She is very hard working and thanks you for your support

loans.use: to buy construction supplies for resale.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To buy more palm oil and 20 bags of garri for her food business.

loans.name: Bernard

texts.en:
This is 46-year-old Bernard. He is married and has three children aged 25, 9 and 2 years. He has two additional dependents who live with him for schooling. 

In 2008, Bernard established his pharmacy business. He began his business because he wanted to help with the smooth running of his home. His business is located on the outskirts of town, and his main customers are people in the general community. Working six days a week and 15 hours a day, he earns about 870,000 SLL every month from this business. 

He would like a loan in the amount of 5,000,000 SLL. Bernard requires a loan in order to buy more drugs, cosmetics, etc., for resale. He hopes that this loan will help his business to grow through proper use. In the future, Bernard plans to build a hospital and a house and to give a quality education to his children. He thanks you for your support.

loans.use: to buy more medicine for resale

loans.name: Angelique

texts.en:
Angelique is 45 years old. She is married with two children aged one and five years. One of them goes to school. She is a farmer and she has been growing maize for 12 years. Also, her husband is a farmer. With the loan from Kiva, she would like to pay workers who harvest maize. The profits from the business will be used to renovate her house.
 
The agriculture sector accounts for 37% of Rwanda's gross domestic product, generates 65% of Rwanda's export revenue, and employs approximately 90% of Rwandans (as of 2009). Despite the importance of agriculture to Rwandans and their economy, financial institutions view lending to fund agricultural activities as a high-risk proposition because the profitability of these activities is affected by weather, natural disasters, and price fluctuations. For this reason, farmers in Rwanda remain under served by financial institutions. Urwego Opportunity Bank is expanding into this market and is happy to provide Kiva lenders with the opportunity to support Rwandan farmers.

loans.use: To pay workers who harvest maize on her farm.

loans.name: Francisco Hernan

texts.es:
Francisco es un hombre veterano de 67 años de edad que se dedica a vender productos de la canasta familiar, su negocio es todo lo que tiene para generar dinero, no cuenta con una pensión ni con una persona que lo apoye, es separo de su esposa y tiene un hijo de 23 años que aunque lo quiere, antes lo tiene que apoyar para que se desarrolle como un profesional universitario.

Francisco solicita un préstamo para la compra de productos de la canasta familiar, la razón del monto es para abastecer el negocio con todo tipo de mercancía, como lo son abarrotes, granos, productos de aseo doméstico y personal entre otros.

Este crédito será muy importante para francisco, ya que es una persona con una edad considerable que no puede salir a buscar un empleo por lo que debe aferrarse, proteger y mantener lo que tiene ahora su tienda.
texts.en:
Francisco is a 67-year-old veteran who works selling basic family products. His business is all that he has to make a living. He doesn't have a pension nor anyone to support him. He is separated from his wife and has one son who is 23 years old. Although he wants to support Francisco, Francisco first needs to support his son so he can become a university-educated professional.

Francisco is requesting a loan to purchase basic products for the family, in order to stock his business with all sorts of merchandise such as groceries, grains, home cleaning products, and personal products, among other items.

This loan will be very important for Francisco because he is an aging person who can't go out looking for a place to work. He needs to hang onto, protect, and maintain what he currently has in his store.

loans.use: to buy groceries, grains, home cleaning products, and personal products, among other items

loans.name: Luis Fernando

texts.es:
Esa es la cara de un hombre feliz, es la cara de Luis Fernando un agricultor que goza de su trabajo, que goza del campo, que está muy motivado y a la expectativa de lo que pueda pasar en un lapso pequeño de tiempo, pues se encuentra solicitando un préstamo, pero se preguntaran porque están tan feliz? La razón es que Luis Fernando debido a la zona donde vive no hay muchas entidades que lo apoyen solo personas que hacen prestamos informales a tasas de interés elevadísimas fuera de su alcance, pero con el apoyo y las asesorías de Interactuar está logrando mejorar e impulsar su negocio.

Luis se encuentra solicitando un apoyo financiero para la compra de abonos, riegos y semillas que serán su aliciente para una nueva cosecha y marcara el camino de un nuevo negocio de agricultura para él.

Este negocio es muy importante ya que es la única fuente de dinero, con ella se mantiene y genera el sustento para su familia que lo conforma su pareja y sus dos hijos
texts.en:
The face of this happy man belongs to Luis Fernando, a farmer who enjoys his work in the fields. He is very excited and eager about what can happen in a short amount of time. Luis Fernando is requesting a loan, but one must wonder why he is so happy? The reason is that he lives in an area where there aren’t many organizations that support sole proprietors. Therefore, these entrepreneurs rely on informal loans that charge elevated interest rates that are out of reach. However, the support of the advisors from Interactuar is improving the situation so that Luis Fernando can boost his business.

He is requesting financial support in order to pay for compost, irrigation, and seeds. The incentive of a new harvest marks a new path for his agribusiness. This business is very important to Luis Fernando since it is his only source of income. By maintaining it he will be able to support his family, which includes his partner and their two children.

loans.use: to pay for compost, irrigation, and seeds.

loans.name: Zenon

texts.en: Zenon is a tinsmith; he is married and his wife lives at a farm. Zenon has a son and he helps him a lot. He and his son are still living in El Alto. Zenon makes barrels and he also paints the product. Zenon needs a loan again to buy materials to make the barrels and also he would like to make punts. Zenon would like to have his own house in the future. Right now he is living with his parents. He hopes you can help him.

loans.use: to buy materials to make barrels for his manufacturing activity.

loans.name: Virginia

texts.en:
Virginia is a happy, married woman. She has two kids, and she lives at El Alto. She makes and sells vicuña [an animal similar to the alpaca prized for its soft hair] blankets. Virginia has her own house, and she learned how to make the blankets when she was a child. 

Virginia needs a loan to buy vicuña wool. This time she would like to have better quality wool to make better blankets and to earn more money. She hopes you can help her again.

loans.use: to buy vicuña wool

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to invest in a larger variety of sweet breads to sell

loans.name: Merla

texts.en:
Merla is thankful that she was previously granted a Php 22,000 loan to finance her piggery backyard business. Her earnings from raising and selling hogs help support their daily needs and for the schooling of her children. Aside from from her piggery, she also has a boarding house that has twelve rooms for rent.

To help maintain her boarding house, she is requesting a Php 25,000 loan to pay for paint, lumber, labor and other materials needed to improve the rooms of her boarding house. This will help attract more boarders and encourage them to renew their contract with her. She is thanking God and you in advance for the financial help that will be given her.

Merla hopes that her business will grow so that she could send all of her children to college. She prays for good health and protection for her family. She desires that they will stay faithful in their relationship with God. She meets with her co-fellowship members* every week to share stories of her work and to draw strength and inspiration from the Word of God she studies.

* All CCT community partners / clients are organized into fellowship groups that meet on a weekly basis. A fellowship group is composed of 15 to 30 community partners. The fellowship groups gather each week to study the Word of God, build social capital and repay Micro Finance loans.

loans.use: to pay for repairs and improvements to her boarding house.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy more provisions for resale

loans.name: Hawa A.

texts.en: This is 43-year-old Hawa A. She is widowed, and has three children aged 13, 18 and 23 years, one of whom is a school-going child. In 2001, Hawa A. established her clothing business - cotton, lace, etc. Working six days a week and 10 hours a day, she earns about Le 4,178,000 every month from this business. She would like a loan in the amount of Le 5,000,000. Hawa A. has already received and successfully repaid five loans, and now requires a new loan in order to purchase bales of wax cotton, lace, brillian material [a type of white cotton], etc. In the future, Hawa A. plans to reinvest in and improve her business. She did not meet with her previous plans. She thanks you for your support.

loans.use: to purchase bales of wax cotton, lace, brillian material, etc.

loans.name: Anonymous Group
loans.use: to purchase mobile phones, recharge cards and groceries from the market to later sell the goods to customers

loans.name: Marjorie

texts.en:
Marjorie (41) lives in Orange Farm, Johannesburg, with her two children, aged 19 and 4.

She is a single mother who has managed to overcome hurdles and emerge as a successful businesswoman. Indeed, she is a success story within her community.

Marjorie sells meat across her area. She has come up with a very unique way of selling her meat: from the boot of her car. This, she says, enables her to deliver the meat to her clients, hence eliminating the inconvenience of customers having to travel to the butchery. 

With this loan, she wants to buy a pick-up truck and install a meat freezer at the back. This, she says, will greatly increase her capacity as she can now stock more meat and also travel further, thereby opening more markets while ensuring her meat remains fresh.
 
Marjorie intends to own a fleet of trucks delivering food products across South Africa. Having succeeded in business thus far, Marjorie wants to inspire young women within her community and hopes to open a training school for them, teaching basic business skills.

loans.use: to buy a pick-up truck and a portable meat freezer

loans.name: Kadiatu Umarr

texts.en:
This is 32-year-old Kadiatu Umarr. She is married and has two children, aged 9 and 6 years; both are school-going children. She has one additional dependent who lives with her to be fostered.  

In 2009, Kadiatu Umarr established her textiles business. She began her business because she dropped out at primary level due to the death of her father. Her mother was not financially strong enough to pay for her school, so she therefore joined her mother in business and later got married. Her husband gave her some amount of money to start her own business, and she has now established it to the present business.  

Working six days a week and 10 hours a day, she earns about 1,751,000 SLL every month from this business. She would like a loan in the amount of 5,000,000 SLL. 

Kadiatu Umarr has already received and successfully repaid one loan, and now requires a new loan in order to buy bales of assorted cotton and slippers.   In the future, Kadiatu Umarr plans to buy a piece of land and reinvest in the business. Her major challenge is the restriction of the roads to get goods. She thanks you for your support.

loans.use: to buy bales of assorted cotton and slippers.

loans.name: Jariatu

texts.en:
This is 35-year-old Jariatu. She is married and has three children aged 13, 11 and eight years. All are school-going children. In 1992, Jariatu established her frozen fish and chicken business. Working six days a week and seven hours a day, she earns about 3,541,000 SLL every month from this business. 

Jariatu has already received and successfully repaid two loans, and now requires a new loan in order to buy cartons and bags of frozen fish and chicken.   She would like a loan in the amount of 5,000,000 SLL. In the future, Jariatu plans to reinvest and improve her business to provide quality education for her children. One of her previous plans was met by opening an outlet for displaying her goods, but she was unable to build a house. She thanks you for your support.

loans.use: to buy cartons and bags of frozen fish and chicken.

loans.name: Sandra Lorena

texts.es: Sandra de 37 años de edad es una mujer trabajadora que se esfuerza cada día para salir adelante apoyada en su trabajo en una farmacia cercana, además cuenta con un taller de polarizado de vehículos el cual es administrado por su esposo. Ella habita en vivienda propia desde hace 10 años, al lado de su esposos y sus 2 hijos. Sandra desea incrementar las ventas de su negocio y para ello desea invertir en materia prima, pero al no contar con la liquidez económica necesaria solicita un crédito a FUSAI para invertir en materia prima para realizar polarizado de vehículos.
texts.en:
Sandra is a 37-year-old, hard-working woman who strives every day to get ahead with the support of her work at a nearby pharmacy. In addition, she counts on a vehicle window tinting shop run by her husband. She has lived in her own house for 10 years with her husband and two children. 

Sandra wants to increase the sales of her business and for that reason she wants to invest in raw materials, but without having the necessary financial liquidity she asks for a loan from FUSAI to invest in raw materials to do vehicle window tinting.

loans.use: To invest in raw materials to do vehicle window tinting

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy more shampoo, powder, etc., for resale

loans.name: Fatima Guadalupe

texts.es: Fátima de 20 años de edad es una mujer  que se esfuerza cada día para salir adelante apoyada en su negocio de elaboración y venta de ropa para niños actividad que realiza desde hace 4 años y que le ha permitido apoyar a su compañero de vida que le aporta con los gastos del hogar. Ella vive con su esposo y su pequeño hijo en la vivienda de su suegra. Fátima desea invertir en su negocio ya que siente que puede obtener mejores ingresos económicos si invierte en más insumos para su negocio, por lo que solicita un  crédito a FUSAI para invertir en: tela, hilo, zipper, botones, etc. y de esta manera poder brindar una mejor calidad de vida a su familia.
texts.en:
Fátima is a 20-year-old woman who strives every day to get ahead, supported by her business of making and selling clothes for children, work she has done for 4 years, which has permitted her to support her life partner who helps with living costs. She lives with her husband and her young son in her mother-in-law's house. 

Fátima wants to invest in her business now that she feels that she can obtain better income if she invests in more inputs for her business, for which she asks for a loan from FUSAI to invest in fabric, thread, zippers, buttons, etc. and in this manner be able to offer a better quality of life to her family.

loans.use: to invest in fabric, thread, zippers, buttons, etc.

loans.name: Sibongile Patricia

texts.en:
Patricia (55) lives in Orange Farm, Johannesburg, with her husband and her two children. She is a passionate woman who loves kids. She left employment and set up her own daycare and nursery school.

She is requesting a loan to install a gazebo so that the children’s play area is sheltered from adverse weather. She also wants to repair the school’s front area by putting tiles on the floor. This loan, she says, will help the kids have a safe and secure playground.

Patricia is always seeking to improve the state of her school and is already thinking of buying a minivan to ferry the kids to and from school. She hopes to provide quality education that will set a good foundation for the kids.

loans.use: to install a gazebo and to repair the school’s front area.

loans.name: Yehowa Dzi Group

texts.en:
This group is called Yehowa Dzi. It consists of four women. They all live in traditional and simple families in Chorkor, Accra who know one another through friendship and neighborhood connections. They sell foodstuffs, gizzards and tea. They have applied for a loan of 5,600 GHS from Kiva through ID Ghana. 

Lydia is a 26-year-old married woman with three children. She is the featured borrower of the group. Lydia lives with her family in a rented apartment. She has not attended school at all because she got married very young. She is a very dynamic and vigorous woman. Lydia has to help her husband in taking care of the family and as a result, she is requesting a loan of 1,200 GHS from ID Ghana. She will use the loan to purchase gizzards and sausage sto sell door-to-door to her customers. Lydia hopes to expand her business in a few years from now with the help of Kiva through ID Ghana.

loans.use: to purchase gizzards and sausages to sell door-to-door to her customers.

loans.name: Eugenie

texts.en:
Eugenie is 37 years. She is married with two children aged three and five years. Neither go to school. She is a farmer and has been growing maize for the past 12 years. Also, her husband is a farmer. With the loan from Kiva, she would like to pay workers who harvested maize. The profits from the business will be used to pay school fees of her children and to improve their welfare.

The agriculture sector accounts for 37% of Rwanda's gross domestic product, generates 65% of Rwanda's export revenue, and employs approximately 90% of Rwandans (as of 2009). Despite the importance of agriculture to Rwandans and their economy, financial institutions view lending to fund agricultural activities as a high-risk proposition because the profitability of these activities is affected by weather, natural disasters, and price fluctuations. For this reason, farmers in Rwanda remain under served by financial institutions. Urwego Opportunity Bank is expanding into this market and is happy to provide Kiva lenders with the opportunity to support Rwandan farmers.

loans.use: To pay workers who harvest maize on her farm.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy rice, beans, oil, peanuts, sardines, candles, corn meal, soap, and tea leaves.

loans.name: Gloria

texts.pt:
A senhora Gloria de 37 anos de idade,solteira comerciante , mãe de 2 filhos, dos quais 1 frequenta o ensino primário outro menor de idade e vive em casa própria. 

O empréstimo anterior comprou eletrodomésticos para o seu negocio  e com este pretende reforcar o mesmo e comprando congelador, colunas, camas, casais e solteiras, para reforçar o seu negocio. 
   
O cliente tem como sonho, ampliar o seu negocio para responder as necessidades dos seus clientes,e mobilar bem a sua casa.

A cliente tem como principais desafios financeiros , tem recorrido ao xitique. Pretende tomar mais vezes o credito para poder alcançar os seus objetivos e suprir as suas dificuldades.
texts.en: Gloria, age 37, is a single businesswoman and mother of two children, of whom one is in elementary school and the other is not yet school-aged. She lives in her own house. With her last loan she bought home appliances for her business, and with this one she plans to do more of the same, buying freezers,  speakers, and single and double beds in order to strengthen her business. She dreams of growing her business to meet the demands of her customers and of furnishing her home nicely. Her main challenges are financial, but she makes use of an xitique [traditional savings system] and plans to take out future loans to overcome her obstacles.

loans.use: to buy home ware and appliances for her business, such as freezers, speakers, and double and single beds.

loans.name: Amévi

texts.fr: Amévi est revendeuse de céréales et produits d'alimentation générale au marché depuis 1980. Son activité se fait seule. Manquant de fonds pour renforcer son activité, elle demande un premier prêt pour acheter des marchandise. Elle veut assurer l'autosuffisance alimentaire de la famille tout en rendant pérenne son activité.
texts.en: Amévi has been selling cereals and other food products at the market since 1980.  She works alone and suffers from a lack of funds so, she has requested her first loan to buy more stocks.  Amévi would like her family to have enough good food to eat and ensure a good future for her business.

loans.use: to buy food products and cereals for resale.

loans.name: Salda

texts.pt:
A senhora Salda tem 43 anos de idade e viuva mae de 4 filhos 2 dos quais a estudarem e outros 2 ainda menoras e sustenta 2 sobrinhos que estudam no ensino primario.
Com o valor do emprestimo pretende comprar oleo, bolos, peixe, batata, para reforcar o seu negocio.
A sua esperanca e de ver o seu negocio a crescer  e sonha ter uma mercearia que possa vender todos os produtos de 1a necessidade.
Tem como desafios a insuficiencia de fundos, mas que mesmo assim compromete se a pagar pontualmente e diz que ira solicitar mais emprestimos.
texts.en: Salda, age 43, is a widow and mother of four children, of whom two are in school and two are not yet school-aged. She also provides for two nephews who are in elementary school. With this loan she plans to buy oil, pastries, fish, and potatoes in order to strengthen her business. Her hope is to see her business grow and she dreams of having a market where she can sell all the daily needs items. She faces the challenge of limited financial resources, but is committed to making her payments on time and also plans to take out future loans.

loans.use: to buy oil, pastries, fish, and potatoes to sell.

loans.name: Damigou

texts.fr: Damigou vit à Agoè et est âgée de 30 ans, Damigou est une femme mariée avec  deux enfants à sa charge. Damigou a aménagé un atelier où elle vend des tissages et des mèches de diverses gammes. Grâce à son dynamisme, Damigou trouve son revenu pour soutenir les charges de la famille. Damigou s’approvisionne trois fois par mois au marché. Pour commander des tissages et des mèches, Damigou demande ce crédit pour réaliser son achat et tirer le profit nécessaire pour aider son mari dans les diverses charges de la famille.
texts.en:
Damigou is 30 years old and lives in Agoè.  She is married and cares for two children.  Damigou has set up a workshop where she sells different brands of hair weaves and extensions.

Thanks to her dynamic drive, Damigou earns enough to help support her family.  She buys her supplies three times a month at the market.  Her loan will be used to buy further stocks of hair weaves and extensions.  This will generate the necessary profit to help her husband provide for the various expenses of their family.

loans.use: to buy 4 dozen hair extensions for resale.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy a freezer to better equip his house.

loans.name: Esperanca

texts.pt:
A senhora Esperança de 56 anos de idade, é casada mãe de 4 filhos, dos quais 2 já são maiores e independentes, 2 vivem com ela mas também são maiores e trabalham, vive em casa própria.

Com  o valor do empréstimo pretende comprar cimento, areia, pedra , varão, arames, para dar continuidade da sua obra.

A cliente tem como sonho, concluir a sua casa,rebocar,pintar, construir um muro para oferecer um lar melhor a sua família.

A cliente tem como desafios os financeiros e recorre ao xitique. Pretende tomar mais vezes o credito para poder realizar seus desejos
texts.en: Esperança, age 56, is married and the mother of four children, of whom two are grown and independent and two are also grown and work, but live with her in her house. With this loan she plans to buy cement, gravel, rock, beams, and wire to continue with her home improvement projects. Her dream is to finish with her house, including plastering, painting, and building a wall, so she can offer a better home to her family. She has financial challenges, but does make use of an xitique [traditional savings system] and plans to take out future loans to pursue her plans.

loans.use: to buy cement, gravel, rock, beams, and wire.

loans.name: Akouvi

texts.fr: Akouvi est une femme mariée qui vit avec ses quatre enfants à Adidogomé. Akouvi est âgée de 31 ans et vend de la bouillie préparée à base du maïs dans son quartier et des beignets pour l’accompagner. Akouvi s’approvisione une fois par mois au marché pour disposer son stock. Pour commander quelques sacs de farine, de maïs, de sucre et un bidon d’huile, Akouvi demande ce prêt pour réaliser son achat et gagner plus de bénéfice pour venir en aide aux diverses charges de sa famille.
texts.en:
Akouvi is a 31-year-old, married woman who lives with her four children in Adidogomé.  She prepares and sells maize porridge and fritters in her neighbourhood.  She buys new supplies once a month at the market to maintain her stock levels.

Akouvi has requested this loan to buy several sacks of flour, maize, sugar and a drum of oil.  This will generate a profit which will provide for the various expenses of her family.

loans.use: to buy 2 sacks of flour, 3 sacks of maize, 2 sacks of sugar and a drum of oil for her restaurant business.

loans.name: Fati

texts.fr: Femme de 53ans, Fati veuve, a en charge 02 enfants dont 01 scolarisé. Pour subvenir à leurs besoins, elle a commencé la vente des ignames et céréales au marché depuis 1980. Son premier crédit lui servira de s'approvisionner en marchandises afin de répondre aux besoins des clients.  Elle souhaite agrandir son activité et assurer l'auto-suffisance alimentaire de la famille.
texts.en:
Fati is 53 years old, widowed and responsible for two children.  One of the children currently attends school.  In order to provide for her family, she started selling yams and cereals at the market in 1980.

Her first loan will enable her to buy new supplies and respond to the demands of her customers.  In the future, Fati would like to expand her business and ensure a supply of good food for her family.

loans.use: to buy yams and cereals for resale.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy more cartons of chicken, fish and meat

loans.name: Famille Kwizera Group

texts.fr: Le café est une culture de base à IDJWI; Christophe s'y est lancé en 2002. Il lui permet non seulement de réaliser ses projets personnels mais surtout de suppléer sa soeur Consolata devenue veuve et mère de 5 enfants dans ses responsabilités familiales(sur la photo avec son jeune enfant). Il se plaint du prix de vente du café (souvent bas) et le temps nécessaire pour attendre la maturité de cerises. Toutefois, il est optimiste quant à l'avenir car il projette acheter un nouveau champ.
texts.en:
Coffee is a staple crop in Idjwi and Christophe began growing it in 2002.  This allows him to provide for himself, but also supports his sister, Consolata, who has been widowed and left with five children.  Consolata is also shown in the photo with her young child.

Christophe complains about the, often, low price of coffee and the time it takes for the crop to mature.  However, he remains optimistic for the future as he plans to buy a new field.

loans.use: to pay for weeding and harvesting work on his farm.

loans.name: Fatmata

texts.en:
This is 40 year-old Fatmata. She is married and has 3 children aged 19, 15 and 7. She has 2 additional dependents who live with her, helping the others with their schoolwork.  

In 2008, Fatmata established her household utensils business. She began her business just to be self-reliant. Working 6 days a week and 11 hours a day, she earns about SLL 1,926,000 every month from this business. 

She would like a loan in the amount of SLL 5,000,000. She has already received and successfully repaid 1 loan, and now requires a new loan in order to buy more rubber, sets of pans, etc. for her shop. She hopes that this loan will enable her to increase her monthly profits and to add to her business capital. 

In the future, she plans to continue to assist her husband, to improve her business and to build a house.   

She thanks you for your support.

loans.use: To buy cooking utensils

loans.name: Tsuishitoo Group

texts.en:
These women are part of the group called Tsuishitoo, which is made up of four members. They are responsible parents with three children in total under their care. They are from Chorkor, which is located in the Greater-Accra region. They are hardworking and responsible, with a desire for personal improvement. Unfortunately, due to a lack of financial resources, they were unable to study towards a degree and they had to work from a young age to help with the household expenses. They work in grocery, maize, fresh fish and African wax fabric.

Sarah is the featured borrower of this group. She sells fresh fish, and she dedicates 12 hours per day to selling products in her business. She will use this loan to invest in working capital and stock for her business so that she can earn a better income in the near future. She has a sample of her product on show in the photograph on the far left. 

The Tsuishitoo Group is grateful for the help which Kiva lenders provide to people with limited resources. They will hold each other responsible for the repayment of the loan.

loans.use: To buy fresh fish to sell to her customers

loans.name: Saudatu

texts.en:
This is 51-year-old Saudatu. She is married and has 1 child aged 35. She has 2 additional dependents who live with her, in order to help them with their schooling.  

In 2014, Saudatu established her pharmacy business. She began her business after studying as a nurse, and her husband decided to open a pharmacy for her. Working 6 days a week and 12 hours a day, she earns about SLL 1,180,000 every month from this business. 

She would like a loan in the amount of SLL 5,000,000. She has already received and successfully repaid 1 loan, and now requires a new loan in order to buy more drugs for her shop. She hopes that this loan will enable her to increase her monthly profits and add to her business capital.  

In the future, Saudatu plans to continue to expand her business, to build another house and to assist the other family members. She is very religious and thanks you for your support.

loans.use: To buy more drugs for her shop

loans.name: Nowelile

texts.en:
Nowelile (57) lives in Soweto, Johannesburg with her five children.

She sells chicken to support her two youngest children, who are still in school. She buys live chickens from distributors and re-sells them in her neighborhood as either meat or live chickens.

Nowelile wants to improve her business by breeding her own chickens rather than buying from outside sources. She is requesting a loan to buy building materials, namely wire mesh, zinc and wood to build a chicken coop. The loan will also be used to purchase day-old chicks which she will feed and rear in a natural environment.  

In the future she would like to have her own chicken farm in the outskirts of Johannesburg where she will concentrate on breeding chickens and distributing them nationally. She says this will improve her family‘s lifestyle and provide more jobs in the community.

loans.use: to buy chicks and building materials

loans.name: Daniel Adalberto

texts.es: Daniel tiene 36 años de edad es un hombre trabajador que habita en vivienda propia junto a su compañera de vida y su pequeño hijo. Él se desempeña como motorista de su propio vehículo, en el cual realiza viajes a las vendedoras y vendedores de los mercados cercanos, lo que le ha permitido sostener la economía de su hogar. Daniel desea cambiar el techo de su vivienda, ya que este se encuentra deteriorado y en el invierno presenta filtraciones que están deteriorando sus pertenencias, además desea encementar el piso de su vivienda, por lo que solicita un crédito a FUSAI para invertir en: cemento, arena, grava, láminas, polines y pines para cambiar el techo y encementar el piso de su vivienda lo antes posible, ya que se acerca el invierno y el desea realizar las mejoras antes que este termine de deteriorar su techo.
texts.en:
Daniel is 36 years old and is a hard-working man who lives in his own house with his life partner and their small child. He makes a living as a driver of his own vehicle, which he uses to provide transport for local market vendors and which has enabled him to provide financial support for his household.

Daniel wishes to replace the roof on his house because the existing one is worn and, in winter, it leaks causing damage to his belongings. He also wishes to cement the floor of his house, so he is requesting a loan from FUSAI to buy cement, sand, gravel, metal sheets, beams and nails to replace the roof as soon as possible, as winter is coming and he would like to carry out the improvements before winter irrevocably damages his roof.

loans.use: to buy cement, sand, gravel, metal sheets, beams and nails to replace his roof and to cement the floor of his house.

loans.name: Virgen De Copacabana 2015 Group

texts.es:
La A.C. “VIRGEN DE COPACABANA 2015” iniciará el primer ciclo en Pro Mujer, como parte del Centro Focal de Panamericana, está compuesta por ocho  integrantes y está dirigida por una mesa directiva donde la señora Justa es la Presidenta. Los negocios que las integrantes de la asociación comunal llevan adelante son variados entre ellos existen: venta de pelotas, tienda de barrio, venta de hierbas, venta de zapatos. 

El crédito que sacaran beneficiara a pequeñas microempresarias donde la señora Justa es integrante, ella indica que hace tres años que integra Pro Mujer, ingresando por la invitación de una amiga que es cliente de la institución. En la actualidad ella tiene un negocio de tienda de barrio; da a conocer que este negocio lo inicio hace varios años, al observar la carencia de este negocio en su zona, decide implementarlo siendo un existo económico dejando la posibilidad de cuidado de su familia. 

El crédito que ahora sacará es para el aumento de capital (compra refrescos, fideos y arroz por mayor) que adquirirá de las vendedoras de la ciudad de El Alto y posteriormente lo comercializará en su espacio de venta. Esta forma de trabajo le permite generar recursos para apoyar a su familia económicamente, ya que ella es casada y tiene cuatro hijos.  

Cuando se le consulta qué le gusta de Pro Mujer, ella responde que le gusta el área de salud que ofrece la institución.
texts.en:
The communal bank “VIRGEN DE COPACABANA 2015” is starting its first loan cycle with Pro Mujer, as part of the Panamericana centre.The group has 8 members and is run by a managing committee whose preseident is señora Justa. The businesses run by the members of the communal association are varied, including: sale of balls, local shop, sale of herbs and shoe sales. 

The loan they are taking out will benefit small microentreprises, one of which is run by señora Justa. She says that she joined Pro Mujer 3 years ago at the invitation of a friend who is a client of the institution. At present, she has a local shop; she says that she started the business several years ago when she realised that this kind of business was lacking in her area. She decided to set one up  and it has been a financial success and enabled her to look after her family. 

The loan that she is now taking out is to increase her stock (purchase of wholesale soft drinks, pasta and rice) that she will buy from the women who sell wholesale in the city of El Alto and subsequently sell in her sales outlet. This type of work enables her to generate income to financially support her family, as she is married with four children. 

When asked what she likes about Pro Mujer, she replied that she likes the health centre that the institution provides.

loans.use: to buy wholesale soft drinks, pasta and rice

loans.name: Rashmita Group

texts.en:
Khandagiri is a slum area of Bhubaneswar town in the Khurdha district of Odisha, India. In this area, most of the peoples are in the poorer community. A person in their community has a particularly small business occupation only. Undoubtedly, they all belong to small businesses but their ambition is higher than their current status. The income they get from this is only hand-to-mouth for them. Mrs. Narmada, about 33, is a woman from this area. She is standing first from the right hand side with her hand raised in the photo. She is married and lives with her husband and only son who is three years old. 

Mrs. Narmada is engaged in a small business. She earns a monthly income of Rs. 8,000 INR from this business. According to Narmada, this small income is not at all sufficient to meet the requirements of her family as well as her social livelihood. Due to this situation, she was in search of a credit source and Mahashakti introduced its work in the same area. Narmada, along with four other members, formed a group named Rasmita. So she wants with this loan to purchase more and more quantities of sugar, wheat, dal, spice items, biscuit items and other grocery shop requisite items for the expansion of the business. Narmada hopes to construct a house, provide a better education to her children and lead a prestigious life in society. The other four members of this group are doing different types of micro enterprises like general store, vegetable vending, fast food centre, home shopping, and a cycle store.

loans.use: to purchase more sugar, wheat, dal, and spices.

loans.name: Jose

texts.en: Jose is 21 years old. He is single and he doesn't have children but he lives with his stepfather and he helps him a lot. Jose works at a barbershop from 9:00 am until 10:00 pm.  Jose needs a loan to start his own business. He would like to have his own barbershop but right now he wants the loan to buy scissors, shampoo and other hair products to start attending at home. Right now, Jose is the only one working at his home so he needs your help

loans.use: to buy scissors, shampoo and other hair products

loans.name: Anonymous Group
loans.use: to buy cereals.

loans.name: Mnuka Group

texts.en:
Bonifasi, who is in his early 50s, is a divorcee with two children who are still at school.  He has been running a butcher shop since 2009.  He works from 5 am to 7 pm daily and is able to make a fair monthly profit.  

This will be Bonifasi's sixth loan from Tujijenge Tanzania.  He used the previous loan to renovate the butcher shop by installing tiles and a sink and also to increase his meat stock.  He has managed to pay back all his loans successfully. He used the profit to pay school fees, loan repayment and covered household expenses. He will use this loan to increase his meat stock.  He dreams of making his butcher shop international.

Bonifasi will share this loan with his loan group "Mnuka", which has a total of four members who will hold each other accountable for paying back the loan.

loans.use: to increase his meat stock.

loans.name: Maa Santoshi 2 Group

texts.en:
In the year 2014, six self-dependent women of Fire Station Road, Bhubaneswar, Khurdha, Odisha, India formed a group named Maa Santoshi 2 with an objective of expanding their existing businesses and developing their social livelihood by taking a loan from Mahashakti Foundation. Mrs. Monalisa the most active and energetic lady, made a decision to improve herself. This outstanding lady’s age is about 32 years old. She is sitting on the chair with her hand raised in the photo is Mrs. Monalisa. She is a cheerful lady with high ambition. Her family consists of her husband and two daughters of nine and 16 years old, respectively.

For five years, Mrs. Monalisa has been engaged in a tailoring occupation with the help and support of her husband and two children. She earns a monthly income of Rs. 5,500 from her occupation. But the present income is not sufficient to manage the business expenses as well as the household expenses for her family. So Mrs. Monalisa wants to raise her income by increasing the volume of her business by taking a loan. She will purchase the threads, clothes and related items from the nearest market. Mrs. Monalisa hopes that this loan will definitely generate a handsome amount of extra income. She has a dream of saving enough for the better education of her children and construction of a good house. 

The other five members of the group are also doing small businesses like a papad business, vegetable vending, tailoring, beetle cultivation, milk selling, general store, etc. They can also develop themselves through post loan disbursement.

loans.use: to purchase lots of threads and clothes for tailoring

loans.name: Sandra

texts.fr: Sandra est une femme mariée et mère de deux enfants. Agée de 28 ans, Sandra vit à Adidogomé pour exercer ses activités quotidiennes. Pour réaliser son revenu, Sandra achète des pains qu’elle revend dans le quartier en s’approvisionnant trois fois par mois. Pour acheter quelques pains qu’elle pourra revendre, Sandra demande ce prêt pour réaliser sa commande et gagner plus de rentabilité dans son activité.
texts.en: Sandra is a married woman and the mother of 2 children. The 28-year-old lives in Adidogomé, where she does her daily business. In order to earn money, Sandra buys loaves of bread 3 times a month which sells in her neighbourhood. Sandra is requesting this loan in order to buy bread that she can resell in order to increase the profits from her business.

loans.use: to buy 7 dozen loaves of bread.

loans.name: Anonymous Group
loans.use: to buy cereal.

loans.name: Ele-Mawussi

texts.fr: Ele-Mawussi, une femme de 29ans a pour mari un informaticien. Ils ont ensemble un enfant. Pour prêter main forte à son conjoint dans les charges familiales, elle revend depuis 2009 des détergents, des produits divers et insecticides au marché et s'approvisionne au même lieu. Elle est à son second crédit de WAGES et ce montant l'aidera à acheter des marchandises
texts.en: Ele-Mawussi is a 29-year-old woman who is married to a computer specialist. The couple have one child. In order to be able to support her spouse with the family expenses, Ele-Mawussi has been selling detergents, insecticides and various other products at the market (where she also gets her supplies) since 2009. This is her second loan from WAGES and it will help her to buy more merchandise.

loans.use: to buy detergents, insecticides and various other products.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy clothing.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to tile the floor in her house, which will give it a cleaner atmosphere.

loans.name: Nueva Estrella Group

texts.es:
La A.C. “NUEVA ESTRELLA” iniciará el segundo ciclo en Pro Mujer, como parte del Centro Focal de Panamericana, está compuesta por nueve  integrantes y está dirigida por una mesa directiva donde la señora Roberta es la Presidenta. Los negocios que las integrantes de la asociación comunal llevan adelante son variados entre ellos existen: venta de ropa, venta de chalecos, venta de refrescos y gelatina, venta de prendas de vestir, venta de comida, venta de polleras. 

El crédito que sacaran beneficiara a pequeñas microempresarias donde la señora Roberta es integrante, ella indica que hace dos años que integra Pro Mujer, ingresando por la invitación de mi yerna que es cliente de la institución. En la actualidad ella tiene un negocio de venta de comida; da a conocer que este negocio lo inicio hace varios años, empezando con un capital básico y de forma ambulante, posteriormente pudo adquirir un puesto fijo e incremento su capital. 

El crédito que ahora sacará es para el aumento de capital (compra abarrotes por mayor) que adquirirá de las vendedoras de la ciudad de El Alto y posteriormente, a la elaboración, lo comercializará en su espacio de venta. Esta forma de trabajo le permite generar recursos para apoyar a su familia económicamente, ya que ella es casada y tiene seis hijos.  

Cuando se le consulta qué le gusta de Pro Mujer, ella responde que le gusta la capacitación y el área de salud que ofrece la institución.
texts.en:
The “NUEVA ESTRELLA” communal bank will begin its second cycle in Pro Mujer as a part of the Centro Focal Panamericana. It is made up of nine members and led by a board of directors of which Roberta is the president. The businesses that the members of the communal bank have are varied, Among them are selling clothes, selling vests, selling beverages and gelatin, selling clothing, selling food, and selling skirts.

The loan they will take out will benefit the micro-businesswomen, including Roberta. She says that she joined Pro Mujer two years ago, joining at the invitation of her daughter in law, who is a client of the institution. Right now, she has a business selling food. She reports that she started this business several years ago, starting with basic capital and as a street vendor. Later, she was able to acquire a permanent spot and increase her capital. 

The loan she will take out now is to increase capital by buying groceries wholesale. She will acquire them from the sellers in the city of El Alto, and later, after preparation, she will sell them in her sales space. This type of work allows her to generate resources to support the family financially, since she is married and has six children. 

When asked what she likes about Pro Mujer, she says that she likes the trainings and the area of health that the institution offers.

loans.use: to buy groceries wholesale.

loans.name: Santos

texts.es:
Santos es una mujer de 38 años de edad, esta simplemente unido con su esposo con el que tiene nueve hijos de las edades entre seis y veinte años, esta humilde familia vive en una comunidad de Sololá.
Santos para apoyar a su esposo con los gastos de la casa, se dedica a la compra y venta de verduras desde hace diez años, esta labor lo realiza ella en la plaza de su comunidad.
Santos ahora ha tenido la iniciativa de comprar cebollas por millar para luego venderlos, pero una de las dificultades que ella tiene es que no cuenta con suficiente capital para poder realizar este negocio, por lo que ahora acude a un crédito.
Santos tiene las esperanzas de conseguir el crédito para poder hacer este negocio y mejorar sus ganancias para luego construir otra casa para sus hijos.
texts.en:
Santos is a 38-year-old woman. She is married and has nine children who are between six and twenty years old. This humble family lives in a community called Sololá. In order to help her husband with the home expenses, Santos has been working buying and selling vegetables at the community’s marketplace for ten years.

Santos has now decided to buy onions in bulk to sell. However, she does not have enough money to do it, which is why she is requesting a loan.

Santos hopes to receive the loan so that she can complete this business, improve her profits, and be able to build a house for their children in the future.

loans.use: to buy onions in bulk to sell.

loans.name: René Enrique

texts.es:
René es padre de dos niños de las edades entre nueve y trece años, ellos viven en una comunidad de Sololá.
René cuenta que para obtener ingresos y sacar adelante a su familia se dedica a dos actividades él es jornalero y agricultor estas dos labores los realiza el desde hace 23 años, él cuenta que gracias a estas dos actividades sobrevive con su familia.
René a pesar de todos sus esfuerzos y sacrificios no ha logrado construir una cocina para su familia, pues con lo poco que el  gana no ha podido realizarlo, pero él es un hombre optimista y ahora ha decidido solicitar un préstamo para comprar cemento, block, arena y hierro para construir su cocina.
René cuenta con el apoyo de su esposa que juntamente pagaran el préstamo, y su mayor anhelo es poder tener su cocina antes de este año.
texts.en:
René has two children aged nine and thirteen. They live in the community of Sololá. René says that he has two different activities, which help him to generate some income and get ahead with his family. He has been working as a day laborer and as a farmer for twenty-three years. He says that it is thanks to these activities that he and his family can make it through life.

Despite his hard work and sacrifice, René has not been able to build a kitchen for his family. This is because he does not earn enough. However, he is an optimistic man and has decided to request a loan to buy cement, bricks, sand, and iron bars to build his kitchen.

René’s wife will help him to pay the installments. Their wish is to have a kitchen before this year ends.

loans.use: to buy cement, bricks, sand, and iron bars to build a kitchen.

loans.name: Julia

texts.en:
Julia is 38 years old. She now is married and her husband is a driver. Her husband is 37 years old and the couple has two children.
 
Julia makes and sells cheese. She goes to Rio Seco to sell the cheese.

Julia needs a loan to buy more ingredients to make cheese. She wants to improve her life quality. She hopes you can help her again. Julia has her own house but she would like to give it maintenance in the future.

loans.use: to buy more ingredients to make cheese.

loans.name: Grp Musoma Vumilia Group

texts.en:
Bertha, who is in her early 60s, is married and has ten grown children. She has been selling small dried fish for 15 years now. She works from 5 a.m. to 7 p.m. daily and is able to make a very good monthly profit.

This will be Bertha's third loan from Tujijenge Tanzania. She used the previous loans to keep on increasing the dagaa (small dried fish) and has paid all her loans successfully. She used the profit to save in her bank account, repay the loan, take care of herself and her extended family and cover household expenses. She will use this loan to increase her small dried fish stock and meet her customers' demand. She dreams of selling scrappers.

Bertha will share this loan with her loan group " Musoma Vumilia," which has two members who will hold each other accountable for paying back the loan.

loans.use: to increase on the small dried fish stock and meet her customers' demand.

loans.name: Wesley

texts.en: Wesley is 41 years old. He is married with five children. He operates a spare parts and mechanical repair business. He has been in this business for 17 years and it has been profitable. He will be using the loan to purchase additional stock of spare parts, mechanics material and tools and hopes this will help him serve more customers. He will use the income generated to open another business. His hopes and dreams for the future are to expand his business and be successful.

loans.use: To purchase spare parts,mechanical materials and tools

loans.name: Carisma

texts.en:
Carisma, who in her late 30s, is single and has one son who is still at school. She has been running two projects, a tailoring business and a motorcycle transport business. She works from 8 a.m. to 6 p.m. daily and is able to make a good monthly profit.

This will be Carisma's third loan from Tujijenge Tanzania. She used the previous loan to increase her materials and sewing equipment. She bought a motorcycle and has paid back all her loans successfully. She used the profit to pay school fees and cover household expenses.  

She will use this loan to buy materials and sewing equipment and to service her motorcycle. She dreams of buying a fridge and selling sodas, water, juice, etc.

Carisma will make sure she pays back her loan with the loan schedule.

loans.use: to buy materials and sewing equipment and to service her motorcycle.

loans.name: Jenalyn

texts.en:
Jenalyn, 29, is a woman with three children, who are all in school. She is a very hardworking entrepreneur. 

Jenalyn has a food vending business in the Philippines. She has been in this business for six years.

Jenalyn requested a PHP 10,000 loan amount through NWTF to buy ingredients for her food production business. In the future, Jenalyn would like to save enough money so she could afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy ingredients for her food production business.

loans.name: Obai

texts.en:
This is 41-year-old Obai.  He is married and has two children, aged five and three. He has six additional dependents to assist him in his cosmetics business.    

In 2011, Obai established his business to improve his standard of living. Working six days a week, 11 hours a day, he earns about 1,411,000 Sierra Leonean Leone every month. 

Obai has already received and successfully repaid one loan. He would now like a loan of 6,250,000 leone to buy more cartons of soap, body cream, hair cream and other cosmetics and to add to his business capital. 

He hopes that this loan will enable him to increase his monthly profits. In the future, he still plans to expand his business, to buy another vehicle for transport and to educate his children. He thanks you for your support.

loans.use: To buy more cosmetics for his shop

loans.name: Mariatu

texts.en:
Mariatu is married, and has three children aged 13, 8, and 6 years; all are school-going children. She has two additional dependents who live with her to be fostered. 

Mariatu established her ready-made items business - boxers, vests, t-shirts, Lacoste, etc..  Working 6 days a week and 10 hours a day, she earns about Le 5,096,000 every month from this business. 

She would like a loan in the amount of Le 5,000,000. She has already received and successfully repaid four loans, and now requires a new loan in order to buy packages of underwear, boxers, vests, t-shirts, etc. 

In the future, Mariatu plans to develop her land and improve the standard of living for her family.  Her previous plan was partly met, by improving her business by generating more capital from her last loan, but she was unable to rent a shop due to the high rental cost.  

Her major challenge is lack of a shop because it affects her sales during the rainy season.  She thanks you for your support.

loans.use: to buy packages of underwear, boxers, vests and polos

loans.name: Timothy

texts.en:
This is 28-year-old Timothy. He is married, and has one child, aged 5. He has two additional dependents, helping them with their school.  

In 2010, Timothy established his electronic DVD and VCD plates business. He began his business just to improve his income and develop his family. Working six days a week and 11 hours a day, he earns about SLL 1,350,000 every month from this business. 

He would like a loan in the amount of SLL 5,000,000 in order to buy more DVDs, VCD plates and recording materials. He hopes that this loan will enable him to increase his monthly profits. In the future, Timothy plans to increase and expand his business to build a house and to educate his child. He thanks you for your support.

loans.use: To buy more DVDs and VCDs for his shop.

loans.name: Isha

texts.en:
This is 35-year-old Isha.  She is married, and has three children aged 13, 7 and 5 years; all are school-going children. She has six additional dependents who live with her to help in the business.  

In 2009, Isha established her soft and hard drinks business. She began her business because she stopped school at the primary level due to the death of her father, and there was nobody to support her education.  Her aunt fostered and introduced her into the business.  Working 6 days a week and 11 hours a day, she earns about Le 2,558,000 every month from this business. 

Isha would like a loan in the amount of Le 5,000,000. Isha requires a loan in order to buy cartons and crates of assorted drinks - (soft and hard).  

In the future, Isha plans to build a house for her children, and open another outlet.  The loan will act as additional income into the business.   She thanks you for your support.

loans.use: to buy cartons and crates of assorted drinks - (soft and hard).

loans.name: Fanta

texts.en:
This is 37-year-old Fanta.  She is married, and has five children aged 19, 15, 12, 9 and 7 years; all are school-going school. She has two additional dependents who live with her to be fostered.  

In 2007, Fanta established her food stuff business - ground nuts, palm oil, raw fish, peppers, etc.  Working 6 days a week and 10 hours a day, she earns about Le 2,243,000 every month from this business. 

She would like a loan in the amount of Le 5,000,000. Fanta has already received and successfully repaid three loans, and now requires a new loan in order to buy bags of ground nuts, peppers, and gallons of palm oil. 

In the future, Fanta plans to reinvest in the business. She has bought a cow and a motor bike from the profit she generated from the previous loan, and she is now selling wholesale and retailing.   She thanks you for your support.

loans.use: to buy bags of ground nuts, peppers, and gallons of palm oil.

loans.name: Fatmata

texts.en:
This is 43 year-old Fatmata.  She is married, and has three children aged 20, 17 and 4 years; all are school-going children. 

In 1999, Fatmata established her tailoring materials - thread, zips, poplin, designing thread, and assorted materials (etc.) business. She began her business because she stopped her education at the secondary level when her parents divorced, and her father refused to support her education. Later she got married at an early age.  Her husband gave her some amount of money to start her own business, and then she established a tailoring materials shop. Working 6 days a week and 11 hours a day, she earns about Le 4,350,000 every month from this business. 

She would like a loan in the amount of Le 5,000,000. She requires a loan in order to buy dozens of assorted thread, zips, SS cords, buttons etc.  

In the future, Fatmata plans to complete her building projects and improve her business.  Her main challenge is low sales, as schools have not yet reopened.  She thanks you for your support.

loans.use: to buy dozens of assorted thread, zips, SS cords, buttons etc.

loans.name: Alimamy

texts.en: This is Alimamy O. who has 3 children aged 8, 7 and 3 years, One of his children goes to school. In 2012, Alimamy O established his mobile phones and accessories business. Working 6 days a week and 10 hours a day, he earns about Le 5245000/month from this business. He would like a loan of Le 6000000.  Alimamy O has already received and successfully repaid 3 previous loans, and now requires a new loan to buy mobile phones and accessories. The previous loan helped him to pay for a land, freezer and other electrical appliance.  In the future, he plans to complete the payment of the land and build his own house.  He thanks you for your support.

loans.use: to buy mobile phones and accessories.

loans.name: Joel

texts.en: Joel is a business man who has an industrial laundry business, he specializes in denim. He is 37 years old, started five years ago and currently, he has started making his own brand of blue jeans. He is asking for a loan to buy some raw materials for his laundry business.

loans.use: To buy raw materials for the laundry business.

loans.name: Mohamed

texts.en: This is 42 year-old Mohamed.  He is married, and has 3 children aged 15, 13 and 9. In 2000, Mohamed established his building material shop. He began his business just to be self reliant and to improve himself. Working 6 days a week and 11 hours a day, he earns about Le 2,045,000 every month from this business. He would like a loan of Le 5,000,000. Mohamed has successfully repaid 2 previous loans, and now requires a new loan to buy a motor bike for additional income. He hopes that this loan will enable him to increase his monthly profits and to create additional income in his business.   In the future, Mohamed plans to develop his business, to educate his children to higher level and to build another house. The loan has been a source of added income.  He thanks you for your support.

loans.use: To buy motor bike

loans.name: Jikereen

texts.en:
As a married parent of four children, Jikereen works hard to support her family.

She has a dried fish making business in the Philippines, and also earns additional income from a general store. Jikereen is borrowing PHP 6000 through NWTF, to buy more fish, and other materials for her dried fish making business.

Jikereen has been sustaining her business activities through a previous from NWTF. She hopes that her hard work will help her attain her dream to save enough money, so she can send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy more fish and other materials for her business

loans.name: Marivic

texts.en:
Marivic, 41, is a married woman with four children, two of whom are currently in school. She is a very hardworking entrepreneur. 

Marivic has a fish vending business in the Philippines. She has been in this business for two years.  

Marivic requested a PHP 5,000 loan amount through NWTF to buy more fish to sell.

She would like to save enough money so she could afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy more fish to sell.

loans.name: Josefina

texts.en:
Josefina is 55 years old and has three children. Josefina works very hard to provide for them.

Josefina runs a general store in the Philippines. She has been in this business for two years now.  

Josefina requested a PHP 12,000 loan through NWTF to buy items to sell in her general store like canned goods, eggs, home care products and other groceries.

Josefina would like to save enough to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: to buy items to sell in her general store like canned goods, eggs, home care products and other groceries.

loans.name: Mary Jane

texts.en:
Mary Jane, 40, is a married woman with two children, one of whom is still in school. She is a very hardworking entrepreneur. 

Mary Jane has a dried-fish-making business in the Philippines. She has been in this business for 20 years.

Mary Jane requested a PHP 7,000 loan amount through NWTF to purchase more fish and other materials for making dried fish. She would like to save enough to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: to purchase more fish and other materials for making dried fish.

loans.name: Linda

texts.en:
Linda, 58, is a married woman with nine children, one of  whom is in school. She is a very hardworking entrepreneur. 

Linda has a buy and sell rice business in the Philippines. She has been in this business for 23 years.

Linda requested a PHP 10,000 loan amount through NWTF to buy additional sacks of rice to sell.

In the future, Linda would like to save enough to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: to buy additional sacks of rice to sell.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy dozens of jeans, sets of dishes, bales of assorted cottons, packet lace, brillian etc.

loans.name: Jorge Alejandro

texts.en: Jorge is 39 years old, divorced and has three sons. He has owned his hardware store for over 17 years.  He says that through hard work he has been able to support his family, achieve financial stability and even invest in other small business. He is asking for a loan to restock his store, he enjoys his work and hopes to continue to make it grow.

loans.use: To restock the inventory of his hardware store.

loans.name: Diana

texts.en: Diana is 33 years old, married and has two sons ages 14 and 5. She has a food stall were she serves shakes rich in vitamins and proteins.
