She is asking for a loan to buy more nutritional supplements for her business. She says that she enjoys working and has been able to support her family, grow as a person and get a house.

loans.use: To buy nutritional products for her food stall.

loans.name: Anonymous Group
loans.use: to 1 sack of "atiéké" (grated and fermented cassava pulp) and 5 liters of cooking oil

loans.name: Gerardo

texts.es:
El socio pertenece al banco comunal “Siempre Juntos” ,el socio agradece y valora el préstamo y se compromete a cumplir con el pago de sus cuotas mensuales con mucha responsabilidad.
El socio Gerardo sigue  dedicándose al negocio de elaboración de colchones, el socio es una persona responsable y empeñoso, él socio continua vendiendo los colchones a sus clientes que le solicitan, siendo de esta manera que el socio saca adelante a su familia.
El socio solicita el crédito para la compra de espumas, entre otros.
texts.en:
This member belongs to the Siempre Juntos communal bank. He is grateful for and values the loan and promises to make the monthly payments with great responsibility.

Gerardo continues to work in his business making mattresses. He is a very responsible and persevering person. He continues selling his mattresses to the customers who ask for them, and in this way he gets his family ahead.

The member asks for the loan to purchase foam and more.

loans.use: to purchase foam, and more.

loans.name: Adelaida

texts.en:
Adelaida is a married woman with eight children. Adelaida is 48 years old and three of her children who are in school. She is a very hard working entrepreneur. 

Adelaida has a retail beauty product business in the Philippines. Adelaida requested a PHP 10000 loan amount through NWTF, to buy items like roll on, lotion, etc. for sale.

Adelaida has been in this business for 13 years. In the future, Adelaida would like to save enough money to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy items like roll on, lotion, etc. for sale.

loans.name: Ramos

texts.es: Ramos es una mujer de 44 años que se encuentra profundamente agradecida por el préstamo anterior que le permitió poder instalar su energía eléctrica en su hogar, por lo que su vida fue beneficiada de gran forma, ella cuenta que antes del crédito, su familia sufría de carencias de la energía eléctrica y de agua pero ahora gracias a Dios y al apoyo de ustedes Ramos tiene una mejor condición de vida, Ramos ahora solicita un nuevo préstamo para invertirlo en su pequeña tienda que ha emprendido hace poco, comprando así los siguientes productos, recitos, dulces, gaseosas. Ella tiene las esperanzas de conseguir el crédito, para nuevamente tener un impacto de mejoría en su familia.
texts.en: Ramos is a 44-year-old woman who is profoundly grateful for the previous loan which allowed her to install electricity in her home, through which her life has benefited greatly. She says that, before the loan, her family suffered from the lack of electricity and water, but now, thanks to God and your support, Ramos has a better living condition. Ramos now asks for another loan to invest it in her small store that she has recently undertaken, purchasing the following supplies, Ricitos snacks, sweets, and soft drinks. She has the hope of getting the loan, to again make a positive impact on her family.

loans.use: to purchase products for her store such as Ricitos snacks, sweets, and soft drinks.

loans.name: Luz Abigail

texts.es:
Luz es una mujer de 20 años de edad, es casada tiene una linda familia de dos hijos de las edades entre dos y tres años, esta bonita familia vive en una comunidad de Sololá.
Luz con el afán de apoyar a su esposo con los ingresos de la casa trabaja desde hace cinco años en oficios domésticos, ella cuenta que gracias a esta labor ha logrado sacar adelante a su familia.
Luz una mujer que se preocupa por las necesidades de su familia, y que ahora se a dado cuenta que una de las necesidades más prioritarias es terminar la construcción de su casa, a pesar de todo el esfuerzo que ella hace con su esposo no han logrado terminar, por lo que ella a decidido solicitar un préstamo que lo utilizara para comprar cemento block, arena para repellar la casa y que tenga una bonita vista.
El gran sueño de luz es tener su casa terminada este año y seguir mejorando su casa.
texts.en:
Luz is a 20-year-old woman, married, and has a lovely family of two children between the ages of 2 and 3. This nice family lives in a community in Sololá.

Luz, with the desire to support her husband with the household income, has worked for the past five years in domestic work. She says that, thanks to this work, she has managed to get her family ahead.

Luz is a woman who is concerned for her family's need, and now she realizes that one of the needs of highest priority is to finish the construction of her house. Despite all the efforts that she and her husband make, they have not managed to finish it. So, she has decided to ask for a loan which will be used to purchase cement, concrete blocks, and sand to replaster her house so it looks good.

Luz's great dream is to have her house finished this year and continue improving her house.

loans.use: to purchase cement, concrete blocks, and sand to replaster her house.

loans.name: Edith

texts.es:
La socia Edith vive en la ciudad del Cusco al sur del Perú, ella pertenece al banco comunal "SIEMPRE JUNTOS", la socia sigue  trabajando en una entidad pública, la socia lleva buen tiempo con su trabajo el cual le va bien gracias al empeño que le pone cada día a su negocio, la socia es una persona responsable, siendo de esta manera que la socia saca adelante a su familia.
La socia solicita el crédito para la compra de un electrodoméstico.
texts.en: Edith lives in the city of Cusco, in Southern Peru. She belongs to the SIEMPRE JUNTOS communal bank. She still works for a publicly-owned company. She has been working in this job for a long time, and she is doing well thanks to her daily effort. Edith is responsible, and this is how she supports her family. She is requesting the loan to buy an electrical appliance.

loans.use: to buy an electrical appliance.

loans.name: Maria Luisa

texts.en:
Maria Luisa is 54 years old, married with five children. Two of her children are still in school, Maria Luisa works very hard to provide for them.

Maria Luisa runs a general store in the Philippines and requested a PHP 7000 loan through NWTF, to buy additional stock of canned goods, shampoo, soft-drinks, coffee, etc. to sell at her store.  Maria Luisa has been in this business for 3 years. 

She would like to save enough money to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy more stocks of canned goods, shampoo, soft-drinks, coffee, etc. for sale.

loans.name: Marlon David

texts.es: Marlon es un joven de 19 años de edad,  Marlon vive con su madre y sus 2 hermanos, su madre se dedica  a  la crianza de animales y ella es quien  le enseña a esta actividad a sus hijos, Marlon no tuvo la oportunidad de terminar sus estudios y por este motivo trabaja al jornal y a la ganadería, Marlon necesita el dinero del crédito para  comprar terneros ya que  esta actividad es la que  le permite tener sus ingresos, la aspiración de Marlon es la de mejorar su negocio y salir adelante con su familia.
texts.en: Marlon is a 19-year-old young man. Marlon lives with his mother and his two siblings. His mother works raising animals and she is the one who taught this work to her children. Marlon didn't have the opportunity to finish his schooling and for this reason, he works as a day laborer and in animal husbandry. Marlon needs the money from the loan to purchase calves since this activity is what allows him to have an income. Marlon's aspiration is to improve his business and get ahead with his family.

loans.use: to purchase calves.

loans.name: Faustino

texts.es:
Faustino un hombre de 50 años de edad, es casado tiene una linda familia de nueve hijos de las edades entre seis y treinta y dos años, esta humilde familia vive en una comunidad de Sololá.
Faustino para generar sus ingresos y mantener a su familia se dedica a la albañilería desde hace veinticinco años, sus años de experiencia lo han llevado a construcciones muy importantes, él cuenta que esta labor es su único fuente de ingresos pues ya no se dedica a otra cosa.
Este gran hombre se preocupa mucho por las necesidades de su familia y  una de las más principales ahora es terminar la construcción de su casa, aunque él se ha esforzado mucho por terminarlo, su salario ya no se da abasto por lo que a tomado la decisión de solicitar un préstamo que lo utilizara para comprar cemento, cal , arena, block, y hierro para los acabados de la construcción de la casa.
Faustino sueña con seguir mejorando la apariencia de su casa, para que su familia tenga un hogar digno.
texts.en:
Faustino is a 50-year-old man. He is married and has a lovely family of nine children between the ages of six and thirty-two. This humble family lives in a community in Sololá.

Faustino, to generate his income and support his family, has worked in bricklaying for the past twenty-five years. His years of experience have brought him to important construction sites. He says that this work is his only source of income, since he doesn't work doing anything else.

This great man is very concerned about his family's needs and one of the primary ones now is to finish building his house. Although he has worked very hard to finish it, his earnings are not enough, so he has decided to ask for a loan that he will use to purchase cement, lime, sand, concrete blocks, and iron to finish the construction on the house.

Faustino dreams of continuing to improve the appearance of his house so that his family has a respectable home.

loans.use: to purchase cement, lime, sand, concrete blocks, and iron to finish constructing his house.

loans.name: Nuvia Consuelo

texts.es: Nuvia es una señora de 47 años de edad, ella está divorciada  y tiene  3 hijos,  Nubia creció en el campo y se dedica a la crianza de animales menores, comenta que cría cuyes  pequeñitos y cuando ya crecen los comercializa para tener sus ingresos, el crédito lo va a invertir en la compra de cuyes para tenerlos en cuyeras y seguir trabajando  en su negocio y esto le permita  sacar adelante con sus hijos.
texts.en: Nuvia is a 47-year-old woman. She is divorced and has 3 children. Nuvia grew up in the countryside and works raising small animals. She says that she raises small guinea pigs and when they grow, she sells them to have an income. The loan will be invested in the purchase of guinea pigs to keep them in guinea pig cages and to continue working in her business and this will allow her to get her children ahead.

loans.use: to purchase guinea pigs.

loans.name: David

texts.es:
David es un hombre de 25 años de edad, vive con su pareja, tiene un hijo varón de 1 año, y su negocio es la producción de estuco.
Él es emprendedor, independiente, paciente, fuerte, responsable y trabajador. Su negocio lo desarrolla en la provincia ‘Vichaya’ que se caracteriza por tener una composición demográfica Aymará, en estas tierras de los “hombres águila” se puede destacar muchas riquezas, como; su templo franciscano, construido en 1560 y declarado Monumento Nacional, el cual atesora importantes lienzos de pintura del Siglo XVIII, y otros. De clima frío y seco con una temperatura que varía durante el día entre 0-12 grados centígrados
David es de tez morena, cabello negro corto, baja estatura, ojos pardos, complexión física delgada, su lengua materna es el Aymará que se habla en el lugar y habla español por cultura general y por el comercio que realiza. su vida la comparte con su pareja que se dedica a la producción de estuco y con su hijo que es un bebé, viven en una casa propia de la familia construida de adobe con techo de calamina y cuenta con energía eléctrica, para conseguir agua debe aproximarse al arroyo que queda a 10 minutos de distancia caminando. Su negocio es la producción de estuco; que es una pasta de grano fino compuesta de cal apagada, mármol pulverizado y pigmentos naturales, que se endurece por reacción química al entrar en contacto el carbonato cálcico de la cal con el dióxido de carbono y se utiliza sobre todo para enlucir paredes y techos. Su trabajo consiste en explotar desde la roca misma hasta convertirlo en su producto final, labor que realiza todos los días de la semana durante el día. “inicié esta actividad por herencia de mi padre que se dedica al mismo negocio…” comenta. La ventaja de su negocio es que trabaja junto a su esposa, la desventaja es que el arroyo queda lejos. Su sueño es tener un terreno propio donde poder explotar la roca, él desea realizar la compra de tola y abono para producir estuco. Esta es la 1 secuencia de préstamos con la institución en 2 años que realiza esta actividad de forma independiente.
Es por esos motivos que David solicita un préstamo para la compra de tola y abono para producir estuco.
texts.en:
David is a 25-year-old man, lives with his partner, and has a 1-year-old son and his business is making stucco. 

He is enterprising, independent, strong, responsible and hard-working. His business is located in Vichaya province, which is characterized by having an Aymará demographic. In these lands of the "Eagle men," many treasures stand out such as a Franciscan temple, build in 1560 and declared a National Monument, which has a stockpile of important canvases of paintings from the 18th century, and more. It has a cold and dry climate with a temperature that varies during the day between 0-12 degrees centigrade. 

David has dark skin, short black hair, is short, has dark eyes, is thin, his native language is Aymará, which he speaks in this place and he speaks Spanish due to the general culture and for the work he does. He shares his life with his partner who works making stucco and with their child who is a baby. They live in their own family house made of adobe with a metal sheeting roof and which has electricity. To get water, they go to a stream that is about 10 minutes away by walking. His business is making stucco, which is a paste of fine grains made up of lime powder, pulverized marble, and natural colors, which hardens through a chemical reaction when the calcium carbonate of the lime is in contact with carbon dioxide, and is used mostly to whiten walls and roofs. His work consists of breaking up the rock itself all the way to making the final product, work that he does every day of the week during the daytime. "I began this work by inheritance from my father who also works in the same business..." he says. The advantage of his business is that he works with his partner. The disadvantage is that the stream is far away. His dream is to have his own land where he can get the rocks. He wants to purchase clay and manure to produce stucco. This is is first loan cycle with the institution in the 2 years that he has done this work independently. 

For these reasons, David asks for a loan to purchase clay and manure to make stucco.

loans.use: to purchase clay and manure to make stucco.

loans.name: Haller Wilfredo

texts.es:
El socio Haller pertenece al banco comunal SIEMPRE JUNTOS, él socio continua  dedicándose a su  negocio de compra y venta de celulares y accesorios, él socio lleva buen tiempo con su negocio el cual le va bien gracias al empeño que le pone cada día a su negocio, el socio continua vendiendo carcasas, estuches, laminas protectoras para celulares entre otros, siendo de esta manera que el socio saca adelante a su familia.
EL socio solicita el crédito para la compra de estuches, laminas, carcasas entre otros.
texts.en:
Haller belongs to the Siempre Juntos communal bank. He continues working buying and selling cell phones and accessories. He has been doing this business for a good while, which is going well for him thanks to the dedication that he puts into his business each day. He continues selling cases, protective screens for cell phones, and more. This is the way that he gets his family ahead.

He asks for the loan to purchase cases, protective screens, and more.

loans.use: to purchase cases, protective screens, and more.

loans.name: Yenny Roxana

texts.es:
La socia pertenece al banco comunal SIEMPRE JUNTOS,la socia sigue dedicándose a su negocio de venta de papelería , la socia se siente agradecida por el crédito otorgado y se compromete a cumplir con sus cuotas establecidas, la socia continua vendiendo lo que son lapiceros,papeles,cuadernos entre otros, la socia desea poder seguir trabajando para de esta forma seguir apoyando a su familia.
La socia solicita el crédito para la compra de papeles  y para algunos gastos personales.
texts.en:
Yenny belongs to the Siempre Juntos communal bank. She continues working in paper sales. She is grateful for the granted loan and promises to make the established payments. She continues selling pencil cases, paper, notebooks and more. She wants to be able to continue working and in this way continue supporting her family. 

She asks for the loan to purchase paper and also for some personal expenses.

loans.use: to purchase paper and for some personal expenses.

loans.name: Mary Joy

texts.en:
Mary Joy is a married woman with five children. She is a very hardworking entrepreneur. Mary Joy is 40 years old and has four children presently in school.

Mary Joy has a general store business in the Philippines. Mary Joy requested a 7,000 Philippines Peso (PHP) loan amount through NWTF to purchase more groceries to sell like canned goods, shampoo, noodles, spices, bread, and other items.

Mary Joy has been in this business for one year. She would like to save enough money so she could afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to purchase more groceries to sell like canned goods, shampoo, noodles, spices, bread, and other items.

loans.name: Ma. Nida

texts.en:
Ma. Nida is a woman with eight children. She is a very hardworking entrepreneur. Ma. Nida is 55 years old now.

Ma. Nida has a general store business in the Philippines and requested a 10,000 Philippines Peso (PHP) loan amount through NWTF to buy items to sell in her general store like canned goods, home product care and other groceries.

Ma. Nida has been in this business for two years. In the future, she would like to save enough to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: to buy items to sell in her general store like canned goods, home product care and other groceries.

loans.name: Mila

texts.en:
Mila is 46 years old and married with three children. With two children in school, Mila works very hard to provide for them.

Mila runs a general store in the Philippines and requested an 8,000 Philippines Peso (PHP) loan through NWTF to buy items to sell like noodles, home product care and other groceries.

Mila has been in this business for 22 years now. 

In the future, she would like to save enough money so she could afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy items to sell like noodles, home product care and other groceries

loans.name: Ralona

texts.en:
Ralona is a married woman with five children. She is a very hardworking entrepreneur. Ralona is 45 years old and has three children who are in school.

Ralona has a food vending business in the Philippines and requested an 18,000 Philippines Peso (PHP) loan amount through NWTF to buy ingredients for her food production business.

She has been in this business for five years. In the future, Ralona would like to save enough money so she could afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy ingredients for her food production business

loans.name: Mery Group

texts.es:
El grupo solidario Mery está conformado por tres mujeres cordiales y emprendedoras, originarias de Bilwi, todas son de la etnia miskita (Lizayda Lesbia, Estela Dionicia y Carmelita). Son mujeres que luchan día a día para llevar el sustento a sus hogares, por medio de la venta de ropa usada. Con el propósito de tener acceso a crédito se organizaron hace 6 meses, para tener la oportunidad de mejorar su nivel de ingresos y calidad de vida.

Lizayda Lesbia: Es una joven de 23 años, con cualidades de líder, trabajadora. Es la coordinadora del grupo solidario. Está casada, tiene 2 hijos menores de edad. Su esposo trabaja de manera informal como albañil. Ella con el propósito de tener su propia fuente de ingresos, contribuir con los gastos del hogar, desde hace 3 años vende ropa usada en un tramo que alquila en uno de los mercados del Bilwi. Está solicitando financiamiento para poder surtir su negocio e incrementar sus ingresos, comprar en Managua una paca mixta de ropa usada y venderla a precios accesibles a su clientela de Bilwi. Ella sueña con ser una comerciante exitosa y tener su propio local.
texts.en: The Mery solidarity group has 3 women members. Lizayda Lesbia, Estela Dionicia y Carmelita are all from Bilwi, are friendly and enterprising and are of Miskita ethnic origin. They work hard every day, selling used clothing to maintain their households. They formed their group 6 months ago so they could obtain a loan to boost their income and improve their quality of life. Lizayda Lesbia, a young woman of 23, is hardworking and a born leader. She is the group's coordinator. She is married with two young children and her husband works on a casual basis as a builder. As she wants to have her own source of income and be able to contribute to the household expenses, she has been selling used clothing for the last 3 years on a pitch which she rents in one of Bilwi's markets. She is seeking financial support to enable her to stock her business, boost her income, buy a bale of mixed second hand clothing in Managua and sell it at reasonable prices to her customers in Bilwi. She dreams of becoming a successful business woman and of having her own premises.

loans.use: to buy a mixed bale of second hand clothing in Managua

loans.name: Matilde

texts.en:
Matilde is 58 years old and married with three children. She works very hard to provide for them.

Matilde runs a general store in the Philippines and requested a 7,000 Philippines Peso (PHP) loan through NWTF to purchase more groceries to sell like canned goods, shampoo, noodles, spices, bread, and other items.

Matilde has been in this business for nine years.

She would like to save enough to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: to purchase more groceries to sell like canned goods, shampoo, noodles, spices, bread, and other items.

loans.name: Rosemarie

texts.en:
Rosemarie is married and has one child. She works hard to support her family. She has a food vending business in the Philippines and earns additional income from a general store. 

Rosemarie is requesting her fifth loan from NWTF for 8,000 PHP, which she will use to buy ingredients for her food production business. She hopes that her hard work will help to save enough to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: to purchase ingredients for her food production business

loans.name: Rafael Enrique

texts.es: Rafael es un joven de 20 años de edad, Rafael  vive en una casa por la que paga arriendo, Rafael tiene nacionalidad colombiana y comenta que se vino de Colombia a Ecuador buscando una vida tranquila sin enfrentamientos y comenta que en la actualidad si  está contento de la vida que tienen y también con tu negocio que es la crianza de chanchos. Rafael necesita el dinero del crédito en la compra de chanchos ya que en la actualidad no tiene chanchos pero con el dinero del crédito va a comprar y seguir adelante en su negocio.  Rafael es empleado en la lechera donde hacen quesos, Rafael tiene la aspiración de seguir trabajando de una buena manera, mejorar su negocio y  luchar por un buen futuro.
texts.en: Rafael is a young man of 20. He lives in a rented house. He is a Colombian and says that he came to Ecuador in search of a quiet life without confrontation. He says that he is currently happy with his life and his business rearing pigs. Rafael needs money in the form of a loan to buy pigs as he does not have any at the moment. The loan money will enable him to buy some and keep his business up and running. Rafael is also employed in a dairy where cheese is made. His ambition is to continue working well, improve his business and work hard to have a successful future.

loans.use: to buy pigs

loans.name: Maria Teresa

texts.es: Maria de 53 años de edad vive en casa propia con su hija, ella se dedica a la siembra de maíz y frijol tiene más de 27 años de dedicarse a ese rubro el cual inicio con capital propio, cuando su cosecha ya esta lista la almacena en sacos como muestra la fotografía para luego comercializarlos en los diferentes mercados que se encuentran cerca de su casa, con las ganancias que obtiene puede salir adelante con los gastos del hogar, ella está solicitando un crédito para la compra de semillas, fertilizantes, abonos, controles de plagas, herbicidas, fertilizantes, etc. y así poder seguir con su trabajo para tener mejores ingresos.
texts.en:
Maria, age 53, lives in her own house with her daughter.  She has been growing corn and beans for over 27 years.  She started with her own capital.  

When her harvest is ready, she stores it in sacks, as shown in the photo.  She then sells them at the different markets that are close to her house.  With the earnings she gets she is able to get ahead with the household expenses.

She is requesting a loan to buy seeds, fertilizers, compost, pesticides, and herbicides, etc.  This way she will be able to continue working in order to have better income.

loans.use: to buy seeds, fertilizers, compost, pesticides, and herbicides, etc.

loans.name: Kenanga Indah Group

texts.en:
The Kenanga Indah group made the previous loan payment of 21,000,000 IDR to MUK on time. They say that there was an increasing profit they earned during the loan period of six months. The pigs grew fat and healthy. They can sell the pigs at a high price because there is lots of demand from the market. The situation stimulated their spirits to run the business. 

The group hopes the cooperation between MUK, Kiva and the clients continues smoothly and lasts longer. 

Ni Komang is the leader, controlling and monitoring the members of her group. She is helped by other boards. She sold all her pigs and earned a satisfactory profit. She saved all the profit and will use it for business capital later.

The Kenanga Indah group received their new loan. The loan use is for increasing the number of piglets, renovating the cages and purchasing superior feed. The group still needs a loan until they have enough capital to run their businesses by themselves. Now they already have savings and will use it for capital.

Ni Komang and the members feel happy receiving the support all this time from lenders, Kiva and MUK. She’ll use the loan to purchase two superior piglets, vitamins and feed. She hopes she can have enough savings soon and continue the business by herself.

loans.use: to purchase two superior piglets, vitamins and feed

loans.name: Mediatrix

texts.en:
Mediatrix is a married woman who is 58 years old with three children. She is a very hardworking entrepreneur.

Mediatrix has a dried fish making business in the Philippines. Mediatrix requested a PHP 7,000 loan amount through NWTF to buy more fish, sacks of salt, additional bamboo and other materials for her business.

Mediatrix has been in this business for five years. She would like to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy more fish, sacks of salt, additional bamboo and other materials for her business

loans.name: Melly

texts.en:
Melly works hard to support her family. Melly is single and has a buying and selling of vegetables business in the Philippines.

Melly requested a PHP 7,000 loan through NWTF to purchase more vegetables to sell like eggplant, radishes, cabbages, carrots, potatoes, sweet potatoes, etc.

Melly has been in this business for five years now, and also earns additional income from a general store.

She would like to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to purchase more vegetables to sell like eggplant, radishes, cabbages, carrots, potatoes, sweet potatoes, etc.

loans.name: Mila Lona

texts.en:
Mila Lona works hard to support her family. Mila Lona is widowed and has a food-vending business in the Philippines.

Mila Lona requested a PHP 5,000 loan through NWTF to buy ingredients for her food-production business.

Mila Lona has been in this business for five years now, and also earns additional income from buying and selling frozen products.

She would like to save enough money so she could afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy ingredients for her food-production business

loans.name: Nemia

texts.en:
Nemia is a married woman. She is 64 years old with nine children. She is a very hardworking entrepreneur.

Nemia has a dried fish making business in the Philippines. Nemia requested a PHP 7,000 loan amount through NWTF to buy more fish, sacks of salt and other materials for her business.

Nemia has been in this business for 24 years. She would like to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy more fish, sacks of salt and other materials for her business

loans.name: Sarah Jane

texts.en:
Sarah Jane is a 24-year-old mother of one child. She is a very hardworking entrepreneur.  

Sarah Jane has a business selling cell phone airtime credit in the Philippines. She has requested a loan of 10,000 PHP through Negros Women for Tomorrow Foundation in order to buy additional cell phones for her business.

Sarah Jane has been in this business for 2 years. In the future, she would like to save money so she can expand her business.

loans.use: to buy additional cell phones for her business

loans.name: Perla

texts.en:
Perla is a married woman with three children. She is a very hardworking entrepreneur. Perla is 51 years old, and all three children are still in school.

Perla has a dried fish making business in the Philippines. Perla requested a PHP 5,000 loan amount through NWTF to buy more fish, salt and other materials for her business.

Perla has been in this business for 20 years. She would like to save enough money so she could afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy more fish, salt and other materials for her business

loans.name: Adelina

texts.en:
Adelina is 46 years old and married with six children.

Adelina works hard to provide for her family. She runs a general store in the Philippines and requested a PHP 18,000 loan through NWTF to buy items to sell like canned goods, beverages, home care products and other groceries.

Adelina has borrowed and paid five loans from NWTF before this loan. She has been running the general store for two years and also earns an income from fish vending.

Adelina aspires to save enough money so she could afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy items to sell like canned goods, beverages, home care products and other groceries

loans.name: Anabel

texts.en:
Anabel is 41 years old and married with five children.

Anabel works hard to provide for her family. She runs a general store in the Philippines and requested a PHP 8,000 loan through NWTF to buy items to sell like canned goods, eggs, home care products and other groceries.

Anabel has borrowed and paid three loans from NWTF before this loan. She has been running the general store for 10 years and also earns an income from buying and selling rice.

Anabel aspires to save enough money so she could afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy items to sell like canned goods, eggs, home care products and other groceries

loans.name: Precilla

texts.en:
As a married parent of three children, Precilla works hard to support her family.

She has a purified water business in the Philippines, and also earns additional income from food vending. Precilla is borrowing PHP 7,000 through NWTF to purchase additional water filter products and bottled water and pay for maintenance for her machine for her purified water business.

Precilla has been sustaining her business activities through her past loan from NWTF. She hopes that her hard work will help her attain her dream to save enough to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: to purchase additional water filter products and bottled water and pay for maintenance for her machine

loans.name: Angelyn

texts.en:
Angelyn is 25 years old and has four children. Angelyn is married, and three of her children are in school.

Angelyn is in the agricultural business of raising pigs in the Philippines and requested a PHP 4,000 loan through NWTF to buy feeds and other supplies to raise her livestock.

Angelyn has been in this business for two years now, and has borrowed three times in the past from NWTF to sustain it.

In the future, Angelyn would like to save enough money so she could afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy feeds and other supplies to raise her livestock

loans.name: Rachel

texts.en:
As a married parent of five children, Rachel works hard to support her family.

She has a dried fish making business in the Philippines, and also earns additional income from selling ready-to-wear clothing. Rachel is borrowing PHP 7,000 through NWTF to purchase more fish and other materials for her dried fish making business.

Rachel has been sustaining her business activities through her past loan from NWTF. She hopes that her hard work will help her attain her dream to save enough money so she could afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to purchase more fish and other materials for her dried fish making business

loans.name: Cecilia

texts.en:
Cecilia is a married woman with six children. She is a very hardworking entrepreneur. Cecilia is 52 years old, and two of her children are in school.

Cecilia has a fruit-vending business in the Philippines. Cecilia requested a PHP 10,000 loan amount through NWTF to buy additional stock of fruits to sell in her business.

Cecilia has been in this business for 35 years. In the future, Cecilia would like to save enough money so she could afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy additional stock of fruits to sell in her business

loans.name: Maria De Jesus

texts.es:
María, de 37 años de edad, está casada y tiene 2 hijas que están estudiando en la escuela de su comunidad.  

María, se dedica a la crianza de cerdos y a la elaboración de queso, estas actividades las aprendió de su abuela, quien dedicó toda su vida a la crianza de animales domésticos.- Hoy en día estas actividad le sirven para conseguir los recursos necesarios y poder satisfacer las necesidades básicas de su familia.

El dinero será utilizado para comprar materiales para reparar las instalaciones donde crecen los cerdos, ya que al comenzar el invierno, los animales se mojan por las lluvias.- También comprará leche para la elaboración de quesos, de esta manera obtendrá un mejor beneficio económico para su familia.

Los sueños de María, son establecer su granja de cerdos de manera más formal, ya que planea construir instalaciones más adecuadas para el cuido de los cerdos y comprar ganado lechero, para aumentar la elaboración  de queso.
texts.en:
María is 37 years old, married, and has two daughters studying in the school of the community.

María makes a living raising pigs and making cheese. She learned these activities from her grandmother, who devoted all of her life to raising domestic animals. Today these activities serve to secure the necessary resources to meet the basic needs of the family.

The money will be used to purchase materials to repair the facilities where she raises pigs. Since the start of winter, the animals get wet by the rain. Also she will buy milk to make cheese. In this way she can get better economic benefit for her family.

María's dream is to establish her farm more formally, as she plans to construct more adequate facilities for the care of the pigs and to buy dairy cattle, to increase her production of cheese.

loans.use: to purchase materials to repair the facilities where pigs are raised and buy milk for making cheese.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: buy a stock of used clothing

loans.name: Enrique

texts.es:
Enrique, de 35 años de edad, no estudio, está casado y tiene 2 hijos que asisten a la escuela de su comunidad.

Enrique, tiene una amplia experiencia en realizar trabajos agrícolas y en la ganadería, pues práctica estas actividades desde que era un niño y las continúa realizando, ya que se han convertido en su principal fuente de ingresos, con la cual puede satisfacer las necesidades de su hogar.- A la actividad de ganadería se suma la ayuda de su esposa y su hijo mayor, quien trabaja por las tardes porque en la mañana estudia.

El dinero será utilizado para comprar una vaca preñada y para comprar concentrado y vitaminas para la buena salud de su ganado, de esta manera tendrá mejores ingresos, pues aumentara la producción de productos lácteos para la venta.

Las metas de Enrique son apoyar en la educación de sus hijos y comprar más ganado y aumentar la producción de leche.- También desea cultivar hortalizas porque tiene un terreno que está bien adecuado para este tipo de trabajo y crianza de ganado.
texts.en:
Enrique, age 35, did not go to school.  His is married and has two children, who go to the community school.

Enrique has extensive experience doing agricultural work and working with livestock.  He has engaged in these business activities ever since he was a boy.  He continues doing this work, and it has become his main source of income.  With this income he is able to meet the needs of his household.

His wife and his oldest son help with the livestock business.  His son works in the afternoons because he goes to school in the morning.

He will use the loan to buy a pregnant cow and to buy concentrated feed and vitamins for the good health of his livestock.  This way he will have better income.  It will increase the production of dairy products to sell.

Enrique’s goals are to support his children’s education, to buy more livestock, and to increase milk production.  He also wishes to grow vegetables because he has land that is well suited to this type of work and for raising livestock.

loans.use: to buy a pregnant cow and to buy concentrated feed and vitamins for the good health of his livestock.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to purchase rice, beverage, flour, and oil

loans.name: Hanitriniaina

texts.fr:
Hanitriniaina est une femme de 29 ans séparée du père de son 2 enfants dont elle a la charge. Elle vit  avec sa mère au sein du même foyer dans un quartier périphérique d’Antsirabe. Cette famille composée de femmes doit se battre au quotidien pour améliorer sa situation et assurer les besoins quotidien sans homme à la maison.

Elle est partenaire de Vahatra depuis 1 ans. Elle tient un petit commerce  qui propose des produits comme des montres, des sacs, des pochettes, des radios, des lampes. Elle mène son activité de manière ambulante dans les vilalges alentours ce qui demande du courage et de long déplacement à pied.

Ce prêt lui permettrait de diversifier les produits qu’elle propose à vendre et augmenter son chiffre d'affaire. Elle compte ainsi acheter des parapluies, des couvertures et des bassines en plastique.
texts.en:
Hanitriniaina is a 29 year old woman, who is separated from the father of her two children of whom she has custody. She lives in a household with her mother in a suburb of Antsirabe. This family of women has to fight daily to improve living conditions and ensure their daily needs without a man living with them.

She has been a partner of Vahatra for a year. She runs a small business selling products such as watches, bags, clutch bags, radios, and lamps. She carries out her activity on an itinerant basis in the local villages, which demands much courage and a considerable amount of walking.

This loan will enable her to diversify her offer and increase her revenue. She plans to buy umbrellas, blankets and plastic bowls.

loans.use: to make wholesale purchase of watches, radios, bags and belts.

loans.name: Nivosoa Laurence

texts.fr:
Nivasoa Laurence est une jeune femme de 21 ans déjà très dynamique. Elle est mariée et a un petit garçon en bas âge. La famille vit dans la commune urbaine d’Antsirabe dont elle est originaire. Dès sa majorité, elle a commencé à prendre ses responsabilités et a choisi de se lancer dans la création de sa propre activité. Elle a débuté en louant quelques jeux vidéo devant son domicile puis a pu acquérir progressivement un peu de matériel. 

Le partenariat avec Vahatra perdure depuis 2 ans. Elle compte utiliser ce prêt pour acheter de nouveaux jeux vidéo et pour investir dans des équipements audio-visuel (télévision, console, manettes…) dans l’optique, à plus long terme, d’ouvrir à la clientèle une véritable salle de jeux.

Grâce à son activité, elle a déjà réussi à acquérir quelques meubles et espère, à l’avenir, pouvoir un jour construire sa propre maison.
texts.en:
Nivasoa Laurence is a very dynamic woman at the still young age of twenty-one. She is married and has one boy still in infancy. The family lives in the urban community of Antsirabe, her hometown. As soon as she became a legal adult, she started taking responsibility for herself. She chose to start her own business. She started by renting a few videogames in front of her house, and progressively was able to purchase some material.

Her partnership with Vahatra is two years old. She plans to use this loan to purchase new videogames and to invest in audio-visual equipment (TV, console, controllers…). In the long term, her aim is to open a real gaming room for her clientele.

Thanks to her activity, she was already able to purchase a few pieces of furniture, and one day hopes to be able to build her own home.

loans.use: to buy TVs, game consoles, and controllers

loans.name: Jose Elise

texts.fr:
José Elise  a 45 ans, il est marié et a 4 enfants. C’est un homme de la campagne qui s’est rapproché de la ville pour ses opportunités de travail et pour permettre à ses enfants de recevoir un enseignement de meilleure qualité. Il élève des cochons depuis 11 ans  et a une solide expérience dans ce domaine d’activité.

Son partenariat avec Vahatra a commencé il y a 2 ans et lui a permis d’agrandir son cheptel. Il compte utiliser ce prêt pour acheter de nouveaux porcelets et de la provende qui garantit à ses animaux une alimentation adaptée et équilibrée.

Avec les bénéfices de son activité, il a déjà réussi à placer de l’argent à la banque sur un compte épargne, il espère ainsi sécuriser et garantir l’avenir de sa famille.
texts.en:
José Elise is forty-five years old and is married with four children. He is a man of the countryside who moved closer to the city for its work opportunities and to allow his children to get a better education. He has raised pigs for eleven years, and has a solid experience in this domain.

His partnership with Vahatra is two years old, and has allowed him to increase his livestock. He plans to use this loan to purchase new piglets and feed, which guarantees that his animals will get an appropriate, balanced nutrition.

With profits from his business, he already succeeded in putting some money in the bank on a savings account. He thus hopes to secure and guarantee his family’s future.

loans.use: to buy piglets and feed meal.

loans.name: Louisette

texts.fr:
Louisette est une entrepreneuse audacieuse. Elle a 36 ans, elle est mariée et a eu 3 enfants. Elle est locataire d'une maison dans un quartier commerçant d'Antsirabe.

Elle est emprunteuse de Vahatra depuis maintenant plus de deux ans où elle a pu bénéficier de plusieurs prêts successifs d'un montant croissant. Elle a ainsi pu démarrer et développer une activité d'achat revente de tomates, d'oignon, et toutes sorte de légumes. Elle vend dans le plus grand marché de la ville où des clients venant des provinces achètent ses légumes en gros.

Le prêt lui servira à diversifier et a augmenter le stock de ses marchandises. Elle est une femme battante et son objectif dans la vie est d'acheter un terrain afin de construire une maison pour sa famille.
texts.en:
Louisette is a bold entrepreneur. She is 36 years old, married, and has three children. And she rents a house in the Antsirabe area. 

Louisette has been a borrower with Vahatra for more than two years where she has benefited from several successive loans, which have increased in amount.

Thus she has been able to launch and develop a business of buying and selling tomatoes, onions, and all kinds of vegetables. She sells her goods in the largest market in town where her customers come from the provinces to buy vegetables at wholesale.

This loan will serve to diversify and increase her stock.

Louisette is a strong woman and her goal in life is to buy some land in order to build a house for her family.

loans.use: to buy tomatoes, onions, potatoes, and carrots

loans.name: Nana

texts.fr:
Nana est un autoentrepreneur audacieux. Il est âgé de 48 ans et vit avec sa femme et ses 5 enfants dans un quartier périphérique de la commune d'Antsirabe. Il travail à son domicile où il a pu développer un atelier de fabrication d'huile d'arachide. 

il est partenaire de Vahatra depuis plus de 4 ans et a pu obtenir plusieurs prêts successifs d'un montant croissant. Il a ainsi pu mettre en place une unité production et de conditionnement d'huile d’arachide qu'il va ensuite livrer à différents commerçants de la ville. 

Ce prêt devrait lui permettre d'augmenter son capital en achetant un stock d'arachide destiné à la fabrication d'huile. Sa priorité pour l'instant c'est de développer son activité pour pouvoir travailler avec des grossistes.
texts.en:
Nana is a bold entrepreneur. He is 48 years old and lives with his wife and five children in the outer area of Antsirabe. He works from his home where he has been able to develop a workshop to make groundnut oil. 

He has been with Vahatra for more than four years and has received several successive loans of increasing amounts. Because of this, he has been able to produce, package, and deliver his oil to different merchants in town.

This loan should allow him to increase his capital and buy groundnuts which will be made into oil. His priority for the moment is to develop his business so that he can work with wholesalers.

loans.use: to buy groundnuts

loans.name: Jean Henri

texts.fr:
Jean Henri est un éleveur entreprenant. Il est âgé de 41 ans et élève seul son unique enfant à la campagne à 10 kilomètres de la ville d'Antsirabe. Quant il était plus jeune et il d'abord parti à la capitale pour trouver du travail. Mais la vie est aussi difficile la bas et après quelques il a préféré retourner dans la commune dont il originaire.

A cette époque il a décidé de commencer une activité d'élevage porcin. Il a ainsi emprunté un 1er crédit chez Vahatra qui lui a permis d'acheter un premier porcelet. Depuis il a pu bénéficier de plusieurs crédit d'un montant à chaque fois supérieur pour développer cette activité. Il est ainsi partenaire de Vahatra depuis plus de 3 ans.

Avec ce crédit Jean Henri souhaite diversifier son élevage et acheter sa 1ère vache. Il pourra ensuite vendre son lait et avoir un revenu plus régulier ce qui devrait lui permettre d'atteindre une autonomie financière.
texts.en:
Jean Henri is an enterprising livestock farmer. He is 41 years old and raises his only child alone in the countryside, 10 kilometers from Antsirabe. 

When he was younger he left for the capital to find work. But life was also difficult there, and after some time he chose to return to the area he grew up in. At that point, he decided to start raising pigs. He received his first loan with Vahatra, which allowed him to buy his first piglet. Since then he has been able to benefit from several loans, which have increased in amount each time so that he can [continue] to develop his business. He has been with Vahatra for more than three years. 

With this loan, Jean Henri wishes to diversify his livestock and buy his first cow. He will be able to then sell its milk and have a more regular income which should allow him to become financially independent.

loans.use: to buy a cow

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: sell staple items like rice, oil, sugar, and soap.

loans.name: Victoria

texts.en: Victoria is a widow with 4 children. She has been farming for over 30 years and it is the family's main source of income. To improve the farm, she borrowed a new loan from GDMPC micro credit to buy fertilizer. It is her desire to expand her business to provide better living for her family.

loans.use: to purchase fertilizer.

loans.name: Bienvinido

texts.en:
Bienvinido engages in rice farming. He toils the land and grows rice. He is a 50-year-old married man with six children from Getafe, Bohol. His oldest child is 9 years old. To have supplemental income, he also runs a sari-sari (variety) store. He sells basic commodities like noodles, salt, sugar, soap, canned goods, biscuits and chips.  

He is asking for a loan to buy fertilizers and canned goods. This will help his farm grow more rice and fill his store with a variety of stock. This could attract more buyers and improve his earnings.

He is determined to expand both of his businesses to make them more productive and profitable.

loans.use: to buy fertilizers and canned goods

loans.name: Elizabeth

texts.en:
Elizabeth is 49 years old and married with three children. Elizabeth works very hard to provide for them.

Elizabeth runs a general store in the Philippines and requested a PHP 8,000 loan through NWTF to buy items to sell like eggs, home care products and other groceries.

Elizabeth has been in this business for three years now. 

In the future, Elizabeth would like to save enough to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: to buy items to sell like eggs, home care products and other groceries

loans.name: Richlyn

texts.en:
Richlyn is a married woman with four children. She is a very hardworking entrepreneur. Richlyn is 34 years old, and all four children are still in school.

Richlyn has a dried fish making business in the Philippines. Richlyn requested a PHP 5,000 loan amount through NWTF to purchase more fish and other materials for her dried fish making business.

Richlyn has been in this business for two years. She would like to save enough money so she could afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to purchase more fish and other materials for her dried fish making business

loans.name: Rosalie

texts.en:
As a married parent of two children, Rosalie works hard to support her family.

She has a dried fish-making business in the Philippines, and also earns additional income from fish vending.  Rosalie is borrowing 5,000 PHP through NWTF to  purchase more fish and other materials for her dried fish-making business.

Rosalie has been sustaining her business activities through her past loan from NWTF. She hopes that her hard work will help her attain her dream to save enough money so she could afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to purchase more fish and other materials for her dried fish-making business

loans.name: Felyn

texts.en:
Felyn is 34 years old and married with one child in school. She works very hard to provide for them.

Felyn runs a general store in the Philippines and requested a 10,000 PHP loan through NWTF to buy items to sell like rice, home care products and other groceries. Felyn has been in this business for 3 years now. 

In the future, Felyn would like to build and expand her business to secure the future of her family.

loans.use: to buy items to sell like rice, home care products and other groceries

loans.name: Estela

texts.es:
Estela es madre de tres niños de las edades entre seis y quince años, ella es casada tiene treinta y tres años, vive en una comunidad de Sololá.
Estela para generar sus ingresos y apoyar a su esposo con los gastos de la casa, se dedica al tejido artesanal, elaborando blusas, fajas en el lugar de su domicilio.
Estela una madre que prioriza las necesidades de su familia, por lo que ella ahora solicita un préstamo que lo utilizara para terminar la construcción de su casa comprando así cemento, block, arena y hierro, pues ellos tienen la necesidad de terminar la casa para poder mudarse en ella porque hasta ahora aun no tienen donde vivir con mayor seguridad.
Estela tiene las esperanzas de conseguir el crédito, para que su casa esté terminado lo antes posible, y así pueda seguir mejorando pero su propia casa.
texts.en:
Estela has three children between the ages of 6 and 15.  She is 33 years old and married.  She lives in the Sololá community.

In order to generate income and help her husband with the household expenses, she makes handwoven blouses and belts at home.

Estela is a mother who prioritizes her family’s needs.  That is why she is now requesting a loan to finish building her house.  She will buy cement, cement blocks, sand, and iron.  They need to finish building the house in order to be able to move into it.  Up until now they still do not have a safer place to live.

Estela hopes to get the loan so that her house will be finished as soon as possible.  This way she will be able to continue improving.  But this way it will be her own house.

loans.use: to buy cement, cement blocks, sand, and iron to finish building her house.

loans.name: Honarina

texts.en:
Honarina is 52 years old and has nine children. She is married and two of her children are in school.

Honarina is in the agricultural business, raising pigs in the Philippines. Honarina requested a PHP 9000 loan through NWTF to buy feeds and other supplies to raise her livestock. She has been in this business for three years now, and has borrowed four times in the past from NWTF to sustain it.

In the future, Honarina would like to save enough money so she could afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy feeds and other supplies to raise her livestock

loans.name: Emelita

texts.en:
Emelita is thankful that she was granted a 12,000 PHP loan which she used to pay for cookies and biscuits to sell at retail price. Through her earnings she is able to support her family and meet their daily basic needs. Aside from her biscuits she also earns from her pineapple farm.

She would now like to apply for a Php 15,000 loan which she will use to pay for fertilizers for a more productive pineapple farm harvest. Her earnings will definitely help cover her family’s daily needs and her children’s education. She is thanking God and you in advance for the financial help that will be given her. 

Emelita dreams for her farm to grow and flourish and to have happy and prosperous life with her family. She faithfully meets up with her co-fellowship members to share stories of her work every week and draw strength and inspiration from the Word of God she studies.

 * All CCT community partners / clients are organized into fellowship groups that meet on a weekly basis. A fellowship group is composed of 15 to 30 community partners. The fellowship groups gather each week to study the Word of God, build social capital and repay Micro Finance loans.

loans.use: to pay for fertilizers for a productive pineapple harvest.

loans.name: Marites

texts.en:
Hog raising has been Marites' business involvement. She is 38 years of age, married and blessed with two children. Her husband works as tricycle driver within her locality.

Currently, she raises two hogs. It's been 10 years of hard work and patience that she has devoted in this kind of business. Now, she wants to keep it profitable, but she doesn't have enough capital to sustain the daily maintenance of her hogs. With regards to her situation, she is asking for a loan of PHP 7,000. This amount will be used to purchase necessary hog supplies such as feed and vitamins. She knows that through complete sustenance of feed and vitamins for her hogs, she could be able to make them healthier upon reaching their maturity period.

loans.use: to buy hog feed supplies for raising hogs

loans.name: Rosalina

texts.en:
Rosalina is 50 years old and married with three children. With one child is still in school, Rosalina works very hard to provide for them.

Rosalina runs a general store in the Philippines and requested a PHP 7,000 loan through NWTF to purchase more items to sell like canned goods, personal product care, noodles, spices, milk, coffee, etc.

Rosalina has been in this business for 20 years.

She would like to save enough to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: to purchase more items to sell like canned goods, personal product care, noodles, spices, milk, coffee, etc

loans.name: Gemma

texts.en:
Gemma is 43 years old with two children. With both children in school, she works very hard to provide for them.

Gemma runs a general store in the Philippines and requested a PHP 10,000 loan through NWTF to buy items to sell in her general store like candies, biscuits, home care products, and other groceries.

Gemma has been in this business for 10 years now. 

In the future, she would like to save enough money so she could afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy items to sell in her general store like candies, biscuits, home care products and other groceries

loans.name: Genalyn

texts.en:
Genalyn is 35 years old and married with seven children. With five children in school, Genalyn works very hard to provide for them.

Genalyn runs a general store in the Philippines and requested a PHP 8,000 loan through NWTF to buy items to sell in her general store like canned goods, snack foods, home care products, and other groceries.

Genalyn has been in this business for six years now. 

In the future, Genalyn would like to save enough money so she could afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy items to sell in her general store like canned goods, snack foods, home care products and other groceries

loans.name: Ginalyn

texts.en:
Ginalyn is 37 years old and widowed with three children. With three children in school, Ginalyn works very hard to provide for them.

Ginalyn runs a charcoal vending business in the Philippines and requested a PHP 5,000 loan through NWTF to buy additional sacks of charcoal to sell.

Ginalyn has been in this business for two years now. 

In the future, she would like to save enough money so she could afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy additional sacks of charcoal to sell

loans.name: Imelda

texts.en:
Imelda is a married woman with four children. She is a very hardworking entrepreneur. Imelda is 49 years old, and one of her children is in school.

Imelda has an eatery business in the Philippines. Imelda requested a PHP 15,000 loan amount through NWTF to buy ingredients for her food-production business.

Imelda has been in this business for 15 years. In the future, Imelda would like to save enough money so she could afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy ingredients for her food-production business

loans.name: Jenelyn

texts.en:
Jenelyn is 31 years old and married with two children. With two children in school, Jenelyn works very hard to provide for them.

Jenelyn runs a general store in the Philippines and requested a PHP 6,000 loan through NWTF to buy items to sell in her general store like snack foods, beverages, home care products and other groceries.

Jenelyn has been in this business for two years now. 

In the future, Jenelyn would like to save enough money so she could afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy items to sell in her general store like snack foods, beverages, home care products and other groceries

loans.name: Letecia

texts.en:
A married mother of 3 children, Letecia is a very hardworking entrepreneur. She is 62 years old now.

Letecia has a peanut processing business in the Philippines and has requested a 5,000 PHP loan amount through Negros Women for Tomorrow Foundation in order to buy more peanuts to prepare and sell.

Letecia has been in this business for 1 year. In the future, she would like to build and expand her business so she can secure the future of her family.

loans.use: to buy more peanuts to prepare and sell.

loans.name: Rafiatou

texts.fr: Rafiatou est une jeune femme célibataire sans enfants. Rafiatou vit à Adidogomé et est âgée de 18 ans. Pour réaliser des gains et subvenir favorablement à ses besoins, Rafiatou vend des lames, des rasoirs et des articles de détails en se promenant dans son quartier. Rafiatou arrive à subvenir à ses besoins quotidiens grâce à cette activité génératrice de revenus. Rafiatou s’approvisionne une fois par semaine au marché  et demande ce crédit pour acheter des lames et des rasoirs. Rafiatou désire améliorer sa prestation et augmenter son profit
texts.en: Rafiatou is a young unmarried woman without children. She lives in Adidogomé and is 18 years old. To make a profit and to support herself well, she sells razors and blades and retail goods by going door to door in her neighborhood. Rafiatou manages to meet her day-to-day needs, thanks to this revenue-generating business. She gets her supplies once a week at the market and is asking for this loan to purchase some razor blades and razors. Rafiatou would like to improve her range of offerings and to increase her profit.

loans.use: to buy a box of rasors and a box of razor blades

loans.name: Julita

texts.en:
As a married parent of seven children, Julita works hard to support her family.

She has a buying and selling of spices business in the Philippines, and also earns additional income from buying and selling vegetables. Julita is borrowing PHP 9,000 through NWTF to buy more spices like onions, etc., to sell in her stall.

Julita has been sustaining her business activities through her past two loans from NWTF. She hopes that her hard work will help her attain her dream to save enough money so she could afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy more spices like onions, etc., to sell in her stall

loans.name: Elsie

texts.en:
Elsie is a 57-year-old, married mother of 6 children, 1 of whom is in school. She is a very hardworking entrepreneur. 

Elsie has a food vending business in the Philippines. She has requested a 29,000 PHP loan amount through Negros Women for Tomorrow Foundation in order to buy kitchenware and ingredients for her food business.

Elsie has been in this business for 16 years now. In the future, Elsie would like to save enough money to both expand her business and repair her family's home.

loans.use: to buy kitchenware and ingredients for her food business.

loans.name: Anonymous Group
loans.use: to maintain a farm field and to pay for manual labor at the harvest

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to purchase 'pagne' cloth

loans.name: Jasmin

texts.en:
Jasmin engages in farming. She grows and sells rice.  She is a married woman with a six-year-old daughter. She is 28 years old and a resident in the town of Talibon, Bohol. Her husband works in construction. His income helps defray the family's daily expenses.

Jasmin has requested  a loan to buy fertilizer and pay for house repair. The fertilizer will be used in improving her farm so that she is able to increase the yield of her farm. She could then manage her finances and be able to settle her obligations. 

She is hoping that she could handle her business so as to become more sustainable and provide her growing child with better living conditions.

loans.use: to buy fertilizers and pay for house repair

loans.name: Criselda

texts.en:
Criselda is engaged in a food vending business. She offers street foods within her local community. Criselda is married to a driver and has three children. Her generated income goes toward their daily consumption and an allowance for her eldest child.

Criselda would like to maintain her food vending business. That's why she is asking for additional capital of PHP 7,000. This loan will be used to buy bar-b-que, sausage, "hotdogs", and other kinds of street foods she offers.

She hopes that her food vending business will grow continuously.

loans.use: to buy bar-b-que, sausage, "hotdogs", and other kinds of street foods for her food vending business.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to purchase cattle

loans.name: Lolita

texts.en:
Lolita is a married mother of 6 children. She is a very hardworking entrepreneur who is now 55 years old.

Lolita has a general store business in the Philippines, and she has requested a 8,000 PHP loan through Negros Women for Tomorrow Foundation in order to buy items to sell in her general store such as canned goods, home care products, as well as other groceries.

Lolita has been in this business for 25 years now. In the future, she would like to save enough to be able to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: to buy items to sell in her general store such as canned goods, home care products, as well as other groceries.

loans.name: Delia

texts.en:
As a married parent of three children, Delia works hard to support her family.

She has a tailoring business in the Philippines, and also earns additional income from pig fattening. Delia is borrowing PHP 20,000 through NWTF to buy new supplies for her tailoring business.

Delia has been sustaining her business activities through her past 29 loans from NWTF. She hopes that her hard work will help her attain her dream to save enough money to expand her business and repair her family's home.

loans.use: to buy new supplies for her tailoring business.

loans.name: Orquidea Group

texts.es:
Este grupo solidario está integrado por cuatro mujeres alegres y amables: Jenny Josefa vende accesorios de acero,  Martha Elena  vende ropa usada, Mariby Yuseydi  y Martiza del Socorro tienen una pequeña en el corredor de su casa de tambo y madera. Todas viven en Bilwi, municipio de Puerto Cabezas. Se organizaron hace 6 meses, con el propósito de acceder a créditos con garantía solidaria, para tener la oportunidad de incrementar sus inventarios y mejorar su calidad de vida y la de sus familias. Decidieron nombrar al grupo Orquidea, en honor a la hija mayor de la coordinadora y para caracterizarse como mujeres que crecen en a nivel personal y en los negocios como la Flor de Orquidea. 

Jenny Josefa: Es la coordinadora del grupo solidario Orquidea. Es una mujer jovial, con cualidades de líder, dinámica. Tiene 32 años de edad, casada con dos hijas: La mayor de 12 años estudia su primer año de secundaria y una pequeña de 2 años de edad. Su esposo trabaja de manera informal como chofer de un taxi. Ella desde hace 2 años se dedica al comercio de productos de acero, en un tramo que tiene en uno de los mercados de Bilwi. Está solicitando financiamiento para comprar en Managua accesorios para damas de acero: pulseras, cadenas, aretes, anillos, brazaletes entre otros productos. Ella y su esposo sueñan con diversificar sus productos, vender frutas y verduras.
texts.en:
This communal bank is made up of 4 friendly and happy women: Jenny Josefa sells accessories made of steel, Martha Elena sells used clothing, Mariby Yuseydi and Martiza del Socorro have small stores in the corridor of their wooden houses built on stilts, They all live in Bilwi, in the municipality of Puerto Cabezas. They got together 6 months ago with the goal of accessing loans with a group guarantee, to have the opportunity to increase their inventories and improve their quality of living and that of their families. They decided to name the group "Orquidea" in honor of the oldest daughter of the coordinator and to characterize themselves as women who are growing at a personal and business level like the Orchid flower.

Jenny Josefa is the coordinator of the "Orquidea" communal bank. She is a jovial woman with the qualities of a dynamic leader. She is 32 years old, married with two children. The oldest is 12 and studies at secondary school, and she has a two year old child. Her husband works informally as a taxi driver.

She has worked for the past two years selling products made of steel in a stall that she has in one of the markets in Bilwi. The loan she is requesting is to buy accessories for women made of steel from Managua: bracelets, chains, rings amongst other products. She and her husband dream of diversifying their products selling fruit and vegetables.

loans.use: to buy woman's steel accessories in Managua: bracelets, chains, rings amongst other products.

loans.name: Jovelyn

texts.en:
Jovelyn is 34 years old and married with two children, one of whom is in school.

She earns a living by raising pigs in the Philippines. Jovelyn is borrowing PHP 28,000 through NWTF in order to buy feed and vitamins for her pig.

Jovelyn has been raising pigs for twelve years and also earns additional income from selling personal products and from a bicycle taxi businesses.

She is working tirelessly toward the attainment of her dream: to save enough money to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy feed and vitamins for her pig.

loans.name: Maribel

texts.en:
Maribel is 42 years old and married with two children. With both children in school, Maribel works very hard to provide for them.

Maribel runs a general store in the Philippines and requested a PHP 5,000 loan through NWTF to buy items to sell in her general store like canned goods, condiments, home care products, and other groceries.

Maribel has been in this business for five years now. 

In the future, Maribel would like to save enough money so she could afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy items to sell in her general store like canned goods, condiments, home care products, and other groceries

loans.name: Marjorie

texts.en:
Marjorie is 42 years old and married with two children. With one child in school, Marjorie works very hard to provide for them.

Marjorie runs a general store in the Philippines and requested a PHP 6,000 loan through NWTF to buy items to sell in her general store such as canned goods, beverages, home care products, and other groceries.

She has been in this business for one year now.

In the future, Marjorie would like to save enough to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: to buy items to sell in her general store such as canned goods, beverages, home care products, and other groceries.

loans.name: Unidos Para Triunfar Group

texts.es: Carmen de 55 años de edad es separada y tiene 3 hijos. Ella Pertenece a la Alcancía Comunal “Unidos Para Triunfar”  la cual la conforman 06 mujeres optimistas y solidarias. Carmen se dedica a la venta de anticuchos. Gracias a su constante dedicación y buen servicio a sus clientes ha logrado mejorar su calidad de vida y la de sus hijos. Su mayor deseo es de poner un negocio más grande .Solicitó el crédito para la compra de carne, corazón de res, papa y choclo. El grupo “Unidos Para Triunfar” agradecen a los Inversionistas Kiva por el apoyo brindado. Carmen es la primera del lado del lado izquierdo, viste blusa celeste y falda rosada a cuadros.
texts.en: Carmen is 55 years old, is separated and has 3 children. She belongs to the communal bank "Unidos Para Triunfar", which is formed of 6 optimistic and supportive women. Carmen makes a living selling kebabs. Thanks to her continued dedication and good service for her customers, she has been able to improve her quality of life and that of her children. Her greatest desire is to have a bigger business. She requested this loan to buy meat, beef heart, potato and corn. The group "Unidos Para Triunfar" thanks Kiva lenders for their provided support. Carmen is the first from the left side, wearing a blue blouse and a pink plaid skirt.

loans.use: to buy meat, beef heart, potato and corn.

loans.name: Marcelina

texts.es:
La socia Marcelina continua en el banco comunal “Siempre Juntos” ,la socia continua dedicándose a trabajar como asistente en una veterinaria, la socia se siente agradecida por el préstamo y se compromete a cumplir con los pagos de su cuota, la socia es una persona responsable y empeñosa, siendo de esta manera que la socia saca adelante a su familia.
La socia solicita el préstamo para comprar materiales como medicinas, jarabes entre otros.
texts.en:
Marcelina is still a member of the communal bank “Siempre Juntos” (Always Together). She continues to work as a veterinary assistant. The member is grateful for this loan, and she promises to make her loan payments. She is a responsible and entrepreneurial person. It is in this way that the member moves her family forward.

She is requesting a loan to buy supplies such as medicines and drug syrups, among other things.

loans.use: to buy supplies such as medicines and drug syrups, among other things.

loans.name: Cipriana

texts.es:
La socia pertenece al banco comunal SIEMPRE JUNTOS, la socia continua dedicándose al negocio de venta de tripas de cordero, la socia lleva buen tiempo con su negocio el cual le va bien gracias al empeño que le pone cada día a  su negocio, la socia es una persona responsable y empeñosa, siendo de esta manera que la socia saca adelante a su familia.
La socia solicita el crédito para la compra de carme (tripas de cordero).
texts.en: Cipriana belongs to the communal bank Siempre Juntos, and continues to make a living in the business of selling lamb tribe. She takes good time with her business, which is doing well thanks to the efforts she puts every day into her business. She is a responsible and earnest person, and in this way she pulls her family ahead. She asks for a loan to buy meat (lamb tribe).

loans.use: to buy meat (lamb tripe).

loans.name: Marlyn

texts.en:
Marlyn is a woman with six children. She is a very hardworking entrepreneur. Marlyn is 46 years old, and two of her children are in school.

Marlyn has a bicycle transport business in the Philippines and requested a PHP 9,000 loan amount through NWTF to buy spare parts and other equipment needed for her business.

Marlyn has been in this business for two years.

In the future, she would like to save enough money so she could afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy spare parts and other equipment needed for her business.

loans.name: Lorna

texts.en: Lorna is 44 years old and married with two children. One of her children is in school. Lorna has been selling rice in the Philippines for 16 years. She is a very hard working entrepreneur. Lorna requested a 20,000 PHP loan through Kiva's partner, Negros Women for Tomorrow Foundation, to buy more inventory of rice to sell. In the future, Lorna would like to save enough money to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy more stock of rice to sell

loans.name: Melanie

texts.en: Melanie, 29, is married with two children in school. She is a very hard working entrepreneur. Melanie has been buying and reselling dressed chicken in the Philippines for 15 years. She requested a 15,000 PHP loan through Kiva's partner, Negros Women for Tomorrow Foundation, to buy more dressed chicken to sell in her business. In the future, Melanie would like to save enough money so she can send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy more dressed chicken to sell in her business

loans.name: Monena

texts.en:
As a widowed mother of five children, Monena  works hard to support her family. She has a food vending business in the Philippines, and also earns additional income from a general store.  

Monena  is borrowing PHP 21,000 through NWTF to buy ingredients for her food business.

She has been sustaining her business activities through her past 14 loans from NWTF. 

She hopes that her hard work will help her attain her dream to save enough money to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy ingredients for her food business

loans.name: Nur Roihatul

texts.en:
Good day, lenders! We’d like you to meet one of Ruma's agents, Nur. Nur lives in South Tangerang, a suburban located about an hour and a half drive from Jakarta, the capital city of Indonesia. She lives there with her husband and her only child. 

Nur owns a stall that sells mobile airtime credits. As a woman, she realized that it’s really important for her to help her husband increase their income, so they can save more money for their child’s education. That’s why she decided to join Ruma. 

As the business grows, Nur needs additional capital and is seeking a working capital loan from Kiva. She will use the capital to provide more mobile airtime credits to her community, so her community can stay connected with their loved ones, no matter how far they are apart. 

Nur’s goal with Ruma in the nearly future is to serve as an e-commerce business for her community, with Ruma’s latest product called 'Mapan'. 

As seen in the photo, Nur is the one who is standing behind her own stall. She is thankful for your kind support.

loans.use: to purchase additional prepaid airtime credit

loans.name: Mayla

texts.en:
As a married mother of two children, Mayla works hard to support her family.

She has a fishing business in the Philippines, and also earns additional income from a tricycle passenger. 

Mayla is borrowing PHP 15,000 through NWTF to buy fishing gear and other equipment.

She has been sustaining her business activities through her past six loans from NWTF. She hopes that her hard work will help her attain her dream to save enough money to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy fishing gear and other equipment.

loans.name: Dilbar

texts.en:
Dilbar is a generous woman. She has her own business and knows her activity well. She is a sewer, and sews at home. She takes orders at home and sews traditional women's dresses. She was born in 1986. She is married and has one child. She is a goal-oriented person, and wants to open her own sewing workshop. She decided to serve people with traditional and European dresses. 

Dilbar wants to get a loan to buy two computer sewing machines. 

She hopes to be supported by KIVA lenders.

loans.use: To buy two computer sewing machines

loans.name: Iris Janeth

texts.es:
La señora Iris Janeth de 28 años de edad vive  con su pareja  compañero de hogar y sus dos hijos  radica en la comunidad del caimito san Lorenzo, valle, al sur de Honduras posee casa propia se dedica desde hace 04 años a la venta de Ropa Nueva y Usada y también Zapatos,  sus clientes son los compañeros de trabajo ya que aparte de vender ropa en sus ratos libres ella trabaja como secretaria de una fábrica de sal.
Iris con el apoyo del préstamo pretende invertirlo en la mejora de su casa porque necesita comprar cemento, arena, y mano de obra de albañil, necesita repellarla por la parte de atrás,  Es un cliente existente, con deseos de trabajar con prisma y Kiva.
Iris su sueño es terminar su casa, y que sus hijos sigan estudiando para prepararlos mejor.
San Lorenzo, Honduras - Febrero 2015.
texts.en:
Iris Janeth is 28 years old and lives with her common law husband and their two children. She resides in the community of Caimito San Lorenzo, Valle in southern Honduras. Iris has her own home. For the last four years, she has sold new and used clothing and shoes. In addition to selling clothes in her free time, she works as a secretary in a salt factory. Her customers are her work companions.
