Iris, with the aid of this loan, intends to invest in improving her house. She needs to purchase cement and sand, and to pay for a bricklayer who will cement the back of her house. She is an existing client who wishes to work with Prisma and Kiva.

Iris's dream is to finish her house and that her children  may finish their studies and become better prepared.

San Lorenzo, Honduras – February 2015

loans.use: buy cement and sand and to pay a bricklayer to continue making needed improvements on her house.

loans.name: Evangeline

texts.en:
Evangeline is a hog raiser within her local community. She is 50 years old, married and has three children. 

Evangeline would like to nourish her hogs well, which is why she's seeking additional capital of PHP 7,000. She believes that her requested loan will have much to do with the improvement in the growth of her hogs.

Evangeline is looking forward for approval of her requested loan amount. In this way, she could purchase feed, medicine and vitamins that will be used for the daily maintenance of the hogs she is raising.

loans.use: to purchase feed, medicine and vitamins of her hogs

loans.name: Fris

texts.en:
Fris is 40 years old, separated, and has four children. She is from Panta-on, Ozamiz City. Fris owns and managed a piggery business, which she has been doing for five years. She earns 5,000 PHP a month. 

Fris is requesting a loan from GDMPC Microcredit for 20,000 PHP, which she will use to purchase feeds for the pigs. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the loan to improve and expand her business.

loans.use: to purchase feeds for pigs.

loans.name: Melanie

texts.en:
As a married mother of six children, Melanie works hard to support her family.

She has a business selling chicharrones (fried pork rinds) in the Philippines, and also earns additional income from her general store and selling bananas. Melanie is borrowing 17,000 Philippines pesos (PHP) through NWTF to buy ingredients for her chicharrones business.

Melanie has been sustaining her business activities through her past 21 loans from NWTF. She hopes that her hard work will help her attain her dream to build and expand her business to secure the future of her family.

loans.use: to buy ingredients for her chicharrones business.

loans.name: Riza

texts.en:
Riza is a married woman with six children. She is a very hardworking entrepreneur. Riza is 43 years old, and four of her children are in school.

Riza has a manicure and pedicure business in the Philippines. She has requested a PHP 13,000 loan amount through NWTF to buy materials including nail polish, nail cutters, and other necessary items.

Riza has been in this business for two years. In the future, she would like to save enough money to afford sending her children to college.

loans.use: to buy materials such as nail polish and nail cutters

loans.name: Ely Marcela

texts.es:
Ely despierta todos los días pensando a quien podrá ayudar, es una joven de veinticuatros años de edad, que recién egresa de la licenciatura en Tecnología Médica. eta joven apasionada por su carrera y apoyada por su madre logró cumplir la primera de sus muchas metas, graduándose con excelentes notas. Ella cuenta lo agradecida que está con todas las personas que le apoyaron con el préstamo anterior, que le permitió hacer realidad ese sueño. En la actualidad labora en un hospital, dedicada a su trabajo y siempre empleando valores como la responsabilidad, honestidad y solidaridad atiente a todos los pacientes que recurren hacerse algún examen que demande el uso de una máquina. 
Ely pretende emprender de nuevo el camino académico, sueña con especializarse en enfermería y así brindar un mejor servicio en el hospital. Además logrará crecer como profesional y tendrá nuevas oportunidades en otros trabajos, es por eso que ella recurre a Kiva y MiCrédito para que le brinden un financiamiento que pague sus clases. Esta emprendedora joven se ve en el futuro estudiando más y mejorando la calidad de vida propia y de sus seres queridos.
texts.en:
Ely wakes up every day thinking about who she will be able to help. She is a 24-year-old woman who recently graduated with a university diploma in Medical Technology. This young woman, passionate about her degree and supported by her mother, managed to achieve the first of her many goals, graduating with excellent grades. She is very grateful to all the people who supported her with the previous loan, which allowed her to make that dream a reality.

She currently works in a hospital. She is dedicated to her work and she always sticks to values such as responsibility, honesty and solidarity as she attends to all of the patients that come to her for any examinations that require the use of a machine.  

Ely is trying to follow the academic path again, dreaming of specializing in nursing so that she can offer the hospital a better service. She will also achieve professional growth and she will have new work opportunities. It is for this reason that she is turning to Kiva and MiCrédito so that they can provide her with funding to pay for her classes. In the future this enterprising young woman sees herself studying more and improving her quality of life and that of her loved ones.

loans.use: to pay to specialize in nursing

loans.name: Susan

texts.en:
Susan is 55 years old and a married woman with six children, one of whom is in school. She is a very hardworking entrepreneur.

Susan has a food vending business in the Philippines. Susan requested a PHP 22,000 loan amount through NWTF to buy ingredients for her food business.

Susan has been in this business for 23 years. In the future, Susan would like to save enough money to repair her family home and expand her business.

loans.use: to buy ingredients for her food business

loans.name: Nilda

texts.en:
As a married parent of four children, Nilda works hard to support her family. She has a food vending business in the Philippines, and also earns additional income from a general store. 

Nilda is borrowing PHP 8,000 through NWTF to buy ingredients for her food production business.

Nilda has been sustaining her business activities through her past three loans from NWTF. 

She hopes that her hard work will help her attain her dream to save enough money so she could afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy ingredients for her food production business

loans.name: Manuel

texts.es: Manuel un hombre de 35 años de edad, que se encuentra muy agradecido por el préstamo anterior, él cuenta que gracias a este crédito el logro mejorar la calidad de sus cultivos y que el volumen de su cultivo ahora ha aumentado, por lo que él y  su familia se encuentran en una estabilidad económica mucho mejor que la de antes. Él ahora está solicitando un nuevo  crédito que lo utilizará para comprar sus semillas y fertilizantes para seguir aumentando el volumen de su cultivo. Manuel tiene las esperanzas de conseguir nuevamente el crédito para que su él logre cultivar a tiempo y tener buena cosecha este año.
texts.en:
Manuel is a 35-year-old man. He is very grateful for the previous loan. He states that, thanks to this loan, he was able to improve the quality of his crops and that the volume of his crops has now increased. As a result, he and his family are enjoying a much greater economic stability than before.

He is now requesting a new loan, which he will use to buy seeds and fertilizers in order to continue increasing the volume of his crops. Manuel hopes to receive a loan once again so that he can cultivate on time and obtain a good yield this year.

loans.use: to buy seeds and fertilizers.

loans.name: Gul

texts.en:
Gul is a hardworking woman. She was born in a family of agrarians in 1963. She has seventeen years of experience doing business. She is married and has four children. Her husband is an engineer. She worked as an agrochemist in agricultural chemistry from 1990 to 1992. Then from 1992 to 1993 she got experience in secondary school as a teacher of chemistry. Now she is a teacher of biology in school. 

Gul wants to educate her children, and she currently needs to pay tuition fees for her son's studies. As she is educated, she wants to see her child educated as well. Gul is asking for financial support to pay tuition fees for her child's studies. She hopes to be supported by Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To pay tuition fees for her child’s studies

loans.name: Las Maravillas Group

texts.es:
La A.C. “LAS MARAVILLAS” iniciará el primer ciclo en Pro Mujer, como parte del Centro Focal de Panamericana, está compuesta por ocho  integrantes y está dirigida por una mesa directiva donde la señora Arminda es la Presidenta. Los negocios que las integrantes de la asociación comunal llevan adelante son variados entre ellos existen: venta de faldas de cholita, venta de mantas, venta de frutas, venta de papa, venta de salchipapa, venta de jugo de naranja. 

El crédito que sacaran beneficiara a pequeñas microempresarias donde la señora Arminda es integrante, ella indica que es la primera vez que integra Pro Mujer, ingresando por la invitación de una amiga que es cliente de la institución. En la actualidad ella tiene un negocio de venta de faldas de cholita; da a conocer que este negocio lo inicio hace varios años, ya que conocía la forma de trabajo de un empleo anterior que tenía con su tía, es por eso que decide guardar un capital para emprender su negocio. 

El crédito que ahora sacará es para el aumento de capital (compra tela por mayor) que adquirirá de las vendedoras de la ciudad de El Alto y posteriormente a la elaboración, lo comercializará en su espacio de venta. Esta forma de trabajo le permite generar recursos para apoyar a su familia económicamente, ya que ella es soltera.  

Cuando se le consulta qué le gusta de Pro Mujer, ella responde que le gusta los ahorros que ofrece la institución.
texts.en:
Las Maravillas Communal Bank will start its first loan cycle with Pro Mujer as part of the Panamericana regional office.  It's made up of eight members and governed by a board of directors of which Arminda is the president.  The bank members carry out a variety of businesses, including sales of traditional "cholita" skirts, blanket sales, fruit sales, potato sales, "salchipapa" [sausage and potatoes] sales, and juice and orange sales.

The loan they're getting will benefit small business entrepreneurs like Arminda.  She said it's the first time she has belonged to Pro Mujer, having joined on the invitation of a friend who's a client of the institution.  Currently she has a business selling "cholita" skirts.  She started the business several years ago because she was familiar with the work from a previous job with her aunt.  She decided to save some capital to start her business.

The loan Arminda's getting is to increase her capital with the purchase of fabric, which she'll buy wholesale from vendors in the city of El Alto and, after production, sell in her retail space.  This job allows her to earn an income to support her family, because she's single.

When asked what she likes about Pro Mujer, she says the savings the institution offers.

loans.use: to buy fabric wholesale

loans.name: Ruth Leyni Margareth

texts.es:
La socia Ruth pertenece al banco comunal SIEMPRE JUNTOS, la socia continua sus actividades diarias   con la venta de productos de primera necesidad como arroz, azúcar, fideos, aceite y otros más, la socia lleva buen tiempo con su negocio el cual le va bien gracias al empeño que le pone cada día a su negocio, la socia desea poder seguir trabajando para de esta forma seguir apoyando a su familia.
La socia solicita el crédito para la compra de azúcar, gaseosas entre otros.
texts.en: Ruth belongs to the "SIEMPRE JUNTOS" communal bank. She continues with her daily activities selling basic food items like rice, sugar, noodles, oil and others. She has run her business for a long time and things are going well for her thanks to the determination she brings to her work each day. She wants to be able to continue to work and in this way support her family. She is requesting a loan to buy sugar and soft drinks amongst others.

loans.use: to buy sugar and soft drinks, amongst others.

loans.name: Antonio

texts.es:
El socio pertenece al banco comunal TODOS UNIDOS, él socio continua dedicándose a su negocio de venta de repuestos de automóviles, el socio lleva buen tiempo con su negocio el cual le va bien gracias al empeño que le pone cada día a su negocio, él socio desea poder seguir trabajando para de esta forma seguir apoyando a su familia.
El socio solicita le crédito para comprar faros  entre otros.
El socio se siente agradecido con el crédito y se compromete a cumplir los pagos de su cuota.
texts.en: Antonio belongs to the "TODOS UNIDOS" communal bank. He continues with his business selling car parts. He has run the business for a long time and things are going well for him thanks to the determination he brings to his work each day. He wants to continue working in this way to continue to support his family. He is requesting a loan to buy lights amongst others. He is grateful for the loan and promises to comply with the payments of his installments.

loans.use: to buy lights amongst others.

loans.name: Rosalina

texts.en:
Rosalina is a married woman with eight children. She is a very hardworking entrepreneur. Rosalina is 46 years old, and two of her children are in school.

Rosalina has a seafood vending business in the Philippines. Rosalina requested a PHP 10,000 loan amount through NWTF to buy more seafood to sell, like shrimp.

Rosalina has been in this business for two years. In the future, Rosalina would like to save enough money to afford sending her children to college.

loans.use: to buy more seafood like shrimp to sell like shrimp

loans.name: Rosemarie

texts.en:
Rosemarie is 34 years old and married with three children.

Rosemarie works hard to provide for her family. She runs a general store in the Philippines, and she has requested a PHP 8,000 loan through NWTF to buy items to sell like sugar, junk foods, home care products and other groceries.

Rosemarie has borrowed and repaid four loans from NWTF before this loan. She has been running the general store for four years and also earns an income from food vending.

Rosemarie aspires to save enough money to afford sending her children to college.

loans.use: to buy items to sell like sugar, junk foods, home care products and other groceries

loans.name: Monica

texts.en: Monica is 49 years old with six children, two of whom are in school. She works very hard to provide for them. For two years, Monica has run a general store in the Philippines. She requested a 9000 PHP loan through Kiva's partner, Negros Women for Tomorrow Foundation, to buy items to sell in her general store such as coffee, canned goods, home care products, and groceries. In the future, Monica would like to save enough money to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy items to sell in her general store

loans.name: Haydee

texts.en:
As a married parent of seven children, Haydee works hard to support her family.

She has a food vending business in the Philippines, and also earns additional income from pig fattening.  She is borrowing 20,000 PHP through NWTF to buy more snack food to sell to customers.

Haydee has been sustaining her business activities through her past 9 loans from NWTF. She hopes that her hard work will help her attain her dream to save enough money to expand her business and repair her family home.

loans.use: to buy more snack foods to sell to customers

loans.name: Ma. Theresa

texts.en:
Ma.Theresa is married and works hard to support her family. She operates a clothing business in the Philippines, which she has been doing for six years.

Ma.Theresa requested a loan from NWTF for 18,000 PHP, which she will use to buy more items such as blouses, pants, and other ready-to-wear clothing. In the future, she would like to save enough money to expand her business.

loans.use: to purchase blouses, pants, and other ready-to-wear clothing.

loans.name: Wilme

texts.en:
As a married mother of four children, Wilme works hard to support her family.

She has a fishing business in the Philippines and earns additional income from pig fattening. Wilme is borrowing PHP 26,000 through NWTF to buy fishing nets and other equipment for her fishing business.

Wilme has been sustaining her business activities through her past 21 loans from NWTF. She hopes that her hard work will help her attain her dream to save enough money to continue sending her children to college.

loans.use: to buy fishing nets and other equipment.

loans.name: Susana

texts.en:
Susana is 50 years old and widowed with six children. With one child in school, Susana works very hard to provide for the family.

Susana runs a general store in the Philippines. She has requested a PHP 8,000 loan through NWTF to buy items to sell in her general store like canned goods, beverages, home care products and other groceries.

Susana has been in this business for three years. 

In the future, Susana would like to build and expand her business to secure the future of her family.

loans.use: to buy items to sell in her general store like canned goods, beverages, home care products and other groceries

loans.name: Jocelyn

texts.en:
Jocelyn is 47 years old and married with nine children. Three of her children are in school.

She earns a living by farming vegetables in the Philippines. Jocelyn is borrowing 30,000 PHP through NWTF to buy fertilizers and other farm supplies. Jocelyn has been farming vegetables for twenty years and also earns additional income from rice retailing.

She is working tirelessly toward the attainment of her dream: to save enough money to buy more farm land.

loans.use: to buy fertilizers and other farm supplies

loans.name: Flordeluna

texts.en:
Flordeluna is 34 years old and is a married woman with three children. Two of her children are in school. She is a very hard working entrepreneur. 

Flordeluna has a vegetable selling business in the Philippines. She requested a 29,000 PHP loan amount through NWTF to buy fruits and vegetables to sell in her food stall.

Flordeluna has been in this business for eleven years. In the future, she would like to save enough money so she can continue to send her children to school.

loans.use: to buy fruits and vegetables to sell in her food stall

loans.name: Anita

texts.en:
Anita is a 54-year-old married woman with six children. She is a very hard working entrepreneur. 

Anita has a rice retailing business in the Philippines. She requested a 23,000 PHP loan amount through NWTF in order to buy more stock of rice to sell.

Anita has been in this business for ten years. In the future, she would like to build and expand her business.

loans.use: to buy more stock of rice to sell

loans.name: Ratha's Group

texts.en:
A resident from Chhloung district of Kratie province, Ratha is 36 years old and is a mother of three dependent children. Two of her children are still in school and another one is too young to attend school.

For her living, Ratha grows rice and cassava and she has been involved in her business for 16 years. This is her second time with VisionFund (Kiva’s partner) and she has fully repaid her past loan.

In this group of two members, Ratha is the group leader. She will spend her loan portion to buy pesticide and fertilizer for her farmland. She hopes that she can improve her farmland and get more yield than last year.

loans.use: to buy pesticide and fertilizer for her farmland

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: purchase flooring, cement, and sand in order to finish construction on her house.

loans.name: Lengkheng's Group

texts.en:
Lengkheng, 57, lives with family members in Kroc Chhma District of Kampong Cham Province. She is a mother of a dependent child. To support her family’s conditions, she grows rice as the main source of her income. She has been involved in this business for 20 years, and it earns her about 27,800 KHR per day. 

This is her third cycle with VisionFund (Kiva’s partner), and she has fully repaid her past loans. She is the leader of her group, which has two members. She will spend her loan portion to buy pesticide, fertilizer and seeds to support her farmland. She hopes that she can improve her farmland and her family's conditions so they are better than before.

loans.use: to buy pesticide, fertilizer and seeds to support her farmland

location.town: Kampong Cham province; Kroch Chhma district

loans.name: Camilo

texts.es:
Camilo es un hombre de 50 años de edad es casado, tiene una linda familia de siete hijos de las edades entre seis y treinta años, viven en una comunidad de Sololá.
Camilo para generar sus ingresos y mantener a su familia, cuenta con una pequeña tienda de compra y venta de abarrotes en una comunidad circunvecina, él cuenta que gracias a este pequeño negocio ha logrado sacar adelante a su familia.
Camilo es un padre de familia que se preocupa por las necesidades de su familia y una de ella es que cuenten con una casa educada para ellos, por tantos años ha luchado por darles lo mejor a su familia pero ahora con todas sus ganancias ya no se da abasto para terminar la construcción de su casa, por lo que ahora solicita un préstamo de que lo utilizara para comprar cemento, cal, arena, hierro y block.
Camilo sueña con poder seguir mejorando su casa y darle a su familia todo lo mejor que este dentro de sus posibilidades.
texts.en:
Camilo, 50, is married. He has a beautiful family comprised of seven children that are between six and thirty years old. They live in the community of Sololá. Camilo has a small store, located close to where he lives. He buys and sells groceries in order to generate some income and maintain his family. He says that thanks to this business he has been able to get ahead with his family.

Camilo is a father who cares about his wife and children and their needs. He wants them to have a house. He has worked hard for years to give them all the best, but he does not earn enough to finish building their house.

This is why he is requesting a loan to buy cement, lime, sand, iron bars and bricks. Camilo’s dream is to be able to continue improving his home and working as hard as he can to give his family the best.

loans.use: to buy cement, lime, sand, iron bars and bricks to finish his house.

loans.name: Yulduz

texts.ru: Юлдуз проживает на районе Шахритус, находящийся на юго-западной части Таджикистана. Юлдузу 21 год. Она живет вместе с родителями и братом. Юлдузу всего 21 год. Она уже 3 года занимается животноводством. Она не смогла получить высшее образование, но она очень умная. Юлдуз насчитанная девушка и уверена что она сможет создать устойчивый и надежный бизнес. Юлдуз начала с животноводческой деятельности. У нее сейчас только один скот. Она хочет за счет заемных средств увеличить поголовья скотин расширить имеющийся бизнес. Она верит, что с этим кредитом она приблизиться к своей мечте.
texts.en: Yulduz lives in the Shahrituz region, in south-western Tajikistan. She is only 21 years old, and lives with her parents and brother. She has been raising livestock for 3 years already. She was unable to get a college education, but is very smart. Yulduz is a responsible woman and is sure that she can start a sustainable and reliable business. Yulduz began with animal husbandry. She now has one cow. She wants to use the borrowed funds to increase her herd and expand her business. She believes that this loan will bring her closer to her dream.

loans.use: to buy livestock and start a reliable and sustainable business

loans.name: Maria Concepcion

texts.es: Maria Concepcion es una joven de 23 años de edad y a su corta edad ha aprendido la labor del tejido a mano y ha hecho unos tejidos muy hermosos. Los créditos que Fape y Kiva  le ha dado le han servido para comprar hilos por cajas de muchos colores, telas y materiales para tejer. Sus güipiles los vende en el mercado de la localidad. Solicita el crédito para la compra de hilos por mayor ya, que si compra por mayor le dan a mejor precio. Sus pagos han sido puntuales. Y esta muy contenta ya que por medio de la inversión de su crédito ha podido comprar las materiales que necesitan para tejer.
texts.en:
Maria Concepcion is a 23 year old young woman who has learned to weave by hand and has already made many beautiful fabrics.She sells the güipiles (regional dress or blouse) she makes in the local market.

The loans with Fape and Kiva will help her to purchase more supplies in many different colors, such as thread and fabric and other materials she needs. She is asking for a loan in order to purchase these supplies on wholesale so she can get a better price.

Her payments have been punctual and she is happy that with her loan she has been able to purchase all the necessary materials she needs.

loans.use: purchase materials to knit.

loans.name: Arturo

texts.es:
El señor Arturo de 54  años de edad vive con su conyugue, no tiene  hijos  que depende de él,  radica en la comunidad de san Lorenzo, al sur de honduras, tiene casa propia  y se dedica desde hace 20 años  al negocio de la cría de ganado, venta de leche y vacas, sus clientes son los amigos y personas a quien el vende la leche, también vende novios para destazo y leña seca para las tortillerías, Don Arturo es un hombre trabajador que desea salir adelante.
Don Arturo esta solicitando el préstamo para complementar la  compra de una vaca parida, con el apoyo de este crédito el aumentara su ganado y tendrá mejor producción de leche y de esta manera tendrá más ingresos, su  sueño es mejorar su casa.
San Lorenzo, Honduras - Febrero del 2015.
texts.en:
Arturo is 54 years old. He lives with his wife in his own house in the community of San Lorenzo in the south of Honduras. He has no dependent children. He has worked raising cattle for more than 20 years selling milk and cows. His clients are friends and people to whom he sells milk. He also sells calves for butcher and wood to make tortillas. Arturo is a hard-working man who wants to get ahead. Arturo is requesting a loan to complete the purchase of a pregnant cow. With the help of this loan he will increase his cattle and have greater production of milk and in this way have more income. His dream is to make improvements to his house.
San Lorenzo, Honduras - February 2015.

loans.use: to buy a pregnant cow for his business.

loans.name: Parvina

texts.en:
Parvina is 62 years old, married, and has one child whom she and her husband adopted late in their lives. She was born in southern part of Tajikistan. She is a hardworking woman. Her family worked hard in agriculture to feed their family. They had a big family and Parvina grew up quite fast. Their lives were not easy. Each member of the family had specific work with the land and keeping livestock. Parvina was obligated to keep livestock because she was best in it. She loved to work with livestock and tried to take care of them. 

As a grown up, Parvina decided to do operate a cattle business. Her father supported her in this endeavor. She requested a loan, which she will use to buy cattle. She is planning to expand her business and buy cattle for keeping. She hopes to educate her child through her hard work.

loans.use: to purchase cattle

loans.name: Jayson

texts.en:
Jayson runs a sari-sari (variety) store. He sells basic commodities like biscuits, noodles, canned goods, soft drinks and toiletries. He is a 24-year-old man with a 1-year-old dependent. He is a resident in the town of Talibon, Bohol.

He has requested a loan in the amount of 18,000 PHP to purchase a sack of rice, soft drinks, and canned goods. These materials will be used in attracting more customers and improving the content of his small store. With these, his daily income will be augmented which will enable him to provide the basic needs of his family.

In the future, Jayson is hoping to expand his sari-sari (variety) store.

loans.use: to purchase a sack of rice, soft drinks, and canned goods

loans.name: Buenaventura

texts.es:
Buenaventura, de 64 años de edad, se ha dedicado desde pequeño a trabajar en el cultivo de maíz, frijol y café, está casado y su esposa se dedica a administrar una pequeña tienda que tienen en su casa y tiene 5 hijos, pero todos tienen sus propias familias.

Buenaventura, nos comenta que en el lugar donde ellos viven, han puesto otras tiendas y debido a eso, sus ventas han disminuido.- También, el cultivo de café ya no da tanto fruto, a causa de una enfermedad llamada roya y en la zona no encuentran otras formas de trabajo.- Es por eso que cuando no encuentran trabajo, se dedican a halar leña para venderla y sacar un poco de dinero; él considera que el crédito es una alternativa para poder continuar con su pequeño negocio de venta de granos básicos.

Buenaventura, solicita el crédito para comprar golosinas, gaseosas, arroz, frijoles, azúcar, lácteos, etc. Todo para poder mejorar el inventario de su tienda, pues considera que será una gran ayuda, pues podrá ofrecer más productos en su tienda y así atraer nuevamente a sus clientes.

El sueña con tener una tienda más grande, como la que tenía antes y que le generaba buenos ingresos.- Las ganancias las utilizará para mejorar la casa donde viven.
texts.en:
Buenaventura is 64 years old and has made a living since childhood in the cultivation of corn, beans and coffee. He is married and his wife makes a living managing a small store they have at their home. They have five children, but they all have their own families.

Buenaventura says there are a lot of new stores in the place they live, and their sales have declined because of that. Also, the cultivation of coffee no longer gives much fruit because of a disease called rust. In this area you do not find other ways of working. This is why when they don't find work, they make a living hauling firewood to sell and make a bit of money. He considers the loan as an alternative to be able to continue with his small business selling basic grains.

Buenaventura asks for the loan to buy candy, soda, rice, beans, sugar, dairy, etc. All of this to be able to improve the inventory of his store, which he believes will be a great help as he can offer more products in his store and attract new customers.

His dream is to have a bigger store, like the one he had before that generated a good income. The proceeds will be used to improve the house where they live.

loans.use: to buy candy, soda, rice, beans, sugar, dairy, etc.

loans.name: Nelson Alejandro

texts.es: Nelson Alejandro, tiene la edad  de 21 años, está soltero, vive con sus hermanos y padres, los cuales son su mayor prioridad. Con su crédito pretende hacer la compra de una vaca para la producción de leche y que tengan buenas características en la producción y que se pueda adaptar bien a las condiciones de clima y tipo de pasto de la zona. La idea es aprovechar el espacio que tiene de pasto y las buenas condiciones del terreno, clima y agua potable para poder tener estos animales. Con esta compra podrá mejorar la actividad, y a la vez tener un ahorro que le permitirá ir teniendo más animales e invertir más en la propiedad y poder cumplir con algunas metas personales y de su familia.  Es el primer  préstamo que  recibido de FUDECOSUR. Él no había tenido antes otros préstamos en bancos estatales, pero FUDECOSUR le ha brindado el préstamo con mayores facilidades y la tasa de intereses mucho más baja.
texts.en:
Nelson Alejandro is 21 years old, single and lives with his parents and siblings. His family is his number one priority. With this credit, he wants to purchase a milking cow that produces a lot of milk and one that can easily adapt to different climate conditions and the type of grazing in his region.

His idea is to take advantage of grazing space he has as well as the good terrain conditions, climate and drinking water available in order to have some livestock.

With the purchase of a milking cow, he will be able to save enough to buy more animals and invest even more in his property as well as meet some personal and family goals.

This is his first loan with FUDECOSUR. He has not had any other loans with state banks, but FUDECOSUR is able to more easily offer him a loan and lower interest rates.

loans.use: purchase a milking cow.

loans.name: Eunice

texts.en:
The person in the photograph is Eunice. She is married and blessed with three children. She joined Hand in Hand Eastern Africa to get knowledge about business management and also to borrow and improve her business.

Eunice practices dairy farming. She is borrowing Kiva loan to boost her dairy activities by buying dairy feed, which will increase milk production and therefore her level of income.

Eunice is grateful to Kiva and its lenders.

loans.use: to buy dairy feed, which will increase milk production.

loans.name: Gilbert

texts.en:
Gilbert, at heart, is a resourceful, loving man. His fatherly love has been enough to show him that he needs to work hard to help his children get ahead with excellent values and education. George is a very hardworking, honest and dedicated farmer who hails from Kerugoya, a rural town in Kenya. He is a family man, and he has a lovely family that he really loves and cherishes. Gilbert and his wife work as a team supporting each other, and have practiced mixed farming for the past five years. 

Gilbert always says, “I have always had an affinity for farming, and it runs in my blood.” Because of the liking that he has for farming, he has even nicknamed one of his cows, which makes him a very proud farmer, especially when he is milking his cows. Through his dairy cow, he is able to get between 5-10 liters of milk a day, and this helps him support his family. 

Gilbert practices crop farming, but he has not been making good profits because of poor farming implements; that is why he is kindly seeking a loan to buy farm implements. Through the loan, he will be able to buy high-quality seeds, good fertilizer and pesticides that he will use to greatly improve his crop production. Modern farming requires the use of modern techniques, and therefore using high-quality seeds will assure him a bumper harvest and hence, increased profit levels. 

Gilbert is very visionary, and his goal for the season is to boost his crop production and be able to get more crop output than last year. All this can be achieved through lenders’ help and goodwill. Gilbert believes that through the loan, he will turn around his family life and be able to give his children a solid educational background. This loan will be Gilbert’s way out of poverty.

loans.use: to buy farm implements.

loans.name: Elena

texts.en:
The person on the photo is Elena. She is 31 years old, married and living with her husband and her two children. 

She practices poultry farming and she is borrowing this Kiva loan to buy more chicks to add stock to her poultry business so that she can sell more and meet her customers' demands. She says that this loan will help her increase her income which will help her pay for her children’s tuition fees.

Elena is very happy for this loan and grateful to Kiva and its lenders.

loans.use: to buy more chicks to add flock to her poultry business.

loans.name: Set- Kobor Group

texts.en:
The person raising his hand in the photo is John, a member of Set Kobor group in Nakuru, Kenya. He is fifty-one years old, married and blessed with six children. John joined Hand in Hand Eastern Africa (HiH EA) in January 2014.

John is a vegetable farmer. HiH EA enterprise training has enabled him manage his enterprise well, and thereby earn profit. He is borrowing a Kiva loan to buy fertilizers and seeds that will improve quality and quantity of his yields and thus maximize profit. Income from his enterprise will help him meet his family's basic needs, education and medical care.

He is grateful to Kiva and its lenders and promises to repay promptly.

loans.use: to buy fertilizer and seeds that will help boost farming.

loans.name: Saydi Yohanna

texts.es:
La señora Saydi de 30 años  de edad vive con sus padres, tiene 02 hijos que dependen de ella,  tiene casa propia y se dedica desde hace 10  años al negocio de  venta de ropa de adulto y achinería como ser: ganchos para pelo, diademas, adornos, aretes, pulseras y su venta es de forma ambulante, ella compra el producto en Tegucigalpa y luego sale a venderlo con su mama, ella es madre soltera que lucha día con día para mejorar su calidad de vida.
Saydi necesita el préstamo para surtir de mercadería su negocio con ganchos para pelo, diademas, adornos, aretes, pulseras y otros artículos que pueda vender, es su primer  crédito que solicita a prisma es recomendado por un cliente muy bueno de Prisma.
Saydi su sueño es mejorar su calidad de vida y la de su familia.
San Lorenzo, Honduras - Febrero del 2015.
texts.en: Saydi is 30 years old and lives with her parents. She has two children who depend on her. She has her own home and has made a living for 10 years in the business of selling adult clothing and low-cost consumer goods such as: hair clips, tiaras, ornaments, earrings, and bracelets which she sells on the street. She purchases the the products in Tegucigalpa and afterwards departs to sell them with her mother. She is a single mother that fights day in and day out to improve her quality of life. Saydi needs this loan to supply the market of her business with hair clips, tiaras, ornaments, earrings, bracelets, and other articles that can be sold. It's the first loan she has requested from Prisma and comes recommended by a very good client of Prisma. Saydi's dream is to improve the quality of life for herself and her family.

loans.use: For the purchase of hair clips, tiaras, ornaments, earrings, bracelets, and other articles that can be sold for her business.

loans.name: Kiki

texts.en:
Good day, lenders! We’d like you to meet one of PT Rekan Usaha Mikro Anda's (Ruma) agents, Kiki. Kiki lives in East Serang, a suburban area located about two hours' drive from Jakarta, the capital city. She lives there with her husband and her two children. 

Kiki owns a stall where she sells daily consumer products and mobile airtime credits. As a woman, she realized that it’s really important for her to help her husband increase their income, so they can save more money for their children’s education. That’s why she decided to join Ruma. 

As the business grows, Kiki needs additional capital, so she is seeking a working capital loan from Kiva. She will use the capital to provide more mobile airtime credits to her community, so her community can stay connected with their loved ones, no matter how far apart they are. 

Kiki’s goal with Ruma in the near future is to serve as an e-commerce business for her community, Ruma’s latest product, called Mapan. 

As seen in the photo, Kiki is the one who is standing in her own stall. She is thankful for your kind support.

loans.use: to purchase additional prepaid airtime credit to sell to community members.

loans.name: Isaac

texts.en:
The person appearing in the photograph is Isaac; he is married and a father of seven. His economic activity is rabbit keeping. Isaac joined Hand in Hand Eastern Africa to learn more skills on enterprise development and financial management. This has equipped him with skills on business management. He needs a loan to build a better hutch and to buy quality feed for his rabbits. He believes this will greatly help him increase his income and, therefore, be in a position to provide basic necessities to his family.

Isaac is grateful to Kiva and their lenders for the help and support.

loans.use: To pay for consruction of modern rabbit hutch and to buy rabbit feed

loans.name: Ana Gladys

texts.es: Ana Gladys, tiene la edad  de 35 años, está casada,  vive con su esposo y sus hijos los cuales su mayor prioridad. Con su crédito pretende hacer la compra de pollos pequeños para el engorde. Lo que pretende es aprovechar las buenas condiciones que tiene en cuanto a local y el espacio que no tiene problema con vecinos que pueda causarle algún tipo de molestia. Además de poder comprar animales de mejor calidad para que tengan un buen desarrollo una buena ganancia en peso de carne y que sea de buena calidad. Con el ingreso que espera obtener quiere utilizarla en el bienestar y estudio de su familia y cumplir con algunas metas familiares y seguir invirtiendo más en el negocio. Es el primer  préstamo que  recibido de FUDECOSUR. Ella no había tenido antes otros préstamos en bancos estatales, pero FUDECOSUR le ha brindado el préstamo con mayores facilidades y la tasa de intereses mucho más baja.
texts.en:
Ana Gladys is 35 years old and is married. She lives with her husband and her children, who are her main priority. With her loan she intends to buy small chickens to fatten up. She intends to make the most of the good conditions that she has in terms of premises and a location without problems with neighbours that could cause her any bother. Being able to buy high quality animals means that they will develop well, put on weight well and produce good quality meat.  

She will use the profit that she hopes to make for the well-being and education of her family, to achieve some family goals and to continue investing more in the business. It is the first loan that she will receive from FUDECOSUR. She has not had loans from other state banks in the past, but FUDECOSUR has offered her a loan with greater ease and a much lower rate of interest.

loans.use: to buy broiler chickens

loans.name: Emilce

texts.es:
La Sra. Emilce es de la ciudad de San Pedro, donde tiene su pequeño negocio de venta de ropas nuevas y semi-nuevas, también posee un taller de confección de ropa,  y por medio de su esfuerzo ayuda a su familia y a sus seres queridos.
Ella es una persona muy trabajadora que quiere salir adelante, es por ello que se esfuerza mucho cada día. Agradece por esta oportunidad que recibe de poder seguir y crecer.
Pide este préstamo para poder comprar telas, hilos, y otros, y con ello poder seguir con su trabajo como lo viene haciendo.
texts.en:
Emilce is from the city of San Pedro, where she has her small business selling new and semi-new clothing. She also has a clothing production workshop, and through her efforts she helps her family and loved ones. She is very hardworking and wants to move forward, so she strives for it everyday.

She appreciates the opportunity she is getting to be able to continue and to grow. She is requesting this loan to be able to buy fabrics, thread, and other items, and with those she will be able to continue with her work the way she is doing.

loans.use: to buy fabric, thread, and other items.

loans.name: Savoeng's Group

texts.en:
Savoeng, a 51-year-old woman, lives in the Thmor Koul district of Battambang province. She has seven children, two of whom are dependent on her.

To improve her family’s living, Savoeng grows rice as the main source of her income. She has been in this business for 28 years. This is her seventh time with VisionFund (a Kiva partner) and she has fully repaid her past loans.

Savoeng leads the group of two members to get a new loan. As the group leader, she will spend her loan portion to plow her two-hectare rice farm, and to buy seed and fertilizer to support her business. She hopes that she can earn more income to improve her lifestyle.

loans.use: to plow a two-hectare rice farm, and to buy seed and fertilizer to support her business.

loans.name: Noluscor

texts.en:
It's a normal thing to have a chicken farm in Kenya, but to start an actual business out of it is something else entirely.

Noluscor is a smallholder mixed-farmer based in Maili saba village. He has been practicing mixed farming for the last 18 years. To earn a decent living, he sells milk and eggs and engages in numerous small personal businesses or “side hustles” as he likes to call them. Only recently, he started seeing how he could be making big money off poultry farming.

To Noluscor, raising hens is something close to a hobby. He wants to sell eggs, but figures the quantity he produces won't make economic sense. He needs to purchase more poultry. However, his biggest challenge today is limited funds to expand.

Noluscor is seeking a loan from Kiva lenders via Juhudi Kilimo to purchase poultry. Future proceeds from the commercialization of his poultry farm are already committed to pay for his siblings’ education and his children. In the long run, he is confident his efforts will translate into his family having a better quality of life.

loans.use: To buy poultry

loans.name: Sokeng's Group

texts.en:
A villager living in Prey Prorsorb district of Kratie province, Sokeng is a 46-year-old mother of three children. All of her children are dependent on her. For her family support, she sells snacks and ice cream as the main source of her income. She has been involved in this business for 28 years.

This is her second time with VisionFund (Kiva’s partner), as she has fully repaid her past loan. As the group leader of four members, she will spend her loan portion to buy a motorcycle to support her snack-selling business.

Sokeng hopes that she can earn more money to update her family’s lifestyle and support all her children to study until graduating.

loans.use: to buy a motorcycle to support her snack-selling business.

loans.name: Abla

texts.fr: Abla est une femme mariée âgée de 37 ans  et vit à Adidogomé. Mère de deux enfants, Abla est très entreprenante et dynamique. Abla vend des poissons fumés en se déplaçant aux besoins de ses clients afin de trouver son gain. Abla s’approvisionne une fois par mois au marché pour avoir ses marchandises. Pour acheter des poissons, Abla demande ce crédit pour réaliser sa commande et augmenter sa marge bénéficiaire.
texts.en:
Abla is a married woman aged 37, and she lives in Adidogomé. The mother of two children, Abla is very enterprising and dynamic. She sells smoked fish, moving around in order to meet the needs of her customers and earn her living. She stocks up once a month at the market so as to have merchandise to sell. 

In order to buy some fish, Abla is requesting this loan to complete her order and grow her sales and profit.

loans.use: to buy some smoked fish for resale

loans.name: Mujeres Del Progreso Group

texts.es: Este es la nueva Alcancía Comunal “Mujeres del Progreso”  la cual la conforman 05 socias responsables y entusiastas. Teresa de 30 años de edad es separada y tiene 05 hijos 3 de ellos dependientes. Ella se dedica a la confección de polos para una fábrica. Hace más de 1 año que viene trabajando en dicho negocio el cual le va bien. Su mayor deseo es  de tener  su propio  negocio. Solicitó el crédito para la compra de telas. El grupo  “Mujeres del Progreso” agradecen el crédito brindado. Teresa está adelante, ella se encuentra sentada, es la primera del lado derecho y viste polo color rosado.
texts.en: This is the new "Mujeres del Progreso" ["Women of Progress"] Communal Bank, which comprises five responsible and enthusiastic women members. Teresa, age 30, is separated and has five children, three of whom are dependents of hers. She has worked sewing shirts for a factory for over a year, and it's going well. Her greatest dream is to have her own business, though, so she's taking out this loan in order to buy fabrics. Teresa is the one pictured in front to the right, wearing a pink blouse. The "Mujeres del Progreso" group is thankful for this loan.

loans.use: to buy fabric.

loans.name: Pori

texts.en:
Pori is a hardworking woman. She has five years' experience of planting agricultural produce and selling it on the domestic market. Basically she is planting wheat (cereals) and cotton. She likes to work in the land and tries her best to have a good harvest. 

Pori is planning to plant new seeds to harvest at their season. She is asking for financial support from Kiva lenders to buy fertilizer and seeds. She hopes to be supported and have a good harvest this season.

loans.use: To buy seeds and fertilizer

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to start poultry farming.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To buy a quality dairy cow

loans.name: Eloise

texts.fr: Afin d'acheter des pagnes Éloïse fait un troisième crédit à WAGES. Elle souhaite à l'avenir ouvrir une boutique et assurer une bonne scolarisation à ses enfants. Elle est mariée avec 03 enfants en charge. Ils sont âgés de 15, 10 et 07ans. Éloïse quant à elle à 35ans avec 15ans d'ancienneté dans l'activité.
texts.en:
In order to buy lengths of African print cloth for resale, Éloïse is requesting a third loan from WAGES. In future, she would like to open a little shop and also ensure the appropriate schooling of her children. She is married and raising three children. They are 15, 10, and seven years old. 

Éloïse herself is 35 years old and has been in this business for 15 years.

loans.use: to buy lengths of brightly colored African prints (pagnes)

loans.name: Miguel Angel

texts.es:
Miguel, 38 años de edad, estudio hasta sexto grado, está casado y no tiene hijos.

Miguel, se dedica a la ganadería y la agricultura, estos oficios los aprendió de sus padres; se levanta a las 4:30 a.m. junto a su esposa que es quien le apoya en las actividades agrícolas.- Miguel, junto a su esposa, trabajan durante la mañana y en la tarde él trabaja en otras parcelas y su esposa se dedica a los oficios domésticos y a ordeñar la vacas que poseen, para vender la leche.

Miguel, necesita el crédito para comprar una vaca, para incrementar la producción de leche y obtener ingresos adicionales para su familia.

Miguel, desea ahorrar dinero de la venta de leche y de la siembra, para en el futuro comprar un vehículo, para dedicarse a hacer viajes y obtener ingresos extras.
texts.en:
Miguel, 38, has a 6th grade education.  He is married and has no children.

Miguel has a business raising livestock and farming.  He learned these activities from his parents.  He gets up at 4:30am along with his wife, who supports him in his farming activities.  Miguel, along with his wife, works during the mornings.  In the afternoon he works on other people's land, while his wife devotes herself to the household chores and to milking the cows they own so that they can sell the milk.

Miguel needs a loan to buy a cow so that he can increase his milk production and obtain more income for his family.

Miguel wants to save money from selling milk and from his harvest, so that in the future he can buy a vehicle.  This way, he could make trips and obtain additional income.

loans.use: to buy a cow

loans.name: Kapkatet Burgei Group

texts.en:
The person raising her hand in the photo is Hellen, a member of Kapkatet Burgei Group. She is thirty-six years old, married, and a mother of three. She joined Hand in Hand Eastern Africa (HiH EA) in the year 2014.

She does poultry keeping and maize farming. Through HiH EA training, she has acquired skills in enterprise development, business record keeping, and financial management.  Hellen is borrowing a Kiva loan to purchase poultry feed. This will greatly boost her poultry enterprise hence increased income which will enable her to cater for her children’s school fees, clothing, food and other needs for the family. 

Hellen is grateful to Kiva and their lenders and promises to repay the loan promptly.

loans.use: To buy poultry feed that will help boost her poultry production.

loans.name: Julia Josefina

texts.es:
La socia Julia se sigue dedicando al negocio de elaboración de adornos, aretes y collares, la socia trabaja desde las 8:00 a.m hasta las 5:00 p.m,la socia por medio de este negocio la socia quiere salir adelante, el sueño de la socia es ampliar el negocio de elaboración de adornos. La socia solicita el crédito para comprar un televisor para su casa.

La socia está feliz por el préstamo y se compromete a cumplir con los pagos de su cuota.
texts.en:
Julia continues her business of making decorations, earrings, and necklaces. She works from 8:00 A.M. to 5:00 P.M. Julia wants to move forward with her business. Her dream is to expand her business of making decorations.

She is requesting a loan in order to buy a television for her house. Julia is pleased with the loan and promises to complete her payments.

loans.use: to buy a television for her house.

loans.name: Simon

texts.en:
The person in the photo is Simon; he is 48 years old, married, and has six children between the ages of 12 and 24.

He joined Hand in Hand Eastern Africa in 2013 to be trained in entrepreneurial skills. This has helped him run his carpentry business more effectively. His customers have increased, encouraging him to apply for a loan to buy more timber. This will enable him to meet the rising demand for furniture in the market. He hopes his business will thrive so that he can use the income generated to pay for his children's school fees and general family needs.

Simon is grateful to Kiva and their lenders for the financial support and promises to repay his loan promptly.

loans.use: to buy timber that will help boost his furniture-selling business

loans.name: Emmanuel Women Group

texts.en:
The person raising her hand in the photo is Margret, a member of Emmanuel Women Group that joined Hand in Hand Eastern Africa in 2013. She is 37 years old, married, and blessed with four children. Margaret sells second-hand clothes. She has been in this business for four years. She is happy for the Hand in Hand Eastern Africa training she received, which enabled her to mobilize savings for start up capital for her enterprise.

She is borrowing from Kiva to buy more clothes for resale. This will enable her to improve the living standard of her family by providing a balanced diet and quality education to her children. Margret is grateful to Kiva and their lenders and promises to repay promptly.

loans.use: to buy more stock of second-hand clothes that will help boost sales

loans.name: Shamsiya

texts.en: Shamsiya is a hardworking woman. She was born in 1967. She is married and has four children. Her husband is an agrarian. She has experience working as a nurse from 1996 to 2011. After that she became an agrarian woman and helps and supports her husband. They are busy planting cotton. She wants to educate her children and behave well for their benefit. She is planning to pay the tuition fee of her son. She requested a loan from Kiva lenders to pay the tuition fee for her son’s studies.

loans.use: To pay the tuition fee

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to purchase spare parts for resale

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy shoes and merchandise for her store.

loans.name: Anonymous Group
loans.use: to buy merchandise.

loans.name: Ailenita

texts.en:
Ailenita is 31 years old and married with four children. With three children in school, Ailenita works very hard to provide for them.

Ailenita runs a general store in the Philippines and requested an 8,000 PHP loan through NWTF to buy items to sell like canned goods, home care products, and other groceries.

Ailenita has been in this business for 11 years now. 

In the future, Ailenita would like to save enough money so that she can afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy items to sell like canned goods, home care products, and other groceries

loans.name: Anonymous Group
loans.use: to buy merchandise.

loans.name: Anonymous Group
loans.use: to purchase seeds and boost production.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: buy gold jewelry, perfume, and purses

loans.name: Anonymous Group
loans.use: to purchase groceries and other things for her grocery store.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to purchase merchandise such as purses and jewelry.

loans.name: Blanca

texts.es:
Doña Blanca sigue trabajando en su negocio, le va muy bien, su cartera de clientes ha crecido mucho y ahora cuenta con el contrato de un segundo catering service a quien también le brinda los servicios de alquiler de sillas, mesas, bancos y manteles. Solicita su cuarto préstamos, ya que tiene una urgencia de comprar telas para fabricar más manteles ya que tiene varios eventos próximamente, ella misma los confecciona. Para la clienta los créditos anteriores le han permitido aumentar los ingresos económicos de su familia y así poder pagar los estudios de sus  3 hijos. 
Su negocio significa mucho para ella, ya que es la oportunidad de superarse, realizarse como una mujer empresaria y seguir fijándose nuevas metas.
texts.en:
Doña Blanca continues to manage her business and is doing very well. Her list of clients has grown tremendously and now she has a contract with a second catering service. She also provides rental services in which she supplies chairs, tables, benches, and linens. Blanca is requesting her fourth loan because she needs to buy fabrics for making more table linens since she has several upcoming events. She will make the linens herself.

Her previous loans helped to increase her family’s income and she was able to pay for the education of her three children. Blanca’s business means a great deal to her because it gives her the opportunity to succeed, find fulfillment as a businesswoman, and continue setting new goals.

loans.use: to buy fabrics for making table linens.

loans.name: Solidaria Mujer Prosperidad Group

texts.es:
Este grupo está conformado por tres mujeres de La Carpio, una tiene un salón de belleza, otra una soda, la otra cuenta con un bazar; con grandes deseos de continuar con su actividad productiva ya que son jefas de hogar que llevan el sustento a sus hogares. Presentaron una excelente moral de pago en su crédito anterior. Son todas nicaragüenses con muchos años de residir en Costa Rica.

Una de las integrantes doña Sandra, está casada, tiene dos hijas y un hijo, los cuales estudian y presentan un buen rendimiento académico, ya que doña Sandra les ha inculcado la importancia y el buen hábito de estudiar para que puedan contar con un mejor futuro. 
Ella tiene un salón de belleza en la comunidad donde vive, uno de los pocos, ha logrado adquirir diferentes títulos en el área que se desarrolla, realiza desde corte de cabello, peinados, esmaltado de uñas, tintes y demás tratamientos de cuidado personal. Su hija le apoya en las tardes y desea aprender igual que doña Sandra ya que asegura que es un ejemplo a seguir, por el buen servicio que brinda. 

Necesita este crédito para comprar un mejor lava cabezas y productos que le permita atender correctamente a su clientela. Ya que el lava cabezas que tiene ya casi no funciona. Eligió Fundación Mujer por la baja tasa de interés y rápido servicio que se le brinda.

Doña Sandra sueña con re modelar su salón, pasarse a un lugar más amplio y comprar nuevo equipo que le permita atender mayor número de personas; convertir su salón en el más moderno y preferido por las personas. Esto es posible si se le apoya con el financiamiento.
texts.en: This group consists of three women from La Carpio.  One of them has a beauty salon, another a soda fountain, and the third one has a small bazaar. They have great desire to continue with their productive activities because they are head of household who support their homes. They demonstrated an excellent payment history in their last credit. They are all Nicaraguan, with many years  of residence in Costa Rica. One of the members, Mrs. Sandra, is married with two daughters and a son, who are studying and they show a good academic record. Mrs. Sandra has taught her children the importance and the good habit of studying to achieve a better future. She has a beauty salon in the community where she lives, one of the few, and has been able to get different certifications in this area. She cuts hair, does hairstyling, nail polish, hair coloring and other treatments for personal care. Her daughter helps her in the afternoons, and she wants to learn like Mrs. Sandra because she has set a good example for the good service she provides. She needs a loan to buy a better washbasin for hair and products to be able to service her clients more efficiently. The washbasin she currently has is on the verge of falling apart. She chose Fundacion Mujer for the low interest rate and fast service they provide. Mrs. Sandra dreams of remodeling her salon, move to a larger location, and be able to buy new equipment to service a larger number of people and convert her salon into the most modern and favorite of people. This is possible if she is helped with this loan.

loans.use: To buy merchandise and washbasin for hair.

loans.name: Anonymous Group
loans.use: to purchase machinery and products to sell.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy pigs and food for the pigs.

loans.name: Anonymous Group
loans.use: to buy merchandise

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: buy two industrial sewing machines.

loans.name: James

texts.en:
The name of the person in the photo is James; he is married and a father of two children. 

His economic activity is keeping poultry. He joined Hand in Hand Eastern Africa in March 2013 and has received trainings on enterprise management and financial planning. These trainings have equipped him with skills to effectively run his poultry business. James requires a loan in order to purchase quality chicken feeds and also buy more chicken. He believes this will increase his proceeds especially eggs production and thus boost his income. He will therefore be able to improve the overall living standards of his family.

James is grateful to Kiva and their lenders and promises to make established payments.

loans.use: to purchase chicken and feeds that will improve production

loans.name: Tujikaze Arutani Women Group

texts.en:
The lady appearing in the photo is Damaris, a member of Tujikaze Arutani Women Group. She is 46 years old and married with six children.

She joined Hand in Hand Eastern Africa (HiH EA) to benefit from trainings on enterprise development and financial planning. This has helped her improve her knowledge in business management. 

In July 2014 she applied for a loan of 10,000 KES from HiH EA’S Enterprise incubation fund (EIF) which she has completed repaying.  She used her first loan to invest in her enterprise of maize and bean farming by purchasing farm inputs like fertilizer and seeds. She is borrowing more from Kiva in order to 
purchase farm inputs like irrigation equipment and storage sacks. She hopes this will enable her to boost her proceeds and then, increase her income. She will therefore be able to improve the living standards of her family including modern housing and quality healthcare. 

Damaris is grateful to Kiva and their lenders and promises to repay promptly.

loans.use: to buy irrigation equipment and storage sacks to help boost farm output

loans.name: Maseno Self Help Group

texts.en:
The person raising his hand in the photo is David. He is a member of Maseno Self Help Group. He is sixty-four years old, married and the father of eight children.

He farms maize, beans and tomatoes. Part of the produce is used for family consumption and the rest for commercial purposes. He is happy for Hand in Hand Eastern Africa enterprise management training. He is borrowing from Kiva to buy farm inputs such as fertilizers and crates for tomatoes. He hopes that the Kiva loan will assist him to boost his business and hence increase his income. This will improve the living standard of his family which includes quality
education.

David is happy for Kiva and their lenders for financial support.

loans.use: To buy farm inputs such as fertilizer and tomato crates that will boost the enterprise.

loans.name: Crispina

texts.es:
La Sra. Crispina está casada, es de la ciudad de San Lorenzo y se dedica a la elaboración y venta de comestible, ella es una persona muy trabajadora y emprendedora, que está luchando y esforzándose por poder salir adelante.
Ella solicita el préstamo la compra de un nuevo congelador, ya que con ella podrá mantener frescos los alimentos que hace y vende. Ella es una persona  responsable y honesta en sus compromisos.
texts.en:
Crispina is married. She is from the city of San Lorenzo, and she makes a living preparing and selling food. She is a very hard-working and entrepreneurial person who is fighting and making an effort to move forward.

She is requesting a loan to buy a new freezer, which will allow her to maintain the food that she prepares and sells fresh. She is a responsible person who is honest in her commitments.

loans.use: to buy a freezer for food preservation.

loans.name: Doris Yesenia

texts.es: Doris empezó su negocio vendiendo juguetes y ropa americana en el mercado invirtiendo Q800 .00 luego su negocio fue creciendo hasta llegar a tener una librería la que ha tenido hasta ahora ya hace 3 años, su mayor anhelo es llegar a tener mejoras en su negocio, gracias a Dios a ayegado a tener un negocio mas grande tambien gracias a su familia por el apoyo que le han brindado hasta ahora, y también agradece a FAPE porque siempre la han apoyado.Esta solicitando este credito para la compra de producto Libreria.
texts.en: Doris started her business selling toys and second-hand clothing in the market, with an investment of 800 Quetzales (about 100 USD). Her business then grew until she had a stationary store, which she has now had for 3 years. Her greatest desire is to make improvements in her business. She is thankful to God that she now has a bigger business, and also to her family for the support they have provided her with up until now. She is also grateful to FAPE because they have always supported her. She is asking for this loan to buy products for her stationary store.

loans.use: to buy products to sell in her stationary store

loans.name: Armida

texts.en:
Armida is a married woman with five children. She is a very hardworking entrepreneur. Armida is 29 years old and has two children who are in school.

Armida has a food vending business in the Philippines and requested a PHP 5,000 loan amount through NWTF to buy ingredients for her food production business.

Armida has been in this business for 17 years. In the future, she would like to save enough money so she could afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy ingredients for her food production business

loans.name: Mary

texts.en:
This is Mary. She is sixty-four years old and married. She joined Hand in Hand Eastern Africa in 2013.

Mary does vegetable and dairy farming, a business she has been doing for the last thirty years. She has requested a loan from Kiva lenders in order to purchase fodder to help improve productivity. She plans to use the profits generated from milk and cereal sales to cater for her family's basic needs and save money for future use to help expand her business.

Mary is grateful for Kiva and its lenders and promises to make payment promptly.

loans.use: To purchase fodder that will improve milk production.

loans.name: Nena

texts.en:
Nena works hard to support her family. She is widowed and has a food vending business in the Philippines.

Nena requested a PHP 12,000 loan through NWTF to buy ingredients for her food production business like cooking oil, meat, fish, flour, spices and other materials needed for her business.

Nena has been in this business for 10 years now, and also earns additional income from a general store.

She would like to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy ingredients for her food production business like cooking oil, meat, fish, flour, spices and other materials needed for her business

loans.name: Imee

texts.en:
Imee is a married woman with four children. She is a very hardworking entrepreneur. Imee is 33 years old and has four children who are still in school.

Imee has a buy-and-sell sea food business in the Philippines. She requested a PHP 6,000 loan amount through NWTF to purchase more crab, shrimp, oysters, mussels and other seafood to sell.

Imee has been in this business for 10 years. She would like to save enough money so she could afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to purchase more crab, shrimp, oysters, mussels and other seafood to sell.

loans.name: Francis

texts.en:
Francis is a very enterprising man. He has a great desire to get ahead and advance. He is a small-scale farmer residing in a small village in Ekerenyo, which is found in the Nyanza region of Kenya. He has been practicing mixed farming for the last seven years to fend for his family of three children. Francis sells tea and maize from his farm to buyers at a local market. He is also involved in other personal businesses.

Francis is seeking a loan from Kiva lenders through Juhudi Kilimo to venture into poultry farming. Poultry farming is economical and feasible since it doesn’t require much land space. Francis is projecting returns that are sustainable over a long period of time. With the success of the first phase of his plan, he will secure a second loan to purchase more chickens to increase his sales volume. Francis takes pride in belonging to his tribe. People from the Nyanza region are well known to like chicken products, especially meat. Many homesteads keep poultry for subsistence. With the extra income from poultry farming, Francis will comfortably meet the high farming expenses that cripple small-scale farmers across the country. His overall goal with the poultry project is to improve his family's food security.

loans.use: To purchase poultry

loans.name: Monicah

texts.en:
The lady in the photograph is Monicah. She is thirty-five years old and blessed with two children. She earns her living by running a grocery shop and selling clothes. She is happy for the Hand in Hand Eastern Africa enterprise training she received which equipped her with the skill to manage her business. The high demand in the market has made Monicah apply for a loan to boost her clothes selling business by buying more stock. This will improve her sales; hence more income. She will thus be able to meet her objective of educating her children and providing for her family’s basic needs.

Monicah is very grateful to Kiva and its lenders and promises to repay her loan promptly.

loans.use: to buy more stock of clothes that will boost sales and thus more income.

loans.name: Thayu Women Group

texts.en:
In 2012, Thayu Women Group joined Hand in Hand Eastern Africa in order to be trained in financial management, enterprise development and savings mobilization to improve their livelihoods. The members in this group are mostly involved in farming activities.

The person in the photo raising her hand is Lucy. She is 47 years old, married and living with her husband and her six children. She does poultry farming and sells secondhand clothes. She has applied for a loan to buy poultry feed so that she can get more production and provide for her family and boost her secondhand clothes. She says that this loan will help her get more production which will increase her income and help her improve her living standards as well.

She is happy with this loan and grateful to Kiva and their lenders for their help and support.

loans.use: To purchase poultry feed that will boost production

loans.name: Rosa Mistica Group

texts.es:
El grupo Rosa Mistica forma parte del programa de eliminación de la pobreza, son todas mujeres jefas de familia que se unieron para poder mejorar sus condiciones de vida y las de sus familias.
Entre el trabajo y el esfuerzo que hacen, se destaca la Sra. Andresa, una persona humilde y emprendedora, ella se dedica a la venta humilde de remedios naturales, y por medio de su trabajo lucha por su familia, para poder darles todo lo que ella no pudo tener.
La Sra. Andresa quiere seguir creciendo y capacitándose, es por ello que trabaja arduamente, y comenta que pide este préstamo para poder comprar remedios varios para la venta, y con ello seguir luchando por mejorar.
texts.en:
The Rosa Mistica [Mystical Rose] group is part of a poverty elimination programme. All the members are female heads of their families who came together in order to improve their quality of life and that of their families.

In the work they do and the effort that they make, Andresa stands out. She is a humble and enterprising women who has a modest business selling natural remedies. Through her work she fights for her family, to be able to give them everything that she herself couldn't have. 

Andresa wants to continue developing and training, which is why she works so laboriously. She says that she is asking for this loan so that she will be able to buy various remedies to sell and continue to fight to progress.

loans.use: to buy natural remedies to sell

loans.name: Santos

texts.es: Santos es un hombre de 62 años de edad que desde muy temprano se levanta desde muy temprano para iniciar con su negocio de venta de carnes y elaboración de atoles, además por las tardes se dedica a la venta de pan obteniendo mejores ingresos económicos. Él vive junto a su compañera de vida en casa propia desde hace 1 año, por lo que se siente feliz de poder contar con un lugar propio donde vivir. Santos desea incrementar sus ventas y para ello ha tomado la decisión de solicitar un crédito a FUSAI que le permita invertir en: carnes, pan y materia prima para elaborar atoles, ya que sabe que para obtener mejores ingresos necesita contar con una mayor cantidad de productos para ofrecer a su clientela.
texts.en:
Santos is a 62-year-old man who wakes up very early so that he can start his business of selling meat and preparing corn porridge. In addition, he sells bread in the afternoons so that he can generate more income. Santos and his life companion have been living in their own home for one year. For this reason, they are happy to have a place of their own where they can live.

Santos wants to increase his sales, so he decided to request a loan from FUSAI. He will invest in meats, bread, and ingredients for making corn porridge. Santos knows that in order to obtain more income, he needs to have a larger quantity of products to offer to his customers.

loans.use: to buy meats, bread, and ingredients for making corn porridge.

loans.name: Cristina Isabel

texts.es:
La señora  Cristina de  62 años de edad es soltera cuenta con un comedor donde vende sopas marinera, desayunos, almuerzos, refrescos agua en botellones y una gran variedad en jugos y energizante, sus clientes son todos los turistas, personas particulares y chóferes de los buses que viajan a la isla de Amapala.
Doña Cristina es conocida por ser una persona luchadora, se dedica a este negocio desde hace 23 años, radica en la aldea coyolito al sur de Honduras. 
Doña Cristina esta solicitando el préstamo para compra de mariscos, pescado, camarón y curiles, con el apoyo del credito ella pretende  surtir  y mejorar su negocio y vivienda.
Doña Cristina solicita  15.000 lempiras para compra de mariscos, refrescos  espera invertirlo y mejorar mas sus ingresos.  
Doña Cristina  su sueño es tener un negocio  con más productividad.
San Lorenzo, Valle - Febrero 2015
texts.en:
Cristina is 62 years old and single. She has a cafe where she sells seafood soups, breakfasts, lunches, snacks, bottled water, and a great variety of energizing juices. Her customer base consists of tourists, certain individuals, and bus drivers who travel to the island of Amapala. Cristina is known to be a determined person. She has had her business for the past 23 years. She lives in a village in Coyolito, which is located in the south of Honduras.

She is requesting a loan to buy seafood, fish, shrimp, and clams. With the help of this loan, she will stock and improve her business and her home. Cristina is requesting 15,000 lempiras to buy seafood and snacks. This way, she hopes to improve her income. Cristina's dream is to have a more productive business.

San Lorenzo, Valle - February 2015

loans.use: to buy seafood, fish, shrimp, and clams for her business.

loans.name: Teresa

texts.en:
This is Teresa, a resident of Dasmarinas, Cavite, Philippines. Teresa is married to Arnolfo, a factory worker, and has one child. She manages her own household while operating the business. She works hard to augment their income for their daily household needs and for the schooling of her child.

Teresa has a direct selling business. She sells natural Royale health supplements and beauty products. Filipinos are now more knowledgeable and health conscious. They are learning to take natural vitamins and use glutathione soaps to improve their health, live a long life, and to whiten their skin. Her regular customers are her neighbors, friends, family, and the local community. She earns a minimum of 3,500 Philippines pesos (PHP) in sales every week.

To help her sustain her business, Teresa is requesting a 8,000 PHP loan, which she will use to buy Royale beauty and health supplement products such as Grapeseed capsules and Glutathione soaps. Her regular customers are her neighbors, relatives, friends and the local community. She is thanking God and you in advance for a good return of her investment and for the financial help that will be given to her.

Teresa aims to grow her business and hopes to uplift her quality of living. She prays to stay strong and healthy. She faithfully meets up with her co-fellowship members to share stories of her work every week and to also draw strength and inspiration from the Word of God she studies.

* All CCT community partners / clients are organized into fellowship groups that meet on a weekly basis. A fellowship group is composed of 15 to 30 community partners. The fellowship groups gather each week to study the Word of God, build social capital and pay Micro Finance loans.

loans.use: to pay for Royal health supplements and beauty products to sell.

loans.name: Apiza

texts.ru: Апиза, 52 года, замужем, вместе с супругом воспитали 3 детей. У Апизы высшее образование, в качестве основного дохода для своей семьи она занимается животноводством, стартовав с покупки скота на 20,000 сом (KGS). Благодаря упорному труду Апизы, в ее хозяйстве на сегодняшний день имеется: 2 коровы, 5 овец. Доход составляет до 45,000 сом (KGS) в квартал. В целях дальнейшего развития своего хозяйства, Апиза обратилась в Банк «Бай –Тушум» за кредитом в сумме 30,000 сом (KGS) на покупку коровы для откорма и реализации. Доходы от кредита Апиза планирует вложить в дальнейшее приумножение количества домашней скотины и хочет накопить на строительство дома.
texts.en: Apiza is 52 years old, married and, together with her husband, raised 3 children. Apiza has a college education and, to provide the primary income for her family, is involved in animal husbandry, having started this business with a 20,000 som (KGS) purchase of livestock. Thanks to Apiza's hard work, today her business contains 2 cows and 5 sheep. Her income amounts up to 45,000 som (KGS) per quarter. In order to further develop her business, Apiza requested a loan in the amount of 30,000 som (KGS) from the Bai-Tushum Bank to buy a cow for fattening up and resale. Apiza plans to invest the earnings from the loan into further increasing her livestock quantities and wants to to save money to build a house.

loans.use: to buy a cow for fattening up and resale

loans.name: Jorge Eduardo

texts.es:
Jorge, tiene la edad de 41 años, está soltero. Actualmente vive con sus padres solamente. El lo que quier comprar con el credito son terneros. El cuenta con el terreno apto para la explotacion de este proyecto y actualmente esta pensando en comprar unos ternero. El posee muy buenos pastos y espera poder tener esos terneros rapido paral a venta y asi sacarle probecho a su propiedad.
