El tiene como meta aumentar su productividad y ganancias para el sustento de el y sus padres.

Es el primer préstamo que recibido de FUDECOSUR. El no había tenido antes otros préstamos en bancos estatales, pero FUDECOSUR le ha brindado el préstamo con mayores facilidades y la tasa de intereses mucho más baja.
texts.en:
Jorge is 41 years old, single, and currently lives with his parents. He wants to buy calves with this loan so that he can take advantage of his land. Jorge has very good pastures, so he plans to buy a few calves so that they can develop quickly for resale. His goal is to increase his productivity and use his profits to support himself and his parents.

This is the first loan Jorge has received from FUDECOSUR. He has not previously received any other loans from the state banks. FUDECOSUR is offering this loan with better terms and a lower interest rate.

loans.use: to buy calves.

loans.name: María

texts.es:
María es una muchacha de 36 años de edad, es soltera vive junto a sus padres en una comunidad de Sololá.
María para generar sus ingresos y mantener a su familia, se dedica a la compra y venta de mostacia  desde hace once años en una comunidad circunvecina, ella cuenta que gracias a esta labor ha logrado apoyar a sus padres con las necesidades de la casa.
María cuenta que ahora ella necesita mejorar sus servicios a la clientela ofreciéndoles más productos, pero para surtir mejor el negocio ella necesita de una buena cantidad de dinero, aunque una de las limitaciones que María tiene es que no cuenta con el capital suficiente para realizar esta inversión, pero María es una mujer luchadora que no se limite ante nada, es por ello que ahora solicita un préstamo que lo invertirá comprando más productos de bisutería (mostacia)como piedras de jade, plata y anillos.
El gran anhelo de María es contar con un terreno propio para poder construir su casa propia.
texts.en:
María is a 36 year old woman. She is single and lives with her parents in a community of Sololá. In order to generate income and support her family, María has sold beaded necklaces for eleven years in a nearby community. She says that thanks to this work she has been able to help her parents with the household needs.  

María says that now she needs to improve her services to her customers, offering them more products. In order to better stock her business she needs a good quantity of money, although one of the limitations that María has is that she doesn't have enough capital to make this investment. But María is a fighter who doesn't limit herself at all. That is why she is now asking for a loan which she will invest in buying more jewelry products (beaded necklaces) such as jade stones, silver and rings.

María's big wish is to have her own plot of land in able to build her own house.

loans.use: to buy jewelry products such as jade stones, silver and rings.

loans.name: Elena

texts.en:
Elena is 66 years old and married. Both she and her husband work in retail; he sells vegetables and she sells clothes. They own a house, and their three children are independent. 

She is asking for a loan to buy clothes and restock her inventory. Her business is located outside her house and has been open for more than 10 years. Her biggest accomplishment is helping her husband with the family expenses.

loans.use: to buy clothes for her store.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy a cow and 5 sheep for fattening up and resale at a higher price

loans.name: José Santos

texts.es:
José, de 44 años de edad, es un señor muy trabajador, padre de 4 hijos, de las edades de 20, 17, 14 y 15 años, de los cuales 3 estudian y el mayor trabaja junto a él.- José, no tuvo la oportunidad de estudiar, no sabe leer, ni escribir; está acompañado y su pareja se dedica a los oficios domésticos.
	
José, se dedica a trabajar de jornalero en una finca de café, él siempre ha trabajaba de jornalero, debido a que su padre lo mandaba a trabajar para otras personas, fue así como él fue obteniendo experiencia y ahora ya tiene 15 años de trabajar en fincas de café, trabaja ocho horas, desde las siete de la mañana hasta las tres de la tarde.- Además de dedicarse a esta actividad, también se dedica a la agricultura, siembra maíz y frijol. 

Santos, gracias al financiamiento anterior, logro sembrar y obtener buenas cosechas, logró obtener mejores cosechas que le sirvieron para abastecer de alimentos a su familia durante el invierno.- Es por eso que está solicitando un nuevo crédito para comprar fertilizantes, abono y pagar mano de obra para preparar la tierra, de esta manera obtener buenas cosecha y así poder tener ingresos y alimentos para darles a su familia.

José, sueña con expandir más sus siembras, poder ampliarla más su casa y también desea poder tener un mejor empleo, para poder ganar más dinero y así poder cubrir todas las necesidades de su hogar.
texts.en:
José, age 44, is a hardworking man and the father of four children (ages 20, 17, 14, and 15). Three of his children are in school and the oldest one works with him. José did not have the opportunity to attend school, so he is not able to read or write. He is in a relationship and his partner takes care of the household duties.

José works as a day laborer on a coffee farm. He has always worked in this profession because his father had sent him off to work for other people. As a result, he has gained experience and now has been working on coffee farms for the past 15 years. José works eight hours, from 7:00 A.M. to 3:00 P.M. In addition to this job, he engages in agriculture by planting corn and beans.

Thanks to his previous loan, José Santos was able to plant his crops and obtain a good harvest. He was able to achieve a better harvest, which helped to supply food for his family during the winter. For this reason, he is requesting a loan so that he can pay for fertilizers, compost, and labor in order to prepare his land. This will help him to obtain a good harvest so that he can have income and food for his family.

José dreams of planting more crops, expanding his house, and securing a better job so that he can earn more money. This would allow him to cover all of his household needs.

loans.use: to pay for fertilizers, compost, and labor in order to prepare his land for planting.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy cell phone accessories and USBs to sell.

loans.name: Adolat

texts.en:
Adolat is a hardworking woman. She was born in the southern part of Tajikistan in 1969. She is divorced and has three children. She is a cleaning woman and works hard to feed her family. She also sews traditional women dresses at home. Her daughter helps with  the home cleaning and sewing businesses. 

She asks for financial support from KIVA lenders to buy construction materials to renovate her house. She wants to have a good standard of living. It is not easy in Tajikistan to be divorced and raise children alone. She hopes to be supported.

loans.use: to buy construction materials.

loans.name: Lizbeth

texts.es:
La socia Lizbeth pertenece al banco comunal “Todos Unidos”, la socia sigue dedicándose al negocio  de venta de auto partes, la socia se siente agradecida por el crédito otorgado y se compromete a cumplir con el pago de sus cuotas, la socia es una persona responsable y empeñosa, siendo de esta manera que la socia saca adelante a su familia.
La socia solicito el crédito para la compra de parabrisas, entre otros.
texts.en:
Lizbeth is a member of the Communal Bank “Todos Unidos” (Everyone Together). She continues to manage her business of selling auto parts. Lizbeth is grateful for the loan that has been issued and promises to complete her payments. She is a responsible and diligent individual. By working in this manner, she is able to help her family get ahead.

Lizbeth is requesting a loan in order to buy windshields and other products.

loans.use: to buy windshields and other products.

loans.name: El Triunfo Group

texts.es:
Los socios pertenecen al banco comunal “EL TRIUNFO”; Este banco se ubicada en el distrito de Lamay, perteneciente a la provincia de Calca y departamento de Cusco.

La socia es la Sra. Teodora ella es conviviente y tiene 38 años; La socia trabaja en su negocio de  crianza de animales menores, la socia cría a estos animalitos para luego venderlos a  sus clientes que le solictan, la socia lleva buen tiempo con su negocio el cual le va bien gracias al empeño que le, pone cada día a su negocio, la socia a la vez se dedica a la venta de chicha, siendo de esta manera que la socia saca adelante a su familia.

La socia solicita el crédito para comprar maíz, jora entre otros.

Los otros socios se dedican al negocio de agricultura, negocio de venta de animales, negocio de tienda de abarrotes y negocio de comida.

La socia agradece a quienes forman parte de este sueño mediante este medio y se compromete a cumplir con el pago de sus cuotas en el plazo establecido.
texts.en:
These members belong to “El Triunfo” communal bank.  The bank is located in the Lamay district of the Calca province, department of Cusco. The member is Teodora, she lives with her partner and is 38 years old. She works raising small animals. She raises these small animals to then sell them to clients who request them. She has worked with her business for some time now and it is going well because of the effort that she puts in her business every day.  She also sells “chicha” (a drink made from corn) this is how she maintains her family. She is asking for a loan to buy corn, maize among others. 

The other members work in agriculture, animal sales, grocery store and in the food business. The member thanks those who are part of this dream through this means and she promises to make her loan payments as scheduled.

loans.use: to buy corn, maize among others.

loans.name: Ruth Iracema

texts.es:
Ruth, de 28 años de edad, estudio hasta bachillerato y está soltera, sus padres se dedican a la agricultura y a la crianza de pollos, ella les ayuda con las actividades que realizan. 

Ruth, se dedica a comercializar pollos de engorde, este oficio se lo enseño su madre, mientras su padre trabaja en las parcelas durante la mañana, ella le ayuda y en la tarde comercializa el pollo en los alrededores y entre los vecinos. 

Ruth, necesita el crédito para comprar más pollos para engordar y para construir una galera más amplia, para mantener a los pollos.

Ruth, sueña en un futuro tener una granja grande de pollos de engorde y poder comercializarlos al por mayor.
texts.en:
Ruth, 28, studied until high school and is single. Her parents work as farmers and raise chickens. She helps them with the tasks that they carry out. 

Ruth sells broiler chickens, a profession she learned from her mother. She helps her father whilst he works on the land plots during the mornings and in the afternoons she sells the chickens in the surrounding areas and to the neighbours. 

Ruth needs the loan to buy more broiler chickens and to build a bigger chicken coop in which to keep them. 

Ruth's dreams for the future are to have a big broiler chicken farm and to be able to sell them wholesale.

loans.use: to buy more broiler chickens and to build a bigger chicken coop in which to keep them

loans.name: Ailyn

texts.en:
Ailyn is a 42-year-old married hard working entrepreneur with four children, all attend school.

Ailyn  has had a  foods business for 10 years and requests 6,000 PHP amount through NWTF to purchase  sausage, hot dogs, and other frozen products to sell.

She would like to save enough money to send her children to college.

loans.use: to purchase sausage, hot dogs, and other frozen products.

loans.name: Robertina

texts.es: ROBERTINA: Es una mujer miskita originaria de Río Coco; es luchadora, tiene 50 años de edad, madre soltera de 9 hijos: 4 son mayores de edad, 3  adolescentes que estudian su primaria y secundaria y 2 menores de edad. Trabaja como maestra en una escuela rural de educación primaria. Desde hace 30 años habita en una pequeña vivienda  de madera; con el propósito de tener una vivienda más segura y con mejores condiciones, solicita financiamiento para cambiar madera y comprar materiales de construcción: madera cepillada, clavos y cubrir costos de mano de obra. Su sueño es poder  terminar de mejorar su vivienda de tambo y madera, construirle los cuartos a sus hijos, cocina para poder vivir más segura con sus hijos menores.
texts.en:
Robertina is a determined woman who is of Miskito ethnicity and originally from Río Coco. She is 50 years old and a single mother of nine children. Four of her children are grown, three are teenagers who attend high school, and the two youngest ones are in elementary school.

Robertina works as a teacher at rural primary school. She has been living in a small wooden house for the past 30 years. Robertina wants to have a home that is more secure and has better conditions. She is requesting a loan in order to replace the wood, so she will buy construction materials, such as lumber and nails, and pay the cost of labor. Her dream is to finish the improvements to her wooden stilt house and build rooms for her children. She also wants to have a kitchen so that she can live more securely with her younger children.

loans.use: to pay for lumber, nails, and labor so that she can replace the old wood in her house.

loans.name: Dúo Bondad Group

texts.es:
Dúo Bondad
Dúo formado por Telma Alicia ella es originaria de el paraje el sauce. se dedica a la elaboración de tejidos típicos. Vende sus güipiles en el mercado municipal. Lo que ella anhela es tener más capital para poder comprar más hilo y materiales para la elaboración de sus güipiles, y así obtener mejores ingresos para así ayudar a su esposo al mantenimiento de su hogar. Es el segundo crédito que solicita a la fundación y no tiene créditos en otra institución, esto le ha ayudado a hacer sus pagos con puntualidad. Agradece a Kiva la confianza y el apoyo que le han brindado.
texts.en:
“Bondad” (Kindness) Group

This group was started by Telma Alicia, who is originally from the town of El Sauce. She produces traditional woven goods and sells her woven dresses at the municipal market. Her wish is to have more capital so that she can buy thread and materials for making her woven dresses. As a result, she can generate more income and help her husband with maintaining their household.

This is the second loan she has requested from FAPE and she has not received loans from any other institution. As a result, she has been able to make her payments on time. Telma Alicia expresses her appreciation to Kiva for the trust and support that has been shown to her.

loans.use: to buy materials for making traditional woven goods.

loans.name: Lizel

texts.en:
Lizel is thankful that she was granted a 12,000 PHP loan to buy chicken and fish for her retail business.  Her earnings helped support her family and meet their daily basic needs. She is also a dealer of natural medicines named Jinga Juice.

She would now like to apply for a 10,000 loan  to pay for boxes of Jinga Juice which is a powdered juice made of wheat grass and guyabano. She is encouraged by the positive feedback of the natural juice. Her customers are happy with its health benefits and they are regular clients. She is thanking God and you in advance for the financial assistance that will be given to her and a good return on her investment for it will  fund their everyday needs.

Lizel dreams of building her own store to display her products and attract more customers. She continually prays for a happy and victorious family. She faithfully meets  with her co-fellowship members weekly to share stories of her work and drawss strength and inspiration from the Word of God that she studies. 

* All CCT community partners / clients are organized into fellowship groups that meet on a weekly basis. A fellowship group is composed of 15 to 30 community partners. The fellowship groups gather each week to study the Word of God, build social capital and repay Micro Finance loans.

loans.use: to pay for boxes of Jinga Juice to sell.

loans.name: John

texts.en:
John is 31 years old. He supports four members of the family. He has two children. 

John runs a motorcycle business and he has been in the business for two years. He earns a monthly income of KES 6,000 which he uses to support his family. 

He plans to use the loan to buy spare parts and to use the anticipated profits to purchase another motorbike to offer better service and meet the demands of his customers. 

This is John's first loan with VisionFund Kenya. His hope and dream is to educate his children.

loans.use: to buy spare parts.

loans.name: Gloria

texts.en:
Gloria works hard to support her family. Gloria is married and has had a fish business for 5 years.  She earns additional income from operating a general store.

Gloria requests 7,000 PHP through NWTF to purchase more boxes of dried fish to sell.

She would like to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to purchase boxes of dried fish to sell.

loans.name: Bernadeth

texts.en:
Bernadeth is a 54-year-old widowed woman with six children, five attend school. Bernadeth works very hard to provide for them.

Bernadeth has run a general store for 1 year and requests 5,000 PHP through NWTF to buy canned goods, eggs, home care products, and other groceries.

In the future, Bernadeth would like to save enough money  to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy canned goods, eggs, home care products,  and other groceries.

loans.name: Karen

texts.en:
Karen is a 37-year-old married woman with four children, all attend school. Karen works very hard to provide for her family.

Karen has run a general store for 15 years and requests 10,500 loan through NWTF to purchase soft-drinks, canned goods, personal care products, coffee, milk, and bread.

She would like to save enough money  to send her children to college.

loans.use: to purchase soft-drinks, canned goods, personal  care products, coffee, milk, and bread.

loans.name: Martha

texts.es: Martha, tiene la edad  de 31 años, está soltera,  vive con sus padres y sus hermanos, los cuales su mayor prioridad. Con su crédito pretende hacer la compra de fertilizantes y otros productos para aplicarle a la siembra del cultivo de café y así que tenga una buena desarrollo, y de un almácigo de la variedad inverníz con un buen desarrollo y sanidad adecuada, además pagar mano de obra para la aplicación de los productos y asistencia de la plantación y algunos trabajos para la conservación de suelos y de esta manera asegurarse de realizar un buen trabajo. Lo que pretende es aprovechar las buenas condiciones de clima y suelo que cuenta la zona para este cultivo, y también poner en práctica la experiencia de varios años en el manejo de café. Además de poder comprar los mejores productos y de mejor calidad para que su plantación tenga un buen desarrollo y sanidad al igual que una cosecha adecuada, y tener a futuro una producción importante. Con el ingreso de la cosecha que espera obtener quiere utilizarla en el bienestar y estudio de su familia y cumplir con algunas metas familiares y seguir invirtiendo más en los cultivos. Es el primer  préstamo que  recibido de FUDECOSUR. Ella no había tenido antes otros préstamos en bancos estatales, pero FUDECOSUR le ha brindado el préstamo con mayores facilidades y la tasa de intereses mucho más baja.
texts.en:
Martha is 31 years old. She is single and lives with her parents and her siblings, who are her highest priority. 

She plans to use her loan to purchase fertilizers and other products for the proper growth of her coffee crop; to purchase seedlings of the winter variety that have good development and are healthy; and also to pay for labor to help her with the application of the products and crop maintenance, and to perform other tasks for soil conservation in order to ensure that a good job is being done. 

She plans to take advantage of the good climatic and soil conditions that the area has for this type of crop and also to put into practice the experience that she has gained after several years of growing coffee. Additionally, she plans to buy the best quality products to grow a healthy crop, yield a good harvest, and have a significant production in the future. 

With the income she hopes to obtain from the harvest, she wants to look after the welfare and education of her family, fulfill some family goals, and continue to invest further in her crop.

This is the first loan that she has received from FUDECOSUR. She hadn't not had any other previous loans from state-owned banks, but FUDECOSUR has granted her the loan with better repayment terms and a much lower interest rate.

loans.use: to care for her coffee crop.

loans.name: Emerita

texts.en:
Emerita is a 61-year-old married woman with three children.

She has earned a living by raising livestock for 20 years and requests 20,000 through NWTF to buy more livestock.  She earns additional income from food vending.

She works tirelessly to attain her dream which is to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy more livestock.

loans.name: Elisa

texts.en:
Elisa is a 56-year-old married woman with three children, 1 attends school. She is a very hard working entrepreneur.

Elisa has had a bakery business for 24 years and requests 6,000 PHP through NWTF to buy ingredients for her food production business.

In the future, Elisa would like to save enough money to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: to buy ingredients for her food production business.

loans.name: Filecesema

texts.en:
Filecesema is a married woman, 61 years old, with four children. She is a very hardworking entrepreneur.

Filecesema has a rice retailing business in the Philippines. She requested a PHP 11,000 loan amount through NWTF to purchase more sacks of rice to sell.

Filecesema has been in this business for five years. She would like to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to purchase more sacks of rice to sell.

loans.name: Esther

texts.en:
Esther is 52 years old and married with five children. With three of her children in school, Esther works very hard to provide for them.

She  runs a general store in the Philippines and requested a PHP 12,000 loan through NWTF to buy items to sell like canned goods, condiments, home care products, etc.

Esther has been in this business for three years now. In the future, she would like to save enough money to be able to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy items to sell, like canned goods, condiments, home care products, etc.

loans.name: Paul

texts.en:
Paul  was born and raised in the remote Kapsowar area of Kenya, where  land and family are part of your life, and you live for the land and the land lives for you. 

He has farmed for 15 years and makes money through other personal efforts. 

Paul is passionate about dairy farming but  faces such challenges as the high prices of animal feed.  He  deals  with the challenges one-by-one. 

Paul stated that he joined Juhudi in order to make his dreams for his farm and family come true. He requests 50,000 KES  through Juhudi Kilimo to buy a water tank and run water for a wide variety of uses such as drainage and irrigation. This will provide his cows with constant access to water and his land will stay well irrigated. 

Paul will use the load to improve his farm. When he was asked how the loan would benefit his family, he said that more milk to sell would mean he could invest in his child’s education. Help him out!

loans.use: to  buy a water tank.

loans.name: Rael

texts.en:
Rael is  a 62-year-old married woman blessed with four children. She joined Hand in Hand Eastern Africa  to benefit from training on enterprise development and financial management. This has helped her to improve her knowledge in business management.

She runs a grocery shop to earn a living and requests a loan to buy vegetables for her kiosk. This will increase her  income enabling her to continue supporting her family. Her living conditions  will also improve.

Rael is very grateful to Kiva and their lenders for the help and support.

loans.use: to buy  vegetables.

loans.name: Grupo Xecuchin Sector Escuela. Group

texts.es:
Manuel (el primero del lado izquierdo de la fotografía de playera negra) un padre de familia trabajador y dedicado, tiene 36 años de edad, es casado y cuenta con una linda familia de tres hijos de los cuales dos ya están estudiando y uno se encuentra aún bajo el cuidado de la madre, esta humilde familia vive en una comunidad de Sololá.

Manuel para generar sus ingresos y mantener a su familia tiene una pequeña tienda de compra y venta de abarrotes en el lugar de su domicilio desde hace 7 años, él cuenta que gracias a este pequeño negocio ha logrado sacar adelante a su familia.
Manuel con la mente positiva  a tenido la idea de mejorar su pequeño negocio, pues en el lugar donde él vive no hay muchas tiendas, por lo que deberá mejorar  sus servicios, ofreciéndole a la clientela más productos, aunque Manuel no cuenta con suficiente capital para poder realizar esta inversión, pero Manuel no es un hombre de limitaciones, por lo que para alcanzar su objetivo a organizado a un grupo de personas para solicitar un prestamo que lo invertirá comprando azúcar, aceite, recitos, gaseosas, frijoles, arroz.
Manuel su gran sueño es poder ver su tienda más surtida, para satisfacer las necesidades de la clientela.
texts.en:
Manuel (the first person standing on the left, wearing a black T-shirt) is a hardworking and dedicated father. He is 36 years old, married, and has a beautiful family that includes his three children. Two of his children are in school and one is still being cared for by his wife. This humble family lives in the community of Sololá.

In order to generate income to support his family, Manuel manages a small store in his home where he buys and sells groceries. His business has been existence for seven years. He is grateful for this business since it has allowed his family to get ahead.

Manuel came up with the positive idea of improving his small business. He lives in a place where there aren’t many stores, so he thought he should improve his services by offering more products to his customers. However, Manuel does not have sufficient capital in order to make this investment. He is not a man who knows limitations. In order to achieve his goal, he organized a group of people in order to request a loan. Manuel will invest in the purchase of sugar, oil, snack foods, sodas, beans, and rice.

His greatest wish is to have a well-stocked store so that he can satisfy the needs of his customers.

loans.use: to buy sugar, oil, snack foods, sodas, beans, and rice.

loans.name: Sonaiym

texts.ru: Сонайым 53 года, замужем, воспитывает 6 детей, 2 младших сына живут с Сонайым. У нее средне-специальное образование, закончила швейное училище, работала в текстильном училище. С молодости занимается животноводством.  По характеру очень добрая, ответственная, спокойная. Имея развитое хозяйство, Сонайым получает ежемесячную прибыль в сумме до 30,000 сом (KGS). У Сонайым есть 4 коровы, 12 овец, на 2,69 Га она выращивает пшеницу и многолетние травы. В целях дальнейшего развития своего бизнеса, Сонайым обратилась в Банк «Бай – Тушум» за кредитом в сумме 30,000 сом (KGS) на покупку удобрений для обработки почвы и скота для увеличения поголовья. Доходы от кредита Сонайым планирует вложить в дальнейшее увеличение своего хозяйства и накопить на ремонт дома.
texts.en: Sonaiym is 53 years old, married and raising 6 children. Two of her youngest sons live with her. Sonaiym has a specialized secondary education, graduated from a sewing college and worked at a textile college. She has been involved in animal husbandry since her youth. She is very kind, responsible and calm. Sonaiym earns a monthly profit in the amount of up to 30,000 som (KGS) from her well-developed business. Sonaiym has 4 cows, 12 sheep and 2.69 hectares of land, where she grows wheat and perennial herbs. In order to continue developing her business, Sonaiym requested a loan in the amount of 30,000 som (KGS) from the Bai-Tushum Bank to buy fertilizers to treat the soil and livestock to increase her livestock headcount. Sonaiym plans to invest the earnings from the loan into further growing her business and saving money to repair her house.

loans.use: to buy fertilizers to treat the soil and livestock to increase her livestock headcount

loans.name: Kolonbi

texts.ru: Калонби жительница не большого района под именем Шахритус. Ей 45 лет. Она добрая, гостеприимная и культурная женщина. Калонби замужем и имеет четверых детей. Детям 22, 18, 17 и 14 лет. Ее муж находится на территории Российской Федерации на заработках. Калонби работает учительницей в средней местной школе. Она в свободное время, как и большинство жителей, занимается животноводством. Ее зарплата очень маленькая и она вынуждена иметь дополнительный источник дохода.  Калонби решила обратиться за кредитом, чтобы расширить животноводческую деятельность. За счет заемных средств, она приобретет несколько голов скотин, увеличить поголовья скотов, расшириться бизнес и увеличится доход. Она верит в Вашу поддержку.
texts.en: Kolonbi is a resident of a small district, called Shahrituz. She is 45 years old. She is a kind, welcoming and polite woman. Kolonbi is married and has four children, who are 22, 18, 17 and 14 years old. Her husband currently works on the territory of the Russian Federation. Kolonbi works as a teacher at a local secondary school. In her free time, just like the majority of local residents, she is involved in animal husbandry. Her salary is very low, forcing her to have an additional source of income. Kolonbi decided to request a loan to expand her animal husbandry business. She will buy several heads of livestock with this loan, and her business and income will grow due to the increased livestock headcount. She believes in Your support.

loans.use: to buy several heads of livestock in order to grow her business and income

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy kola nuts [for resale].

loans.name: Jocelyn

texts.en:
Jocelyn has operated a sari-sari(variety) store, for 10 years,  to sell basic commodities like biscuits, chips, seasonings, sugar, coffee, toiletries, and others goods. She is a 55-year-old widow woman from Talibon, Bohol with two grown children. 

She is asking for a loan to increase her stock  and purchase a pig. The stock will help attract customers to  her store . Her income will increase and start to balance her finances.

Jocelyn hopes that someday, she could experience fullness of life through a sustainable livelihood.

loans.use: to buy stock for the store and purchase a pig.

loans.name: Amancia

texts.en:
Amancia works hard to support her family of 3 children.

She has a personal products business and earns additional income selling clothing and vegetables. Amancia is borrowing  29,500 PHP through NWTF to purchase personal products to sell.

Amancia has been sustaining her business activities through her  24 previous loans from NWTF. She hopes that her hard work will help her attain her dream  which is to save money and expand her business.

loans.use: to purchase personal products to sell.

loans.name: Nancy

texts.en:
The person in the photo is Nancy. She is 30 years old and blessed with two children. After joining Hand in Hand Eastern Africa, she received training on business and financial management. Nancy started a kiosk selling fruits and vegetables.

She is borrowing a Kiva loan to buy more fruits to stock her kiosk. She hopes this will help her to improve her sales and thus generate more income to cater for her family's needs.

Nancy appreciates Kiva and their lenders for the help and promises to repay the loan promptly.

loans.use: to buy more foodstuffs to sell in her kiosk, thus increasing her sales and profits.

loans.name: Anonymous Group
loans.use: to purchase construction materials to provide a safe living space for the family.

loans.name: Carorine

texts.en:
Carorine is a 54-year-old married woman with four children, 1 child attends school. She is a very hard working entrepreneur. 

Carorine has had a food vending business for 10 years and requests 11,000 PHP through NWTF to buy cooking oil, meat, fish, and flour.

She would like to save enough money to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: to buy cooking oil, meat, fish, and flour.

loans.name: Omina

texts.ru: Омина, 55 лет, замужем, 3 детей. У Омины высшее образование, по специальности педагог, сейчас ведет математику в школе. По характеру она очень трудолюбивая, добрая и пунктуальная. На протяжении 20 лет также занимается полеводством и животноводством. Благодаря упорному труду Омины, в ее хозяйстве на сегодняшний день имеется 6 овец, также обрабатывает 0,4 ГА собственной земельной доли, выращивая картофель, морковь и кукурузу, реализуя ее оптовым покупателям. Совокупная ежемесячная прибыль составляет около 10,000 сом (KGS), заработная плата составляет 6,023 сом (KGS). В целях дальнейшего развития своего хозяйства, она обратилась в Банк "Бай-Тушум" за кредитом в сумме 30,000 сом (KGS) на покупку семян на сумму 18,000 сом (KGS) и удобрений на 12,000 сом (KGS), что позволит ей выращивать экологически чистую продукцию. Доходы от кредита Омина планирует вложить в дальнейшее развитие бизнеса и хочет накопить средства на свадьбу дочери.
texts.en: Omina is 55 years old, married and has 3 children. Omina has a college education, she is a teacher and currently teaches mathematics in school. She is very hardworking, kind and punctual. She has also been involved in farming and animal husbandry for 20 years. Thanks to Omina's hard work, today her farm contains 6 sheep and also 0.4 hectares of her own land, where she grows potatoes, carrots and corn, and then sells these crops to wholesale customers. Her combined monthly profit amounts to about 10,000 som (KGS), and her salary amounts to 6,023 som (KGS). In order to continue developing her business, she requested a loan in the amount of 30,000 som (KGS) from the Bai-Tushum Bank to buy seeds with 18,000 som (KGS) and fertilizers with 12,000 som (KGS). This purchase will allow her to grow ecologically clean crops. Omina plans to invest the earnings from the loan into further developing her business and wants to save money for her daughter's wedding.

loans.use: to buy seeds and fertilizers in order to grow eco-friendly potatoes, carrots and corn for sale

loans.name: Nazokat

texts.en:
Nazokat is an agrarian woman. She was born in the southern part of Tajikistan in a small village. She is married and has four children. Her husband is a taxi driver. 

She has been practicing agriculture for more than three years. Nazokat and her family are busy with working the agricultural land. Recently, she planted spring onions and wants to get a good harvest. She is planning to plant simple onions after the harvest of the spring onions. 

She is asking for a loan to buy seeds and fertilizer for her business. Nazokat is hoping to be supported by KIVA lenders.

loans.use: To buy seeds and fertilizer

loans.name: Teddy

texts.en:
Teddy is a father of two children; he is engaged in a bookbinding business and encoding business. It has been his business for five years. 

He decided to take a loan to buy an additional machine for printing to generate more income. 

Teddy future plan is to expand his business to sustain the needs of his family.

loans.use: to buy an additional machine for printing.

loans.name: Lerma

texts.en:
Lerma is a married woman; she is 60 years old with eight children. She is a very hard working entrepreneur. Lerma has a buy and sell fertilized duck egg business in the Philippines. 

She requested a PHP 5,000 loan amount through NWTF to buy more fertilized duck eggs to sell for her customers.

Lerma has been in this business for 10 years. She would like to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy more fertilized duck eggs

loans.name: Bibiana

texts.en:
Bibiana is married and works hard to support her family. She does business buying and selling soft drinks in the Philippines and has requested a PHP 7,000 loan through NWTF to purchase more soft drinks to sell.

Bibiana has been in this business for 17 years now. She would like to build and expand her business to secure the future of her family.

loans.use: to purchase more soft drinks to sell

loans.name: Imelda

texts.en:
Imelda is 43 years old and married with three children. With three children in school, she works very hard to provide for them.

Imelda runs a general store in the Philippines, and requested a PHP 6,000 loan through NWTF to buy items to sell like canned goods, beverages, home care products and other groceries.

Imelda has been in this business for 18 years now. 

In the future, she would like to save enough money so she could afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy items to sell like canned goods, beverages, home care products and other groceries

loans.name: Susan

texts.en:
Susan is 47 years old, and married with three children.

She works hard to provide for her family. She runs a general store in the Philippines, and requested a PHP 15,000 loan through NWTF to purchase more groceries to sell like canned goods, milk, coffee, bread, detergent, etc.

Susan has borrowed and paid seven loans from NWTF before this loan. She has been running the general store for 15 years, and also earns an income from food vending.

Susan aspires to save enough to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: to purchase more groceries to sell like canned goods, milk, coffee, bread, detergent, etc

loans.name: Julieta

texts.en:
Julieta, a 36-year-old married mother of four children, three of whom are in school, has been raising pigs in the Philippines for five years now. The recipient of three previous loans from NWTF, she has requested a new one for PHP 10000 in order to buy feeds and vitamins for her pigs.

In the future, Julieta would like to save enough money to expand her business and continue to send her children to school.

loans.use: to buy feeds and vitamins for her pigs.

loans.name: Jackielyn

texts.en:
Jackielyn is a married woman with four children. She is 30 years old and three of her children are in school. She is a very hard working entrepreneur.

Jackielyn has a food vending business in the Philippines. She has been in this business for 1 year. She requested a PHP 10,000 loan amount through NWTF to buy ingredients for her food production business.

In the future, Jackielyn would like to save enough money so she could afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy ingredients for her food production business

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to pay for his and his brother's semester fees.

loans.name: Sokleap's Group

texts.en:
Sokleap’s group members live in a rural village in Kandal province in Cambodia. Sokleap makes a living cultivating rice, and she also does extra work as a tailor to support her family. 

In their village there is no reliable access to safe, clean drinking water. Having a water filter at home will help each of these women to safeguard the health of their families and save money on medical expenses and save time collecting fuel and boiling water.

loans.use: To buy a water filter to provide safe drinking water for their family.

loans.name: Soeung's Group

texts.en: Soeung’s group live in a rural village in Kandal province in Cambodia. Soeung makes a living cultivating rice and she also does extra work as tailor to support her family. In their village there is no reliable access to safe, clean drinking water. Having a water filter at home will help them safeguard the health of their families, save money on medical expenses, and save time collecting fuel and boiling water.

loans.use: to buy a water filter to provide safe drinking water for her family.

loans.name: Choecn's Group

texts.en: Choecn’s group lives in a rural village in Kandal province in Cambodia. Choecn makes a living cultivating rice and she also does extra work as tailor to support her family. She has one youngest boy in her family. In their village there is no reliable access to safe, clean drinking water. Having a water filter at home will help each of these women to safeguard the health of their families, save money on medical expenses, and save time collecting fuel and boiling water.

loans.use: to buy a water filter to provide safe drinking water for her family.

loans.name: Samol's Group

texts.en: Samol’s group live in a rural village in Kandal province in Cambodia. Samol makes a living cultivating rice and she also does extra work as tailor to support her family. In their village there is no reliable access to safe, clean drinking water. Having a water filter at home will help each of these women and man to safeguard the health of their families, save money on medical expenses, and save time collecting fuel and boiling water.

loans.use: to buy a water filter to provide safe drinking water for her family.

loans.name: Scem's Group

texts.en:
Scem’s group members live in a rural village in Kandal province in Cambodia.  Scem makes a living cultivating rice, and she also does extra work as tailor to support her family. 

In their village there is no reliable access to safe, clean drinking water. Having a water filter at home will help each of these women to safeguard the health of their families and save money on medical expenses and save time collecting fuel and boiling water.

loans.use: To buy a water filter to provide safe drinking water for their family.

loans.name: Unidas De San Lorenzo Group

texts.es:
17 son las mujeres que integran este grupo, donde se destaca la Sra. Mirta, quien en su última encuesta mostro un nivel de pobreza dentro del nivel  dos, es decir que está en un nivel medio de pobreza.
Ellas hacen la encuesta de eliminación de la pobreza para poder conocer su situación de vida y conforme a ello poder ir mejorando cada día y ayudar a sus familias. Mirta se dedica a la venta de prendas varias, y con ello tiene los medios para poder ayudar a sus seres queridos. 
Mirta pide este préstamo para poder comprar remeras, jeans, camisas, pantalones y otros. Agradece por la oportunidad que recibe de poder crecer y salir adelante.
texts.en:
There are seventeen women who make up this group and Señora Mirta is emphasized. In her latest survey, Mirta demonstrated a level two on the poverty scale, which is a medium level. These women participate in the poverty elimination survey in order to understand their living situation and to be able to continue improving every day and to help their families.

Mirta makes a living selling various articles of clothing and with this business she has the way to be able to help her loved ones. Mirta requests this loan to be able to buy t-shirts, jeans, shirts, pants, and other things. She is thankful for the opportunity she receives to be able to grow and get ahead.

loans.use: to purchase t-shirts, jeans, shirts, pants, and other things

loans.name: Marciana

texts.en:
Marciana is a 36-year-old married mother of four children, all of whom are in school. She is doing her best to meet her children's needs, working especially hard so they can complete their education. Her priority in life is to have enough savings for their education. 

Marciana and her husband have an iron works business that makes steel and ordinary windows, sliding doors, fences and grills. She has requested a loan of P20,000 to buy glass, stainless steel and other materials needed in their enterprise. 

Marciana believes that the loan will be a big help in both maintaining  and expanding the business. She hopes to accept more orders so as to earn greater income.

loans.use: to buy glass, stainless steel and other materials needed in their business.

loans.name: Phoebe Joy

texts.en:
Phoebe Joy is 28 years old and married with one children. With one child still in school, Phoebe Joy works very hard to provide for them.

Phoebe Joy runs a general store in the Philippines and requested a PHP 12,000 loan through NWTF to buy items to sell like canned goods, personal care products, milk, coffee, sugar, cooking oil, spice, bread, etc. She has been in this business for 10 years.

She would like to save enough to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: to buy items to sell like canned goods, personal care products, milk, coffee, sugar, cooking oil, spices, bread, etc.

loans.name: Gwena

texts.en:
Gwena is 62 years old and married with two children. She works hard to provide for her family. She runs a general store in the Philippines and has requested a PHP 29,000 loan through NWTF to purchase more groceries to sell.

Gwena has borrowed and repaid 25 loans from NWTF before this loan. She has been running the general store for 30 years and also earns an income from food vending.

Gwena aspires to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to purchase more groceries to sell.

loans.name: Julio Jose

texts.es:
Julio José es un joven estudiante de medicina, él solicita un préstamo para poder cubrir sus gastos educativo, esta es su historia: Mi nombre es Julio José estudio medicina en UCATECI  La Vega  vivo con mi madre y mi hermana que es  quien cubre los gastos de la casa, mi madre no trabaja  ya que por su enfermedad no puede hacerlo, es sobreviviente de una grave enfermedad y eso me motivó a empezar estudiar medicina para tratar a ese tipo de personas que tengan esta terrible enfermedad.  
Estoy solicitando ayuda en Kiva ya que mi hermana no puede seguir cubriendo los gastos de los medicamentos de mi madre y también mis estudios, de no lograr el préstamo sería muy  difícil continuar, por lo que solicito que por favor sea aprobado para cumplir mi meta de ser un gran médico.
Mi mayor deseo es hacerme una gran profesional y poder ayudar a las personas que me necesiten.
texts.en:
Julio José is a young medical student.  He is asking for a loan to be able to cover his educational expenses.  

This is his story:  My name is Julio Jose.  I study medicine in UCATECI, La Vega.  I live with my mother and sister; she is the one who takes care of the household expenses.  My mother doesn’t work because due to her illness, she can’t.  She is a survivor of a serious illness.  This motivated me to begin studying medicine, in order to treat the people who have this terrible disease.

I am asking Kiva for help because my sister can’t keep taking care of the expenses of my mother’s medicine and also my schooling.  If I didn’t get the loan, it would be very difficult to continue, so I am asking to please be approved in order to meet my goal of being a great doctor.

My biggest wish is to become a great professional and to be able to help people who need me.

loans.use: to cover higher education expenses.

loans.name: Glaiza

texts.en:
Glaiza is 29 years old and married with two children. With one child is still in school, she works very hard to provide for them.

Glaiza runs a general store in the Philippines, and requested a PHP 12,000 loan through NWTF to buy items to sell like canned goods, personal care products, cooking oil, soft drinks, milk, coffee, bread, etc.

Glaiza has been in this business for five years. 

She would like to build and expand her business to secure the future of her family.

loans.use: to buy items to sell like canned goods, personal care products, cooking oil, soft drinks, milk, coffee, bread, etc

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To buy poultry

loans.name: Souka

texts.fr: Mariée et âgée de 29 ans, Souka est une femme qui vit à Adidogomé avec ses deux enfants. Dans son domicile, Souka vend des glaçons et du jus glacé préparé à l’aide du fruit de baobab et des feuilles d’hibiscus à ses clients. Pour répondre efficacement aux besoins, Souka s’approvisionne une fois par mois au marché. Souka demande ce crédit pour commander des bols de fruits de baobab et les feuilles afin de réaliser encore plus de revenus pour aider son mari dans les charges quotidiennes de la famille.
texts.en: Souka is 29 years and married. She lives in Adidogome with her two children. Out of her home, Souka sells ice and frozen juice prepared from  baobab fruit and hibiscus leaves. In order to  keep up with the demand, Souka stocks up once a month at the market. Souka is requesting this loan to stock up on baobab fruit and [hibiscus] leaves in order to increase her revenues and help her husband provide for everyday household needs.

loans.use: to buy 90 bowls of baobab fruit and 78 bowls of hibiscus leaves.

loans.name: Yudis Del Carmen

texts.es:
Yudis, de 23 años de edad, estudio hasta noveno grado, está acompañada y su pareja se dedica a la agricultura y tienen 1 hijo de 2 años de edad. 

Yudis, se dedica a trabajar en la agricultura, este oficio se lo ha enseñado su pareja; durante la mañana trabajan en las parcelas que alquilan y en el transcurso de la tarde, se dedican a ordeñar las vacas, para elaborar queso y venderlo. 

Yudis, necesita el crédito para comprar abono, semilla y pagar el alquiler de la tierra donde sembrarán. 
Ella espera obtener una buena cosecha, para cubrir las necesidades de su familia.

Yudis, planea ahorrar de la venta de queso y de las ganancias de la cosecha, para comprar un terreno para poder pastar sus animales.
texts.en:
Yudis is 23 years old and studied through the 9th grade. She has a partner who works in agriculture and they have a son who is 2 years old. Yudis works in agriculture, she learned this trade from her partner. In the mornings they work in the plots they rent and in the afternoons they milk the cows to make and sell cheese.

Yudis needs a loan to buy fertilizer, seeds and to pay the rent of the land were they will plant. She hopes to have a good harvest to cover the needs of her family. Yudis plans to save money from the sale of cheese and from the profits of the harvest to buy a piece of land to graze her animals.

loans.use: to buy fertilizer, seeds and to pay the rent of the land where they will plant.

loans.name: Van's Group

texts.en:
Van’s group members live in a rural village in Kandal province in Cambodia. Van makes a living cultivating rice, and he also does extra work as a tailor to support his family. 

In their village there is no reliable access to safe, clean drinking water. Having a water filter at home will help each of the members to safeguard the health of their families, save money on medical expenses and save time collecting fuel and boiling water.

loans.use: To buy a water filter to provide safe drinking water for their family.

loans.name: Sokea's Group

texts.en:
Sokea’s group members live in a rural village in Kandal province in Cambodia. Sokea makes a living cultivating rice, and she also does extra work as a tailor to support her family. 

In their village there is no reliable access to safe, clean drinking water. Having a water filter at home will help each of the members to safeguard the health of their families, save money on medical expenses and save time collecting fuel and boiling water.

loans.use: To buy a water filter to provide safe drinking water for their family.

loans.name: Srey's Group

texts.en:
Srey’s group lives in a rural village in Pailin province in Cambodia. Srey works as farmer to support her family. 

In their village there is no reliable access to safe, clean drinking water. Having a water filter at home will help each of these women to safeguard the health of their families, save money on medical expenses, and save time collecting fuel and boiling water.

loans.use: To buy a water filter to provide safe drinking water for their family.

loans.name: Sim's Group

texts.en:
Sim’s group live in a rural village in Pailin province in Cambodia. Sim makes a living cultivating rice and she also does extra work as a village coordinator to support her family. 

In their village there is no reliable access to safe, clean drinking water. Having a water filter at home will help each of these women to safeguard the health of their families, save money on medical expenses and save time collecting fuel and boiling water.

loans.use: To buy a water filter to provide safe drinking water for their family.

loans.name: Lab's Group

texts.en:
Lab’s group lived in a rural village in Pailin province in Cambodia. Lab works as farmer to support her family. 

In their village there is no reliable access to safe, clean drinking water. Having a water filter at home will help each of these women to safeguard the health of their families, save money on medical expenses and save time collecting fuel and boiling water.

loans.use: To buy a water filter to provide safe drinking water for their family.

loans.name: Pov's Group

texts.en:
Pov’s group live in a rural village in Kandal province in Cambodia. Pov makes a living cultivating rice and she also does extra work as a factory laborer and teacher to support her family.

In their village there is no reliable access to safe, clean drinking water. Having a water filter at home will help each of these women to safeguard the health of their families, save money on medical expenses and save time collecting fuel and boiling water.

loans.use: To buy a water filter to provide safe drinking water for their family.

loans.name: Sorphorn's Group

texts.en: Sorphorn’s group live in a rural village in Kandal province in Cambodia. Sorphorn makes a living cultivating rice and she also does extra work as tailor to support her family. In their village there is no reliable access to safe, clean drinking water. Having a water filter at home will help each of these women to safeguard the health of their families, save money on medical expenses, and save time collecting fuel and boiling water.

loans.use: to buy a water filter to provide safe drinking water for her family.

loans.name: Furaha Self Help Group

texts.en:
The person raising her hand in the photo is Mary, a member of Furaha self help group. She is 34 years old and a mother of four. She joined Hand in Hand Eastern Africa (HiH EA) in May 2014.

Mary does maize and bean farming. Mary is grateful to Hand in Hand Eastern Africa HiH EA for enterprise training. She is borrowing from Kiva to start to buy farm inputs such as fertilizers and seeds. This will increase her yields and therefore meet the demand of maize and beans in the area. She hopes to earn more income to enable her to educate her children and meet other family needs.

Mary is appreciative to Kiva and their lenders for their support. She promises to repay promptly.

loans.use: to buy farm inputs such as seeds and fertilizer to improve on yield.

loans.name: Duo Las Paz Group

texts.es:
Duo las Paz
Doña Elvira tiene cinco años de negociar, ella empezó su negocio vendiendo leña y ropa en las casas, era vendedora ambúlate, pero como su hijo se enfermo tuvo que dejar por un tiempo el negocio, ahora quiere agrandar un poco el negocio de la venta de tortilla por eso solicita su crédito esperando el apoyo que FAPE le ha brindado. Su mayor anhelo es poder seguir adelante para darles el mejor ejemplo a sus hijos agradece a Dios y su familia por el apoyo que le han bridado,esta solicitando este credito para la compra de maiz y leña para tortilleria.
texts.en:
Doña Elvira has five years of business experience. She began her business selling firewood and clothing in homes and she was a street vendor. However, her son fell ill and she had to leave her business for a while.

Now, Elvira wants to enlarge her business a bit and sell tortillas and for this reason, she is requesting a loan and waiting for the support that FAPE has offered her. Her greatest desire is to be able to get ahead in order set a good example for her children. Elvira thanks God and her family for the support they have given her.

She is requesting this loan for the purchase of corn and firewood for her tortilla business.

loans.use: to buy corn and firewood to make tortillas.

loans.name: Davlathonim

texts.en:
Davlathonim is an active woman. She was born in southern part of Tajikistan in 1963. She is married and has four children.  Davlathonim is a capable, goal-oriented, honest, and gentle person. 

For almost 15 years she has had a business of trading kid’s clothes. She imports clothes to her domestic market and sells them there. 

She is planning to enlarge her business and buy additional commodities like shoes for kids. She requests a loan to buy shoes and clothes for kids. She awaits Kiva lenders' mercy.

loans.use: To buy children's shoes and clothes to sell

loans.name: Julie

texts.en:
Julie is 49 years old and married with ten children. With six children in school, Julie works very hard to provide for them.

Julie runs a general store in the Philippines and requested a PHP 8,000 loan through NWTF to buy items to sell such as canned goods, eggs, home care products, etc.

Julie has been in this business for 25 years now. 

In the future, Julie would like to save enough money so that she can afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy items to sell such as canned goods, eggs, home care products, etc.

loans.name: Anas

texts.en:
Anas is 19 years old and single, and he lives in Irbid. 

He’s studying accounting in his second year for a bachelor's degree. 

Anas is seeking a loan so he can pay for his upcoming semester fees. The income from his dad’s job is not enough to spend on the house and on his three sons.  That's why Anas decided to ask for a loan to help him cover the university fees.

loans.use: to cover his university fees.

loans.name: Bahaa

texts.en:
Bahaa is 25 years old and single.  He lives in Irbid with his family, which consists from six members. He comes from a well-educated family. 

Bahaa is studying civil engineering in his fourth year for a bachelor degree. The income from his father’s retirement is not enough to cover all the family's  expenses.  Bahaa is hoping to get the loan to pay his semester fees and graduate.  

Then he will look for a good job with a good salary to help his big family with household expenses and be a successful engineer in the future.

loans.use: to pay his semester fees and graduate

loans.name: Carmelita

texts.en:
Carmelita is the loving mother of two children who now successfully work abroad. 

With her desire for helping her children to maintain their needs, she engaged herself in a retailing business while taking care of her grandchildren. Carmelita is selling variety of grocery items in their village. She has been in this business for twenty years. 

Carmelita wants to extend the products she is selling and that’s why she is asking for a loan of PHP 20,000. She will use the loan to buy diapers, powdered milk, coffee, sugar and condiments. 

Carmelita wishes to maintain and grow the business while she can manage it.

loans.use: to buy diapers, powdered milk, coffee, sugar and condiments

loans.name: Yolanda

texts.en:
Yolanda is the happy and proud mom of two children. Through her patience and hard work, Yolanda is able to send her children to school, and now both are professionals. 

Yolanda shares that she receives monthly financial support from her children, but she doesn’t want to rely only on them. Thus, she decided to manage a sari-sari store business in their village. Yolanda wants to increase her income and save some of it for her future. With this in mind, she needs to sell more items to earn more as well. Hence, she is requesting a loan of P20,000 to buy grocery items and rice grains to sell. She believes that by having more stock, she will sell more also and that can increase her income.

loans.use: to buy grocery items and rice grains to sell.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy fish balls, kikiam, hog dogs, eggs, chicken and pork to barbecue.

loans.name: Gina

texts.en:
Gina runs a sari-sari(variety) store. She sells various commodities ranging from noodles, canned goods, chips, eggs, cooking oil, soap and beverages. She is a 33 year-old-woman with seven-year old child. Her husband earns a living by driving a taxi. She lives in Talibon, Bohol.

She is asking for a loan to buy materials for the store like screen, nails and stock for the store. These will help Gina improved her income and creates variety of its stock. She will be able to cater the needs of her customers and also maintain good relations to her customers.

Gina is hoping that someday she will be able to finance the schooling of her child for a brighter future.

loans.use: to buy materials for the store like screens, nails and stock.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy a dairy cow so as to increase amount of milk supplied to customers and to increase income.

loans.name: Jovita

texts.en:
To make a living, Jovita owns and operates a general store in her village. She used her previous loans to improve her business and successfully repaid them. 

Supervising the business personally is not easy, but with the love and help of her family, Jovita has been able to continually improve it. 

Recently, Jovita took a new loan from GDMPC micro credit to purchase more grocery goods to sell. 

In the future, Jovita would like to expand her business to sustain the needs of her family.

loans.use: to purchase more grocery goods to sell

loans.name: Marcos

texts.en:
Marcos is a widower with two children. He is 61 years old and resides in Sumalig, Tambulig, Zamboanga del Sur. Marcos cultivates coconuts for sale for a living and he has been in this business for five years. Each month he earns 12,000 PHP doing this type of business.

He has requested a loan of 50,000 PHP to purchase additional seeds, seedlings and young crops to raise. Marcos has been a member of Kiva Field Partner, GDMPC, for four years. In the future, Marcos wants to save money for emergencies.

loans.use: to purchase additional seeds, seedlings and young crops to raise.

loans.name: Liza

texts.en:
Liza is 54 years old and widowed with three children.

She earns a living by raising pigs in the Philippines. Liza is borrowing PHP 7,000 through NWTF to buy feed and other supplies to raise her livestock.

Liza has been raising pigs for two years now.

Liza is working tirelessly toward the attainment of her dream, which is to save enough to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: to buy feed and other supplies to raise her livestock

loans.name: Lucia

texts.en:
Lucia is 59 years old and married with one child who is in school. She works very hard to provide for her family.

Lucia runs a general store in the Philippines and requested a PHP 6,000 loan through NWTF to buy items to sell like canned goods, eggs, home care  products, and other groceries.

Lucia has been in this business for one year now. 

In the future, Lucia would like to save enough to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: to buy items to sell like canned goods, eggs, home care products, and other groceries

loans.name: Reggie

texts.en:
Reggie is a married woman with five children, three of whom are currently in school. She is 42 years old and a very hardworking entrepreneur. 

Reggie has a food vending business in the Philippines. Reggie requested a PHP 12,000 loan amount through NWTF to buy ingredients such as sugar, flour, cooking oil and other ingredients.

Reggie has been in this business for 10 years. She would like to save enough money so that she can afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy ingredients such as sugar, flour, cooking oil and other ingredients

loans.name: Rowena

texts.en:
Rowena is married, with eight children. She is a very hardworking entrepreneur.  She is 48 years old and has two children who are in school.

Rowena has a business selling used shoes in the Philippines.  She has requested a PHP 8,000 loan through NWTF to purchase bundles of used shoes to sell.

Rowena has been in this business for two years. In the future, Rowena would like to save enough money so she can afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to purchase more stocks of used shoes to sell.

loans.name: Marciana

texts.en:
Marciana is 58 years old and married with one child. She earns a living by raising pigs in the Philippines. 

Marciana is borrowing PHP 5,000 through NWTF to buy feed and other supplies to raise her livestock. She has been raising pigs for two years and also earns additional income from food vending.

She is working tirelessly toward the attainment of her dream: to save enough to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: to buy feed and other supplies to raise her livestock

loans.name: Mary Jane

texts.en:
Mary Jane is a married woman with three children. She is a very hard working entrepreneur. Mary Jane is 37 years old and has two children who are in school.

Mary Jane has a selling used clothes business in the Philippines and requested a PHP 5000 loan amount through NWTF to purchase used clothes to sell.

Mary Jane has been in this business for 3 years. In the future, Mary Jane would like to save enough money so she could afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to purchase used clothes to sell

loans.name: Majeda

texts.en:
Majedah is a 48-year-old mother of three children and lives in Marka. She is a conservative woman and asked her daughter to take her place in the photo.

Majedah has an ambitious daughter named Mais, who wants to be someone important in the future. She is working hard to achieve all her dreams, the first of which is to get master degree, so after she finished her bachelor degree with excellent marks, she decided to complete her education and get the master degree. Now she is in her first year majoring archaeology and tourism, besides that she is working as a teacher in the same university because of her excellent marks.

Majedah, as all mothers, wants to provide anything to her children to make them happy, so she wanted to help her daughter in her educational journey. Therefore she decided to apply for an education loan to help her daughter Mais pay for her university fees and achieve her dreams.

loans.use: to help her daughter pay for her university fees and achieve her dreams.

loans.name: Fredys Antonio

texts.es:
Antonio, de 46 años de edad, está acompañada, estudio hasta bachillerato y tiene solamente 1 hijo de 20 años de edad.- Antonio, se levanta a las 5:00 a.m. junto a su esposa e hijo a iniciar las actividades agrícolas y a ordeñar las vacas.

Antonio,  junto a su esposa se dedican a la agricultura, este oficio lo aprendió de sus padres, trabaja durante la mañana en eso y su esposa se dedica a los oficios domésticos y él trabaja como motorista en la tarde.

Antonio, necesita el crédito para comprar una vaca, para incrementar la producción de leche.

Antonio, planea ahorrar de la venta de leche y de la siembra, para comprar un vehículo, porque el que maneja es alquilado y casi no tiene muchos ingresos, por que no es propio.
texts.en:
Antonio is 46 years old and has a domestic partner. He studied up to high school graduation and he has just one child who is 20 years old. Antonio gets up at 5:00 a.m. together with his wife and son to begin farming tasks and milk the cows.

Antonio and his wife make their living in agriculture. He learned this occupation from his parents. He works at this during the morning and his wife takes care of the household tasks. He also works as a driver in the afternoon.

Antonio needs a loan to buy a cow so as to increase his milk production. He plans to save from the milk sales and cultivation so that he can by a vehicle since he rents the one he drives now. As a result, he doesn't have much of an income because it's not his.

loans.use: to buy a cow.

loans.name: Simba Group

texts.en:
Mwajuma, who is in her mid 20s, is married with one child who is still at school. She has been a food vendor since 2012. She works from 6am to 5pm daily and is able to make a good monthly profit.

This will be Mwajuma's 2nd loan from Tujijenge Tanzania. She used the previous loan to restock the out of stock items in the food store and has paid back her loan successfully. She used her profit to pay school fees, loan repayment and covered household expenses. She will use this loan to increase her mamalishe business stock. (Mamalishe means "mother nutrition" and refers to open air food stalls). She dreams of owning a big business.

Mwajuma will share this loan with her loan group " SIMBA" which consists of two members who will hold each other accountable for paying back the loan.

loans.use: to increase mamalishe (food stall) business stock.

loans.name: Blas

texts.es:
El Sr. Blas tiene 29 años, es soltero, hace 8 años que se dedica a al escaneo de vehículos, y en la actualidad ya tiene muchos clientes. Además de ello también vende repuestos para vehículos.
Él es una persona muy trabajadora y emprendedora que quiere ir mejorando sus condiciones de vida, es por ello que se esfuerza mucho.
Pide este préstamo para poder comprar filtros de aceite, filtros de aire y filtros de combustible, aceites varios, etc.
texts.en:
Señor Blas is 29 years old and is single. For eight years, he has made a living in car maintenance and he now has many customers. In addition, he has sells car parts.

Blas is a very hardworking and entrepreneurial person who wants to continue improving his living conditions. For this reason, he makes a big effort. He is requesting this loan to be able to purchase oil filters, air filters, fuel filters, and various oils.

loans.use: to buy oil filters, air filters, fuel filters, and various oils, etc.

loans.name: Anonymous Group
loans.use: to buy lengths of brightly colored African print cloth (pagnes) for resale

loans.name: Zarhalmo

texts.en:
Zarhalmo is a generous woman. She is from southern part of Tajikistan and born in 1971. She is a Mother of the Heroine (this was an honor that used to be given to mothers of large families) and has six children. She has more than five years practice of planting agricultural products.

She plants onion, watermelon, crops, cereals, potato and etc. Recently, she plants agricultural products at rented land. She has good conditions for a good harvest. Zarhilmo plans to have her own agricultural section. She is asking for financial support to buy fertilizers and seeds. She awaits KIVA lenders mercy.

loans.use: To buy fertilizers and seeds

loans.name: Helen

texts.en:
Helen is a single woman with four children. She is a very hard working entrepreneur. Helen is 40 years old and has one child is still in school.

Helen has a hand-woven business in the Philippines. She requested a PHP 10000 loan amount through NWTF to buy pineapple fiber and other materials for her business.

Helen has been in this business for 2 years. She would like to save enough money so she could afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy piña fiber and other materials for her business

loans.name: Ophelia

texts.en:
Ophelia is 39 years old and married with five children. With four children in school, Ophelia works very hard to provide for them.

Ophelia runs a general store in the Philippines and requested a PHP 5000 loan through NWTF to buy items to sell like bread, home care products and other groceries.

Ophelia has been in this business for 2 years now.

In the future, Ophelia would like to save enough money so she could afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy items to sell like bread, home care products and other groceries.

loans.name: Santiaga

texts.en:
Santiaga works hard to support her family. She is married and has a fish vending business in the Philippines.

Santiaga requested a PHP 14000 loan through NWTF to buy more fish to sell to her customers. She has been in this business for 11 years now.

She would like to build and expand her business to secure the future of her family.

loans.use: to buy more fish to sell to her customers

loans.name: Moreen

texts.en: Moreen is 28 years old. She is single mother with a three year old child. The child is in nursery school in which they are obliged to pay the whole amount in one installment. Maureen is working but can't afford to pay all the money at one. She therefore needs a loan to pay for her three year old child's school fees as she pays Kiva in affordable installments.

loans.use: To pay school fees.

loans.name: Ernest

texts.en:
Ernest is 45 years old. He is married and has three children, one boy and two girls who are ages 16, 11, and 6 respectively. His wife works as a teacher. Ernest has one brother and three sisters whom he also helps support. Ernest has completed college and worked for the ministry of agriculture. 

Ernest has since started his own Zoona business in order to address the lack of financial services available to his community. There is no bank in Ernest’s town of Sinazongwe, so whenever anyone needed to access money they would have to travel to the next town, which would cost them money and time. 

Ernest is requesting a loan in order to pay for his trading booth and expand his Zoona business to other remote locations, providing them with much needed access to financial services. This would allow Ernest not only to further support his family financially but also meet the financial needs of other under-served communities.

loans.use: to pay for his trading booth and expand his Zoona business to other remote locations

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to pay for her trading booth and expand her business

loans.name: Anonymous Group
loans.use: to buy many planks to resell for a profit.

loans.name: Kelvin

texts.en:
Kelvin is 44 years old. He is married and has five children, whose ages range from five to 18 years old. Kelvin also provides support for his siblings. He completed secondary school and then started his own business called Jaluka Enterprises. Since then, Kelvin has started his own Zoona enterprise to provide his community with financial services. Before his business started, Kelvin’s community did not have access to financial services, as there are no banks or financial institutions. He states that his business has added value to the community because people no longer have to travel long distances to send and receive money. 

Kelvin is requesting a loan to expand his Zoona business to reach new unbanked customers by adding onto his working capital so that he can serve more customers. His loan will allow Kelvin to not only grow his business effectively but also further provide for his family.

loans.use: to expand his business to reach new unbanked customers

loans.name: Aaron

texts.en:
Aaron is 57 years old. He is married, and has seven children whose ages range from 32 to 18. In addition to his family, Aaron also helps support his siblings. 

Aaron has completed college and has a certificate in Tobacco Management. He has worked in the field of tobacco management and financing. 

Aaron has started his own Zoona mobile money transfer business in order to bring much needed financial services to his community. Before Aaron started this business, people in the community had to travel far distances in order to access banks or other financial institutions. Aaron specifically enjoys interacting and sharing ideas with his customers, and wants to provide them with the best possible service. 

Aaron is requesting a loan in order to increase the working capital of his Zoona business.  This would allow Aaron to be able to meet the demand for his services, and would mean he wouldn’t have to turn away customers. 

This loan would allow Aaron to grow his business, which would in turn allow him to increase his disposable income to provide for his family.

loans.use: To increase the funds he uses to serve his customers

loans.name: Kalezhi

texts.en:
Kalezhi is a happily married man with four children, and is the primary supporter for his family. He has completed secondary schooling, has worked as a contractor, and started his own Zoona business. Kalezhi’s goal is to help his community, specifically by addressing the problems that are faced due to the lack of access to banking and other financial services. 

Kalezhi’s Zoona business has helped many people by providing them with access to these financial services, which now means that they no longer have to travel long distances just to send or receive money. 

Kalezhi is requesting a loan in order to expand his business by increasing the money that he uses to serve customers on a daily basis. 

The increase in his working capital will help to provide his community and other communities with increased access to these financial services. 

This would allow him to grow his business while also meeting his goal of helping his community and providing for his family.

loans.use: To expand his business by increasing the money that he uses to serve customers on a daily basis

loans.name: Joshua

texts.en:
Joshua is 32 years old. He is married and has a child. He is the sole financial provider for his family. He has completed college with a certificate in enterprise and management. He has worked as a salesman and cashier before starting his own Zoona Mobile Money Transfer business. Joshua states that his Zoona business helps his community through access to financial services. He is a honest and hardworking man and hopes to grow his business and help other communities with lack of financial services. 

Joshua is requesting a loan in order to purchase a trading booth so that he does not keep paying rental at a shop; he also wants to expand his business by increasing his working float. 

This would allow Joshua to provide better service to his existing customers, as well as to grow his business to help other communities as well.

loans.use: To purchase a branded trading booth and grow his business by increasing the money that he uses to serve customers

loans.name: Sally

texts.en:
Sally, the lady appearing in the photograph, is thirty years old, married, and has five children. Sally’s economic activity is running a kiosk. She joined Hand in Hand Eastern Africa in August 2013, and she has received trainings on enterprise development and financial planning, which have equipped her with skills to effectively manage her enterprise.

She is borrowing from Kiva so that she can add stock of cosmetics such as perfumes and body lotion. She hopes the loan will help her boost her business; hence, increase her income to educate her children.

Sally is very grateful to Kiva and their lenders for the help and support.

loans.use: to buy more stock for her cosmetics business, and thus boost sales volume.

loans.name: Nkonde

texts.en:
Nkonde is 34 years old. She is married and has three children who are 2, 5, and 7 years old. She has completed secondary school and college and has worked in business since 2008. 

Nkonde started her own Zoona business in order to give people in her community access to financial services. She is requesting a loan in order to purchase a trading booth so that her business can be more visible. She will also use the loan to grow her business by adding onto her current float. 

Currently, Nkonde operates her business with a float of $1000, but this is not enough for her to satisfy her customer demand. Getting this Kiva loan would allow her to grant more people access to otherwise inaccessible financial services and meet the growing demand for mobile money transfer services. 

Nkonde will use the anticipated profits from her loan to improve her family's standard of living. She thanks the Kiva lenders.
