loans.use: To purchase a small trading booth and grow her business by increasing the money she uses to serve people who need to access financial services in her community

loans.name: Olipa

texts.en:
Olipa is 42 years old, married, and has four children who attend school. She has completed college and has a certificate in business studies. She has worked as an assistant inspector in Lusaka before starting her own Zoona business. Olipa’s business allows people in her community to easily send money to their children at boarding school and their relatives all over Zambia. Olipa has brought needed financial services to her community and people no longer need to travel into town in order to access these types of services. 

Olipa is requesting a loan, which she will use to pay for her trading booth where she operates her business and to increase her working capital so that she can expand her business. This loan will allow her to better serve her customers, as well as to increase her disposable income and further support her children’s education.

loans.use: to pay for her Zoona branded trading booth and increase the money that she uses to service her customers

loans.name: Pedro Antonio

texts.es:
Pedro tiene 55 años, está casado, tiene 3 hijos y tiene una nieta a su cargo. Terminó la escuela primaria. Su principal actividad económica es la agricultura, produce café certificado bajo los sellos Orgánico y Comercio Justo que vende en COCAFCAL  de la cual es socio.
Pedro quiere producir Chile dulce orgánico el cual venderá en  COCAFCAL. El Chile dulce (verde, rojo y amarillo) es un producto popular en la región, que ofrece excelentes beneficios a los productores. "Con la ayuda y el apoyo técnico de COCAFCAL la producción será un éxito", dice Pedro. COCAFCAL ya ha desarrollado el mercado local para los chiles y será capaz de comprar el 100% de la producción de Pedro, con sus ganancias pedro pretende comprar algunas cosas que hacen fata a sus hijos y nieta para tener una calidad de vida un poco mejor y para mejorar la educación de los miembros de la familia. 
Pedro ya ha preparado la tierra (ver foto) y ahora necesita un préstamo para comprar materiales para construir su invernadero. Él tendrá que pagar a los trabajadores temporales, comprar las plantas de chile, el sistema de riego por goteo, las bolsas de fibra de coco y la entrada orgánica para producir chiles hidropónicos. Con los beneficios de este proyecto el espera mejorar su calidad de vida familiar.
texts.en:
Pedro is 55 years old, he is married, he has 3 children and he has one grand daughter he is responsible for. He attended primary school. His main economic activity is agriculture, he produces certified coffee under fair trade and organic certification. He sells his coffee through COCAFCAL, the Coop he is member of.
Pedro wants to produce sweet organic chile which he will sell to COCAFCAL. Sweet chile (green, red and yellow) is a popular product in the region because it offers excellent advantages to producers. "Thanks to COCAFCAL´s technical support, production will be a success", Pedro said. COCAFCAL has already developed the local market for chiles and it will be able to buy 100% of Pedro´s production. With the profits Pedro earns, he wants to buy some products that his children and grand daughter need to enjoy a better quality of life and improve the education level of the members of his family.
Pedro has already prepared the land (look at the picture) and he now needs this loan to buy materials to build his greenhouse. 
He will have to pay for temporary workers, buy the chile plants, buy the drip irrigation system, buy coconut fibre bags and buy the organic entry to produce hydroponic chiles. With the profits Pedro earns from this project he wishes to improve the quality of life of his family.

loans.use: To buy the materials he needs to build an organic greenhouse

loans.name: Manuel Edgardo

texts.es:
Manuel es un agricultor casado de 64 años y con 7 hijos. Manuel se ha dedicado toda su vida a la producción de diferentes productos agrícolas como rábanos, repollos, tomates, pimientos, huevos, leche, café, etc.
El y su familia dependen netamente de los ingresos que la agricultura provee. 
Manuel está solicitando un préstamo para comprar materiales para la construcción de un invernadero en el que pretende sembrar tomate de manera hidropónica y producir tomates 100% orgánicos. El tomate es un producto que deja muy buenas ganancias en la región. La comercialización es fácil a través de la cooperativa COCAFCAL de la que es socio. Ya tiene avanzada parte de la construcción del invernadero y usará los fondos para comprar plántulas para sembrar, agroquímicos (orgánicos), fertilizantes (orgánicos), bolsas de fibra de coco,pagar trabajadores temporales así como comprar e instalar el sistema de riego por goteo. 
Un préstamo le daría la oportunidad a Manuel de mejorar la vida de su familia y darles una mejor educación a sus hijos.
texts.en:
Manuel is a 64 years old married farmer with 7 children. Manuel has dedicated all his life to the production of different agricultural products like radishes, headed cabbages, peppers, eggs, milk, coffee, etc.
He and his family basically depend on the income the agricultural activity provides them.
Manuel is asking for this loan to buy the materials he needs to build a greenhouse where he can sow tomatoes in an hydroponic way and have 100% organic tomatoes. Tomatoes are products that leave substantial profits in the region. Commercialization is easy through COCAFCAL, the cooperative he is member from. Manuel already has the construction in progress and he will use this money to buy plantulas to sow, agrochemicals (organic), fertilizers (organic), coconut fibre bags and a drip irrigation system and to pay for temporary labour force. This loan will give him the opportunity to improve his family´s quality of life and prive his children a better education.

loans.use: To buy the materials he needs to build an organic greenhouse

loans.name: Gulchehra

texts.ru: Гулчехре 50 лет. Она проживает в одном из населенных пунктов Республики Таджикистана под названием Шахритус. Она замужем и имеет троих детей. Ее дети находятся на заработках в Российской Федерации. Гулчехра около трех лет занимается животноводством. Ее муж рабочий строитель, его работа является сезонной и животноводческая деятельность является основным источником дохода. Гулчехра хочет расширить деятельность и вместе с мужем создать надежный и устойчивый бизнес. Благодаря кредиту она сможет купить несколько голов скотин и расширить деятельность.
texts.en: Gulchehra is 50 years old.  She lives in Shahrituz, one of the settlements of the Republic of Tajikistan.  She is married and she has three children.  Her children are currently working as migrant workers in the Russian Federation.  Gulchehra has been involved in animal husbandry for about three years.  Her husband works in construction; his work is seasonal. Animal husbandry is therefore the family's main source of income.  Gulchehra wants to increase her activity and create a reliable and sustainable business with her husband.  This loan will help her to buy a few head of cattle and expand her activity.

loans.use: to buy a few head of cattle and expand her activity.

loans.name: Elizabeth

texts.en:
Elizabeth is a married woman with eight children. She is a very hardworking entrepreneur. Elizabeth is 48 years old, and two of her children are still in school.

Elizabeth has a buy-and-sell seafood business in the Philippines. She requested a PHP 7,000 loan amount through NWTF to buy more crabs, shrimp, mussels, oysters, and other seafood products.

Elizabeth has been in this business for ten years. She would like to save enough money so she could afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy more crabs, shrimp, mussels, oysters, and other seafood products.

loans.name: Nino

texts.en:
Nino is a 51-year-old married woman from village Ruisi. She has husband and son, who are temporarily unemployed. Nino works at the local hospital as a nurse and gets a small income. She is a hard worker who supports her beloved husband in making their precious family's living and covering their increasing needs.

The family also earns a living with agricultural activity. Particularly, they cultivate a plot of land, where they harvest tomatoes and cabbage. They realize income from selling the agricultural products in the local market, which is the main source of the family's income. Nino requested financial support for making financial stability and increasing monthly income.

She received the credit in the framework of joint initiative of Kiva and Credo - Startup Program that gives rural poor people the chance to start or re-start businesses. Nino has been approved with the loan 2000 GEL, which she will use for purchasing equipments for making fruit cookies and stock of fruits and to sell locally.

The loan will greatly assist Nino, and she will be able to expand her business. Due to her kind and nice attitude toward clients, she has a big list of loyal customers. Nino will be very thankful for the loan.

loans.use: to make fruit cookies to sell locally.

loans.name: Adelisa

texts.en:
Adelisa is a married woman with six children. She is a very hardworking entrepreneur. Adelisa is 46 years old, and two of her children are in school.

Adelisa has a food vending business in the Philippines and requested a PHP 9,000 loan amount through NWTF to buy ingredients for her food production business.

Adelisa has been in this business for ten years. In the future, she would like to save enough money so she could afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy ingredients for her food production business.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy goats to sell.

loans.name: Sreang's Group

texts.en: Sreang, a farmer living in Prey Prorsorb district of Kratie province, is 49 years old. She is a mother of seven children, two of whom are dependent on her. She overcomes her family’s hardship by growing cassava, rice, sesame and vegetables. She has been involved in this business for 25 years and it earns her about 38,900 KHR per day. For Sreang, this is her first time with VisionFund (Kiva’s partner). She leads a group of four members to request a loan. As the group leader, she will spend her loan portion to buy fertilizer and seed to support her business. She hopes that she can earn more income to improve her family’s living conditions.

loans.use: to buy fertilizer and seed to support her business

loans.name: Abeer

texts.en:
Abeer is a conservative married woman so she asked her daughter Batool to take her place in the photo. Abeer is 45 years old, and lives in Rusaifeh. 

Abeer has a daughter named Batool, who is 19 years old now, and she is studying at the university in her first year majoring in accounting. Abeer wants to see her children become successful persons in the future, so she is fighting all obstacles faced to pay the education fees for her children.

Abeer is dreaming of the day when Batool will graduate, therefore she asked for an educational loan to help Batool pay for her semester fees.

loans.use: to help her daughter pay her semester fees.

loans.name: Kuña Aty Joahu Group

texts.es:
El grupo Kuña Aty Joahu está en su ciclo número 3 del programa de comité de mujeres, donde todas trabajan y se ayudan por salir adelante, través del esfuerzo y el trabajo continuo dentro del grupo.
La Sra. Isabel forma parte de este grupo, ella se destaca por ser una persona muy luchadora y trabajadora, que siempre participa activamente en las capacitaciones que viene haciendo.   Ella tiene un copetín y solicita  este préstamo para la compra de comestibles, bebidas, jugos y otros. Agradece por esta oportunidad que recibe de poder seguir creciendo.
texts.en:
The "Kuña Aty Joahu" group is in its 3rd cycle of the women's communal bank, where they all work and help each other get ahead through their efforts and continual work within the group.  

Isabel is part of this group.  She stands out because she is a very determined and hardworking person who always actively participates in the trainings that the group has been doing.  She has a small fast-food counter and she is requesting this loan for the purchase of food, drinks, juices and other things.  

She is grateful for this opportunity that she is receiving to be able to continue growing.

loans.use: to buy food, drinks, juices and other things.

loans.name: Mernalyn

texts.en:
Mernalyn is a 39-year-old mother who was gifted with five children. She owns and manages a small retail store within her locality to help her husband in gaining income. Due to the high cost of commodities and school fees, she aspires to improve her business more in order to earn a higher income.

Due to insufficient capital, she is asking for an additional PHP 9,000 to buy more stock of snack foods, candies, laundry soaps, canned goods, noodles, eggs, beverages, seasonings, and soft drinks to resell.

She is hoping that she will receive her loan request so she will be able to improve the business.

loans.use: to buy more stock of snack foods, candies, laundry soaps, canned goods, noodles, eggs, beverages, seasonings, and soft drinks to resell.

loans.name: Dúo Rosario De San Pedro Group

texts.es: Dúo Rosario de San Pedro Doña Mirna es la encargada de este grupo, tiene una venta de ropa variada para damas, caballeros y niños, y es vendedora de cosméticos como cremas, lociones, talcos, shampoo en general  desde hace 4 años.  Su tienda está ubicada en la carretera principal de su aldea y es muy conocida, amable y excelente vendedora.  Tiene 3 hijos y cuenta con el apoyo amoroso de su esposo. Su sueño es tener un local propio ya que esta arrendando donde tiene su venta.  Necesita comprar pantalones de lona, blusas de tela, para damas, caballeros y niños de diferentes precios y el dinero que tiene no es suficiente por tal motivo necesita un préstamo para no quedarle mal a sus clientes que ya le han hecho pedidos.
texts.en:
Doña Mirna is the leader of the Dúo Rosario de San Pedro group. She has a business selling a variety of clothing for women, men, and children. For 4 years she has also sold cosmetics like creams, lotions, talc, and shampoo in general. Her store is located on the main highway in her village. She is friendly, very well known, and an excellent saleswoman. She has three children and has the support of her loving husband.

Her dream is to own her own storefront since she is currently renting the place where she makes her sales. She needs to buy different priced jeans and cloth blouses for women, men, and children. The money that she has is not enough to do so. As a result she needs a loan so that she doesn't disappoint her customers that have already made orders.

loans.use: to buy clothing for resale

location.town: Aldea Vista Hermosa, San Pedro Sacatepequez

loans.name: Hellen

texts.en:
Hellen is 42 years old, married to Elijah and they are blessed with eight children. She has been practicing dairy farming for the last 10 years and earns 10,000 KES per month. 

Hellen has applied for her first loan of 25,000 KES from VisionFund Kenya to buy a dairy cow so as to increase milk supply and earn more income. She plans to use the anticipated profits to educate her children. Her future hopes and dreams are to be financially stable.

loans.use: To buy a dairy cow so as to increase milk supply for more income.

loans.name: Alice

texts.en:
Alice is a married woman with two children. She is a very hardworking entrepreneur. Alice is 23 years old, and one of her children is in school.

Alice has a fishing business in the Philippines and requested a PHP 6,000 loan amount through NWTF to buy fish nets and other materials needed for her business.

Alice has been in this business for two years. In the future, she would like to save enough to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: to buy fish nets and other materials needed for her business.

loans.name: Pridon

texts.en:
Pridon is a 38-year-old man, from Kutaisi city, who lives with his mother and sister. The main breadwinner in the family is Pridon, who works as a sales-man at the local auto shop and earns approximately 400 GEL. His mother is a sick-nurse, who earns an insignificant income monthly. The family finds it hard to satisfy their needs. So they live under poverty and require financial support to make another source of income. Pridon decided to start an auto repair business and needs money to purchase all the required tools. He will work at the nearby service station to generate additional income. He sought credit among local financial institutions, but his attempts were unsuccessful because of his poor living conditions. The startup program, that is a joint initiative between Kiva and Credo, enables poor people to get a loan for starting or re-starting businesses. His application was approved under the framework of this program to get a loan of 750 USD. 

With support of the Start Up program Pridon will get an opportunity to be involved in his own business and tackle his financial difficulties.

loans.use: To purchase tools and start an auto repair business.

loans.name: Bernadith

texts.en:
Bernadith is a married woman with five children. She is a very hard working entrepreneur. Bernadith is 42 years old and has five children who are in school.

Bernadith has a fishing  business in the Philippines and requested a PHP 23,000 loan amount through NWTF to buy fish nets and other supplies needed for her business.

Bernadith has been in this business for nine years. In the future, Bernadith would like to save enough money so she can afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy fish nets and other supplies needed for her business

loans.name: Buazhar

texts.ru: Буажар 56 лет, вдова, имеет 4 детей. Образование - среднее. Уже много лет она занимается полеводством. Благодаря ее непосильному труду и емкой работе, Буажар достигла больших успехов в развитии хозяйства и стала получать ежемесячную прибыль в сумме 15,000 сом (KGS). На сегодняшний день в хозяйстве Буажар имеется 0,48 Га земли,где она выращивает картофель и помидоры. По хозяйству помогают сын и невестка.  В целях дальнейшего развития своего хозяйства, она обратилась в Банк «Бай-Тушум» за кредитом в сумме 60,000 сом (KGS) на покупку семян картофеля, удобрений и овец для откорма. Она является лидером группы "Ынтымак", в которой кроме нее состоят еще 2 человека, всего их трое. Доходы от кредита Буажар планирует вложить в дальнейшее развитие бизнеса и постройку сарая для скота.
texts.en:
Buazhar is 56 years old, a widow, and she has four children.  She has a secondary education and has been involved in agriculture for many years already.  Thanks to her backbreaking work and labor, she has made great progress in the development of her farming business and she now makes a monthly income of 15,000 som (KGS).  She currently owns 0.48 hectare of land on which she grows potatoes and tomatoes.  Her son and daughter-in-law help her with the farm work.  

Eager to develop her farming business, Buazhar has turned to Bai Tushum Bank CJSC and requested a loan of 60,000 som (KGS) to buy potato seeds and fertilizers.  She also wants to buy one sheep for fattening.

Buazhar is the leader of the "Yntymak" group which comprises a total of three members.  She is planning to use the earnings from her loan to further grow her business and to build a barn for her livestock.

loans.use: to buy seeds and fertilizers in order to grow organic produce, and to buy a sheep.

loans.name: Emma

texts.en:
Emma is a married woman with four children. She is a very hard working entrepreneur. Emma is 48 years old and has two children who are in school.

Emma has a mat weaving business in the Philippines and requested a PHP 9000 loan amount through NWTF to buy more materials for her business.

Emma has been in this business for five years. In the future, Emma would like to save enough money so she can afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy more materials for her business

loans.name: Mohammad

texts.en:
Mohammad is a 22-year-old single man from Irbid city. He tried to work along side his study, but he could not find a suitable job. He is a student where he studies electrical engineering. He wants to complete his studies and find good job.

Mohammad has 5 siblings who cause for his family financial problems, and his father cannot cover the education expenses beside the household expenses.

Therefore, Mohammad applied for an education loan; this loan will help him to pay the university installments for this semester and will help him to pay for part of the books he needs.

loans.use: to pay the university installments for this semester and will help him to pay for part of the books he needs.

loans.name: Somloeurt's Group

texts.en: A mother of three children living in Kulen district of Preash Vihea province, Somloeurt is 42 years old. Two of her children are dependent on her and they are still studying at a high school. For her family condition, she grows rice and works as a construction worker. She has been involved in this business for 24 years. This is her second time with VisionFund (Kiva’s partner) and she has fully repaid her past loan. She leads the group of four to get a new loan. As the group leader, she will spend her loan portion to build a decent latrine for her family. She hopes that all of her family members are healthy.

loans.use: to build a decent latrine for her family

loans.name: Oeurt's Group

texts.en: A resident from Srey Snom district of Siem Reap province, Oeurt is 48 years old. She has five children, three of whom are dependent on her. For her living, she grows rice and raises a pig. With this current business, she can earn about 24,300KHR per day. For Oeurt, this is her second time with VisionFund (Kiva’s partner), as she has fully repaid her past loan. She leads the group of three members to get a new loan. As the group leader, she will spend her loan portion to buy pesticide, fertilizer, and seed to support her rice farm. She hopes that she can get more income to support all of her children to study.

loans.use: to buy pesticide, fertilizer, and seed to support her rice farm

location.town: Siem Reap Province, Srey Snom district

loans.name: Anonymous Group
loans.use: to purchase women's clothes and other goods for resale.

loans.name: Steven

texts.en:
Steven has been a client of UGAFODE Microfinance Ltd. for three cycles now. He is 37 years old, married to Dinnah, and has six children aged between 4 and 25 years. All are still in school.

He is is a farmer with a banana plantation, where he gets bananas to sell as well as for home consumption. He needs a loan to buy organic fertilizers to spread on his banana plantation so that he will increase the yields and therefore the income.

He thanks Kiva lenders through UGAFODE for the tremendous support. He is hardworking and resilient and looks forward to more support until he becomes financially stable.

loans.use: to buy organic fertilizers.

loans.name: San Expedito Group

texts.es:
El grupo llamado San Expedito; está en su ciclo número 2 del programa de comité de mujeres, donde todas trabajan y se ayudan por salir adelante. 
Una persona que se destaca es la Sra. Felicita, ella es casada y tiene 4 hijos, por quienes se esta esforzando para poder darles todo lo que ella no pudo tener. Comenta que tiene en su casa un pequeño kiosco donde vende comidas rápidas, bebidas y golosinas, a través del esfuerzo y el trabajo constante está saliendo adelante y también con la ayuda de su comité aprendiendo los comportamientos vitales de una mujer exitosa.
Ella solicita este préstamo para la compra de los ingredientes para la elaboración de las comidas, como ser verduras carnes y otros, como también para la compra de bebidas como gaseosas, jugos, cervezas entre otros.
texts.en:
The group named San Expedito is in its second cycle of the committee of women program, where they all work and help each other to succeed.

One of the members is named Sra. Felicita, who is married and has four children for who she is striving to give everything that she could not have. She says that she has a small kiosk in her house where she sells fast food, drinks and sweets. Through effort and hard work she is moving forward and with the help of her committee she is learning vital behaviors of a successful woman. 

She is asking for this loan to buy the ingredients to prepare meals, which can be meats and other vegetables, as well as for the purchase of drinks such as soft drinks, juices, beer and more.

loans.use: to buy ingredients for making meals, such as meat and other vegetables, as well as to buy drinks such as sodas, juices, beer and more.

loans.name: Pheap

texts.en: Pheap is 38 years old, a married woman with four children living in the Kampong Speu province in Cambodia. She makes Khmer sweet cakes to sell and she has been doing the business for over four years. Two of her children attend school. Her husband is a 38-year-old construction worker. Together, they can earn approximately $13 per day. Pheap would like to cultivate rice, so she has decided to take out a loan to buy farmland. With this loan, she will be able to have her own farmland for rice cultivation and earn rice crops for her family. In the future, she hopes to have enough finances to build a proper house and support her children to finish high school.

loans.use: to buy farmland to cultivate rice

loans.name: Julie Ann

texts.en: Due to financial hardship, Julie Ann aims to improve her business and generate a higher income to sustain the necessities of her family. She is 30 years old and has four children. She is reselling fish and vegetables in the public market to help her husband gain income. To further improve this business, she would like to avail an additional loan of 9,000 PHP to buy more stock of the said products to resell. Being a patient and hard-working mother, she believes that someday she will make more improvements in the business and generate a higher income.

loans.use: to buy more stock of fish and vegetables to sell.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to purchase chemicals for making detergents and any other shop items in bulk and increase her working capital.

loans.name: Mavzhuda

texts.ru: Мавжуде 45 лет. Она жена и мать. Ее муж рабочий строитель, а дети находятся на заработках в Российской Федерации. Мавжуда 7 лет своей жизни посвятила животноводческой деятельности. За столь время она набралась не малого опыта в этом бизнесе и решила расширить бизнес и добиться признания в этой области. Мавжуде на данный момент необходимы средства, чтобы приобрести еще пару голов скотин и корма для них. По этой причине она обратилась за кредитом. Поддержите Мавжуду.
texts.en:
Mavzhuda is 45 years old, married, and a mother.  Her husband works in construction and her children are making a living in the Russian Federation.  Mavzhuda has devoted seven years of her life to animal husbandry.  Over time she has acquired a good deal of experience in this field; she has therefore decided to expand her business and to achieve recognition in this area.

At the moment, Mavzhuda needs money to buy an additional two head of cattle as well as some fodder to feed them.  For this reason, she is taking a loan.  Please support her.

loans.use: to buy livestock and expand her activity.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy poultry.

loans.name: Esterlita

texts.en:
Esterlita is a married woman with twelve children. She is a very hard working entrepreneur. Esterlita is 47 years old and has four children who are in school.

Esterlita has a fishing business in the Philippines and requested a PHP 6000 loan amount through NWTF to buy fish nets and other materials needed for her business.

Esterlita has been in this business for two years. In the future, Esterlita would like to save enough money so she can afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy fish nets and other materials needed for her business

loans.name: Lilian

texts.en:
Lenders! The above picture presents to you Lilian, a very hardworking mother and ambitious go-getter who is 29 years of age and hails from the Chuka area of Kenya, a rural town on the slopes of the famous Mount Kenya. Together with her handsome husband, they support each other as a team and have been doing mixed farming for the past 20 years. Through all those years, she has been able to take care of her family and pay school fees for her children. 

Although this humble mum has been making profits, not everything has been “a bed of roses." She has been facing financial challenges and, because the Chuka area has a ready market for cereals, she is seeking a loan to buy cereals to be able to improve her income level. Lilian’s upbringing was challenging and she has been facing many economic problems, but this ever-smiling mum has been making great improvements. She believes that through your loan, she will be able to realize her goal of improving her living conditions and transforming her life. Through Juhudi Kilimo, Lilian has gone through training and is very honest and disciplined with finances. She hopes that through profits from her business, she will fully pay back the loan. Lilian is very visionary and hopes that through accumulated profits she will be able to open a large cereal selling shop that will boost her income and completely turn her life around.

loans.use: To buy cereals for resale

loans.name: Pheap's Group

texts.en: Pheap, 46, lives with her family members in the Snuol District of Kratie Province. She struggles for a living via growing cassava and red corn. This is her first time with VisionFund (Kiva’s partner). She leads her group of three members to get a loan. As the group leader, she will spend her loan portion on paying for labor fees and buying pesticides and fertilizer for her farmland. She hopes that she can improve her farmland to earn more income, and that she can update her lifestyle.

loans.use: to pay for labor fees and buy pesticides and fertilizer for her farmland.

loans.name: Hoeun's Group

texts.en:
A mother of two schoolchildren living in Kratie Province, Hoeun is 32 years old. For her living, she grows cassava as the single main source of income. She has been involved in this business for ages, and it earns her about 37,500 KHR per day. This is her third cycle with VisionFund (Kiva’s partner), and she has fully repaid back her past loans successfully. 

She leads a group of four to get a new loan. As the group leader, she will use her loan portion to buy fertilizer and seeds to support her cassava farm. She hopes that she can get more income to expand her farmland so that it is bigger than before.

loans.use: to buy fertilizer and seeds to support her cassava farm.

location.town: Kampong Cham province; Kroch Chhma district

loans.name: Dorotia

texts.en:
Dorotia is a new client with UGAFODE MICROFINANCE LTD,  She is 42 years old and married to Mr, Elinest.  They have six children between the ages of 5 to 23 years, all attending school.  She is a farmer with banana plantations and she has a small cereal business. She is a resident of Mutojo, Ntungamo. 

She has applied for a loan of Ugx.1,000,000 to be able to buy organic fertilizers  in order to improve and increase the yields of her banana plantation. She will use proceeds from the banana sales to repay the loan. She is proud to be associated with the Kiva lenders and dreams of a bright future for her children. She is hard working and honest.

loans.use: To buy organic fertuilizers

loans.name: Vanna's Group

texts.en: Vanna is 39 years old and lives in Bovel district of Battambang province. A married woman, Vanna has five children. Four of her children are dependent on her and still in school. For her family condition, she grows cassava on five hectares area and works as village chief. She has been involved in this business for 12 years and it earns her family about 38,700KHR per day. This is her fourth time with VisionFund (Kiva’s partner) and she has fully repaid her past loans. In this group of two members, she is the leader. She will spend the entire loan portion to buy seed, fertilizer and plow the field. She hopes that she can earn more money to support her children to attend university.

loans.use: to buy seed, fertilizer and plow the field

loans.name: Thoeurn's Group

texts.en: Thoeurn is a 48-year-old mother with five children.  She lives in Snuol district of Kratie province. Three of her children are dependent on her. For her family condition, she grows rice and cassava as the main source of income, and she been involved in this business for 15 years. For Thoeurn, this is her first time with VisionFund (Kiva’s partner).  She leads the group of four members to get a loan. As the group leader, she will spend her loan portion to plow the field and buy pesticide and fertilizer to support her farmland. She hopes that she can earn more money to improve her family’s living conditions.

loans.use: to plow the field and buy pesticide and fertilizer to support her farmland

loans.name: Net's Group

texts.en: A local resident living in Kratie province, Net is 35 years old and single. She earns income to support her living condition via cassava growing. She has been involved this business for ages and earns about 33,300 KHR per day. For Net, this is her fourth cycles with VisionFund (Kiva’s partner), and she has fully repaid her past loans. In a group of three, she is the group leader. She will spend her entire loan portion to buy seed and pay for plowing fees. She hopes that she can get more income to create a new business.

loans.use: To buy seed and pay for plowing fee.

location.town: Kampong Cham province; Kroch Chhma district

loans.name: Mphatso Group

texts.en:
Laika is 55 years old, and a mother of three. One child goes to school. She owns a grocery store, which she depends on for her main source of income. She has been running this business for almost a year now. 

She will use the loan to expand her business in order to increase her profits.  This will enable her to pay medical bills for her children and help her parents in the village. She plans to hire someone to help her in running the business and hopes to build a house for her family members.
  
She has a experienced a positive change since she started obtaining the loans as she is now able to pay school fees for her child.

loans.use: to buy assorted groceries

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to purchase clothing, shoes, and general merchandise.

loans.name: Jorge Daniel

texts.es:
El señor Jorge Daniel  43 años de edad es casado, tiene tres hijos  que depende de él   radica en la comunidad de san Lorenzo, valle al sur de Honduras, tiene casa propia  y se dedica desde hace 11 años  al negocio de  reparación de celulares, computadoras,  servicios de videos juegos, trabajos técnicos de electricidad entre otros, etc.
Don Jorge le repara los celulares a los, amigos, vecinos, familiares y personas que le conocen que visitan su negocio, el también trabaja haciendo instalaciones eléctricas en oficinas, casas, compañías don Jorge es una persona trabajadora con deseos de trabajar y salir adelante.
Don Jorge está solicitando el préstamo para la  compra de CDS para videos juegos y celulares con el apoyo de este crédito él pretende suplir  la necesidad de financiamiento, es su cuarto  crédito que solicita ha prisma.
Su sueño es mejorar su casa y su negocio.
 San Lorenzo, Honduras - Febrero del 2015.
texts.en:
Jorge Daniel, 43 years old, is married and has three children who depend on him.  He lives in the community of San Lorenzo, a valley in the south of Honduras.  He has his own house and for 11 years he has made a living in the business of repairing cellphones and computers, offering video game services and technical electrical work, among other things.

Jorge repairs cellphones for his friends, neighbors, relatives and people that know him that visit his business.  He also works doing electrical installations in offices, homes and businesses.  Jorge is a hardworking person with a desire to work and get ahead.

Jorge is requesting the loan for the purchase of video game discs and cellphones.  With the support of this loan he will try to meet his financial need.  This is his fourth loan with Prisma.  

His dream is to improve his house and his business.

San Lorenzo, Honduras, February, 2015.

loans.use: to buy video games and cell phones for his business.

loans.name: Maria Elena

texts.es: Maria de 58 años de edad vive en casa propia con su grupo familiar, ella  se dedica a la venta de antojitos y atol desde hace 10 años, con lo que obtiene de sus ventas logra solventar algunos gastos de su hogar, ella quiere mejorar su vivienda colocando piso cerámico y cambiando las puertas, pero con lo que obtiene de sus ventas no le alcanza para realizarlo por esa razón solicita un crédito para la compra de cerámica, cemento,  puertas y pago de mano de obra y así pueda vivir en lo limpio y seguros.
texts.en: Maria is 58 years old and lives in her own house with her family. She makes a living selling snacks and “atol” (warm cornflower drink). She has been doing this for 10 years and with the profit she makes she is able to cover some of her household expenses. She wants to improve her house by putting ceramic floor and changing the doors, but the earnings that she makes from the sales are not enough to do this. This is the reason she is asking for a loan, to buy ceramic, cement, doors and to pay for the manual labor. This will allow her to live safely and in cleanliness.

loans.use: to buy ceramic, cement, doors and to pay for manual labor.

loans.name: Zhuzhuna

texts.en:
Zhuzhuna is a 53 year-old housekeeper, who lives with her daughter in village Mukhrani. The family belongs to the subsistence-poor category, as they have no source of significant income apart from her daughter's small salary as a a waitress in a restaurant. According to above mentioned situation, Zhuzhuna lacks the access to capital markets and financial institutions to obtain credit for starting business, as they require stable income and business experience.  The Start Up program created by Kiva and Credo enabled her to get a loan of 1500 GEL and start dairy farming. She plans to purchase a cow and after that the family will start producing dairy products: cheese and yogurt for selling. They also use the milk products for family feeding. 
Zhuzhuna and her daughter will be thankful to all the lenders for helping them maintain their farming business.

loans.use: To purchase a milking cow and start dairy farming

loans.name: Erick

texts.en:
Erick is a 28 year-old man from Katito town which is found in Kisumu city within the western part of Kenya.  He supports two people in his family and has two children who are five and two years old respectively.

He sells firewood, a business he has been doing for the last three years, and generates a monthly income of KES. 20,000.  He is taking his first loan with VISION FUND KENYA, which he will use to purchase another hand cart for timber distribution.  He will use the anticipated income to plow back into the business and educate his kids.

His dream is to have a stable business.

loans.use: to purchase a hand cart for timber distribution.

loans.name: Buraziya

texts.ru: Буразия, 49 лет, замужем, мать 4 детей. У Буразии среднее образование, много лет занимается сельским хозяйством. В хозяйстве есть лошадь, 3 овцы, также земельный надел мерою 0,72 ГА, где она выращивает картофель, помидоры и кукурузу.  Супруг и дети с радостью помогают Буразии в ведении ее бизнеса. Есть все условия для содержания скота. Буразия обратилась в Банк «Бай –Тушум» за кредитом в сумме 80,000 сом (KGS) на покупку удобрений, семян картофеля, часть средств - на покупку овец. Буразия является одной из трех участниц группы "Ынтымак". Доходы от кредита Буразия планирует вложить в дальнейшее приумножение количества домашней скотины и хочет накопить на ремонт дома.
texts.en:
Buraziya is 49 years old, married, and the mother of four children.  She has a secondary education and she has been involved in agriculture for many years.  She has one horse and three sheep on her farm, and she also grows potatoes, tomatoes and corn on 0.72 hectare of land.  Her husband and children are happy to help her with the farm work.  

Buraziya has everything she needs to keep livestock.  She has turned to Bai Tushum Bank CJSC and requested a loan of 80,000 som (KGS) to buy fertilizers and potato seeds.  She will also use part of her loan to buy sheep.  Buraziya is one of the three members of the "Yntymak" group.  She is planning to use the earnings from her loan to further increase her livestock headcount and she wants to save money to renovate her house.

loans.use: to purchase some sheep, as well as potato seeds and fertilizers, in order to grow organic produce.

loans.name: El Surcador Group

texts.es:
La socia pertenece al banco comunal EL SURCADOR, él banco está ubicado en la comunidad de Pancarhuaylla distrito de Anta, provincia de Anta  y departamento de Cusco.
La socia Fortunata continua dedicándose al  negocio de crianza de animales menores, la socia es una persona responsable y empeñosa, la socia continua criando  a sus animalitos para luego venderlos a sus clientes que le solicitan, la socia es una persona responsable y empeñosa,a la vez la socia continua dedicandose a la agricultura, siendo de esta manera que la socia saca adelante a su familia.
La socia solicito el crédito para la compra de abono,fertilizantes entre otros.
Los socios de sienten agradecidos por el crédito otorgado y se comprometen a  cumplir con sus cuotas establecidas.
Al momento de tomar la foto una de las socias tapo parte de la cara de su compañera con su sombrero.
La persona que sale con la cara tapada no pertenece al banco comunal.
texts.en: The member belongs to the community bank EL SURCADOR. The bank is located in the Pancarhuaylla community, in the Anta district, province of Anta, department of Cusco. The member Fortunata continues to work growing small animals. The member is a responsible and hardworking person. She grows her small animals so that she can sell them to clients who ask for them. This member is responsible and persistent. She continues to work in agriculture, which is how she pulls her family ahead. She is asking for a loan to buy manure and fertilizers, among other items. The members are grateful for the loan provided and are committed to meet the established payment schedule. At the time when the picture was taken, one of the members hid part of the the face of her partner with her hat. The person whose face is blurred does not belong to the community bank.

loans.use: To buy manure and fertilizers, among other items.

loans.name: El Llanito Group

texts.es:
En una comunidad alejada donde es un poco difícil acceder por la falta de transporte, la agricultura es la fuente principal de empleo, los habitantes se dedican a la siembra, limpia, pizca y desgrane del maíz; parte de la cosecha la emplean para auto consumo y otra para comercializarla.

“El Llanito” es un grupo conformado por 8 hombres y mujeres muy responsables, entre ellos hay personas de la tercera edad, pero esto no es impedimento para que continúen con sus negocios. El nombre del grupo hace referencia al lugar donde vive la representante, punto de reunión para hacer sus pagos, donde hay un llanito "Todos los días se veían animales pastando y mujeres que cuidaban a sus pequeños mientras ellos jugaban fútbol" comenta la líder. Los integrantes y sus actividades son: María quien se dedica a la venta de pollo; Modesta quien tiene una cocina económica; Celia quien cría y vende vacas; José, Sandra, Berenice, Margarita venden borregos y Martha vende cerdos.

Sandra es la más joven, tiene 24 años de edad, y está casada con Giovani  quien se dedica a trabajar en la construcción, por el momento no tienen hijos porque esperan formar un patrimonio y estabilizarse para ofrecerles una mejor calidad de vida.

Hace  un año Sandra recibió su primer préstamo otorgado por VisionFund México e inició con la cría y venta de borregos. Ella comenzó desde cero pero el préstamo le posibilitó la adquisición de los animales. Hoy en día tiene solo 4 borregos por lo que quiere comprar más con su nuevo crédito. Los coyotes de la región son el principal desafío para la actividad de Sandra y puede perder fácilmente algunos animales. Para evitarlo siempre trata de reforzar el corral donde los mantiene. Además, Sandra aprovecha el campo de su comunidad y sale a pastorear sus borregos, de esta manera invierte tu tiempo de manera productiva y continúa construyendo el patrimonio para su familia.

*La fotografía fue tomada en el parque del municipio de los integrantes, Sandra está sentada  en el segundo escalón, viste suéter color morado y tenis negros.
texts.en:
In this far away community, that is hard to reach because of the lack of transportation, agriculture is the primary source of employment.  The residents works planting, cleaning, shucking and shelling corn.  They use part of the harvest for their own consumption, and the rest is sold.

"El Llanito" is a group made up of very responsible men and women.  Among them are elderly individuals, but that does not impede their ability to work in their businesses.  The name of the group makes reference to the area where the group's representative lives and where they meet to make their payments, a little flat area. "Everyday you could see animals grazing and women watching their children as they played soccer" says the groups leader.  The members and their jobs are: María, selling chickens; Modesta, restaurant; Celia, raising and selling cows; José, Sandra, Berenice, Margarita, selling sheep; and Martha, selling pigs.

Sandra is the youngest.  She is 24 years old and is married to Giovani who works in construction.  Currently, they do not have children but they hope to start saving and find stability so that she can offer their future children a better quality of life. A year ago, Sandra received her first loan through VisionFund Mexico, and started raising and selling sheep. She started with nothing but the loan allowed her to purchase animals.  Today, she only has four sheep but she hopes to purchase more with this new loan.  The coyotes in the region are the biggest challenge for Sandra as they can cause her to easily lose her animals.  In an effort to avoid this, she always tried to reinforce the pen that she keep her sheep in.  Sandra also takes advantage of the fields in her community and she takes her sheep out to graze.  This way, she uses her time productively so that she can continue to earn and save for her family.

The picture was taken in the town park.  Sandra is seated on the second step, she is wearing a purple sweater and black sneakers.

loans.use: purchase more sheep.

location.town: Ejido de palmillas San Felipe del Progreso

loans.name: Chris

texts.en:
Chris and his wife, Meghan, (pictured above on the right) are very passionate about the environment, particularly the ocean and the fish that call it home. Chris has a long history in the saltwater aquarium hobby, and he shares this passion for aquariums with Meghan. It was when the thrift store they owned together had to close because of the sale of the building that Chris decided to turn his passion for the environment and fish into a business. 

Planned to open next month, San Diego Reef Shop will be the one-stop shop for all saltwater aquarium needs. San Diego Reef Shop will sell a wide variety of healthy saltwater fish and coral from its 1,000+ gallon system. It will also offer thousands of different species, which will allow them to fill custom orders. The retail location is located in the La Mesa area of San Diego and will also have an online store.  

Parents of one, Chris and Meghan educate people about the proper care of fish and coral. 

They will use his Kiva loan to purchase new equipment for their retail location. He is excited to share his beautiful aquariums with customers for years to come. 

“I am very passionate about sustainability and the way that people treat animals,” Chris says. “We treat all our fish and plants here to promote their health so they can thrive.”

loans.use: to purchase new equipment for his saltwater fish and coral retail location

loans.name: Luzviminda

texts.en:
Luzviminda, 57, is a resident of Bacoor, Cavite, Philippines. She is married to Manolito, a driller, and has one child who is a high school student. She manages her own household while operating a business. She works to augment their income for their daily household needs and for the schooling of her child.

Luzviminda has a direct selling business. She sells Tupperware, undergarments, cosmetics and other products through the popular direct-selling brands like Avon. Dealers buy the products at a lower price than shown on the catalogue for the customers and sell the products at a profit. Her regular customers are her neighbors, friends, family, and the local community. She earns a minimum of PHP 2,500 in sales every week.

To help her sustain her business, she is requesting a PHP 12,000 loan, which she will use to buy beauty products, underwear, and Tupperware to meet the advanced orders of her regular customers. Filipinos prefer to buy these branded personal goods for their good quality and convenience. She is thanking God and you in advance for a good return of her investment and for the financial help that will be given her.

Luzviminda aims to grow her business to improve their quality of life. She prays for a happy and healthy family. She faithfully meets up every week with her *co-fellowship members to share stories of her work and to also draw strength and inspiration from the Word of God she studies.

* All CCT community partners / clients are organized into fellowship groups that meet on a weekly basis. A fellowship group is composed of 15 to 30 community partners. The fellowship groups gather each week to study the Word of God, build social capital, and pay microfinance loans.

loans.use: to pay for Tupperware, underwear, and beauty products to sell.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy supplies for her farming business.

loans.name: Yadira Del Carmen

texts.es:
Yadira es una persona que ha tenido que atravesar muchas adversidades en su vida, sin embargo siempre ha tenido la fortaleza para superarlas y salir adelante junto con sus hijos. 
Hace aproximadamente 6 años inició desesperadamente la búsqueda de una fuente de ingresos para su hogar. Fue así como inició la cría y venta de pollos, negocio que le ha venido generando ganancias con las cuales puede sostener los gastos de su hogar. 

Yadira busca que un préstamo le brinde la posibilidad de acceder a la compra de cuido para los pollos, adecuar el corral de sus pollos. Sabe que con la ayuda de la Corporación Interactuar puede lograrlo.

Yadira tiene la esperanza en que el préstamo le permita salir adelante con su negocio. Además, espera que su negocio crezca y genere mayores ingresos con los cuales les pueda ofrecer a sus hijos una mejor calidad de vida y mayores oportunidades de progreso. 

Con un préstamo que hagas hoy podrás mejorar la vida y el negocio de Yadira!
texts.en:
Yadira is a person who has had to go through a lot of adversity in her life, however she has always has the strength to overcome this and move forward together with her children.

About six years ago she began desperately searching for a source of income for her household. This was how she began to raise and sell chickens, a business that has generated profits for her with which she can cover her household expenses.

Yadira is looking to the loan to offer her the possibility of buying chicken food and adapting the chicken pen. She knows that with the help of Interactuar she can achieve this.

She has the hope that the loan will allow her to move forward with her business. In addition, she hopes that her business grows and generates better profits with which she can offer her children a better quality of life and better opportunities of progressing.

With a loan that you make today you can improve Yadira's life and business!

loans.use: to buy food for her chickens and adapt her chicken pen.

loans.name: Ana Beatriz

texts.es:
Ana, con su espíritu emprendedor y ganas de salir adelante inicio con un negocio de café internet en zona rural del municipio de Puerto Escondido. Con este negocio ayuda a muchas personas a acercarse un poco más a la tecnología que en muchos casos es imposible para muchos habitantes del campo Colombiano.
Ella solicita ayuda para para adquirir inventario en artículos de papelería para mejorar su prestación de servicio y poner a disposición de sus clientes todas la herramientas necesarias para mejorar sus procesos de aprendizaje y comunicación.
texts.en:
Ana, with her entrepreneurial spirit and desire to succeed begain an internet cafe business in the rural area of the municipality of Puerto Escondido. With this business she helps many people to get a little closer to technology, that in many cases is impossible for many of the inhabitants of the Columbian countryside.

She is asking for help to aquire inventory of stationery to improve her service provision and offer her customers all the tools necessary to improve their learning and communication processes.

loans.use: to aquire an inventory of stationery items.

loans.name: Luis Alfaro

texts.es:
Luis es un hombre de 50 años de edad la cual se desempeña como padre amoroso y como agricultor, día a día intenta mejorar las condiciones de su familia.
Es por esta razón que requiere un crédito para la compra de insumos agrícolas como abonos, pesticidas, riegos, entre otros para aplicarlos a sus tierras.

Su principal sueño es poder generar buenos ingresos para no ver pasar a su familia ninguna necesidad pues es algo que vivió y que lo afecto de gran manera por esta razón trabaja incansablemente por sus hijos y su esposa.

Apoya a un campesino del campo Colombiano con grandes sueños para su familia!
texts.en:
Luis is a 50 year old man, loving father and a farmer who day by day tries to improve the living conditions for his family.

For this reason he would like to receive a loan to purchase agricultural supplies such as fertilizers, pesticides, irrigation, among others, for his land. His main dream is to be able to generate good revenue because he does not want to see his family in need. This is something he already lived through and it affected him greatly. For this reason he works non-stop for his children and for his wife.

Support a farmer from the Colombian fields with big dreams for his family.

loans.use: to purchase agricultural supplies, such as fertilizers, pesticides, irrigation, among others, for his land.
